11545.description: AHRC Nassau is committed to enriching the lives of the people whom we serve. With that in mind we have reached out to those people to see how volunteers might help them to live more independent and fulfilling lives. This is the first in an ongoing series where you will be given the chance to work one on one with someone served by this agency. Meet Ken! Ken lives in Uniondale and likes biking and taking walks. He also loves music and comedians. Ken would love to spend time with you walking around his neighborhood, listening to music and talking about some of his favorite comedians. He'd love to share some of his favorite jokes with you and learn some new ones as well. Applicants interested in this opportunity will have to meet the following requirements: Online application Orientation training Tuberculosis Screening Background check and fingerprinting For more information please contact Justin McDannell at 516-626-1000 x1303 or jmcdannell@ahrc.org. To apply today please go to www.ahrc.volunteerhub.com.
11545.title: Someone Wants to Meet You prt 1

11545.description: Volunteer in the evenings during the week or during the day on Saturdays at one of nearly 80 group homes throughout both Nassau and Suffolk Counties. Our Residential Volunteers: work either one on one or in small groups engaging people in meaningful activities meaningful activities include art, music, reading, fitness or simply providing companionship there is also a need for help planning special events such as birthday or holiday parties Allow your skills, passion and interests create experiences that will help people to increase their independence and confidence. Required screenings include: online application orientation training tuberculosis screening background check and fingerprinting All screenings are paid for and arranged by the agency. For more information please contact the volunteer coordinator at jmcdannell@ahrc.org or 516-626-1075 ext. 1303. To apply today go to www.ahrc.volunteerhub.com.
11545.title: Volunteer at one of our Group Homes

11545.description: The agencies ComeUnity Recreation and Sports programs is always looking for enthusiastic and active volunteers to assist with one of many ongoing opportunities. Year round ComeUnity Recreation hosts bowling nights and the walking club. From September through June there are recreation nights twice a week, dances three times a month, the social exchange group and other trips and outings. We have multiple sports teams that practice and compete throughout the year including Basketball, Track & Field, Softball and Skiing. Help us to ensure that the people that we support are able to maintain an active lifestyle in a fun, relaxed and welcoming environment. Requirements: Must be at least 16 Online application Orientation Training For more information feel free to contact Justin McDannell at 516-626-1000 x 1303 or jmcdannell@ahrc.org. To apply today go to www.ahrc.volunteerhub.com.
11545.title: ComeUnity Recreation

06897.description: Volunteers Needed for the American Cancer Society 2017-2018 Relay For Life of Wilton to Help Save Lives The American Cancer Society Relay of Life of Wilton is seeking local volunteers that are passionate, energetic, movers and shakers to become a part of our Event Leadership Team! This team plans and executes the Relay For Life of Newtown. From event logistics, recruiting teams to join us on the track, marketing the event, planning our cancer survivor reception, creating and facilitating event ceremonies, scheduling entertainment and activities - these are just a few of the many opportunities and responsibilities taken on by our team of dedicated volunteers aimed at eliminating cancer once and for all! It only takes a LITTLE time and a BIG heart! We are looking for help with ... Food & Beverage Outreach & Coordination prior to and the day of Relay Sponsorship Outreach prior to the day of Relay Survivor Reception prior to and the day of Relay Community Outreach prior to the day of Relay Day of Volunteers Set Up Clean Up Assist in Overseeing Activities/ Entertainment & Logistical mattersduring the day Volunteers are the backbone of this movement, and you can be part of it right here in Wilton. The Relay For Life movement is the world’s largest fundraising event to save lives from cancer. Uniting communities across the globe, we celebrate people who have battled cancer, remember loved ones lost, and take action for lifesaving change. Funds raised help the American Cancer Society provide free information and support for people facing the disease today, and fund cancer research that will help protect future generations. During Relay For Life events, members of each team take turns walking or running around the track or path. Teams participate in fundraising in the months leading up to the event. Any interested community members who would like to join the Relay For Life movement as a volunteer, team or participant should visit www.RelayForLIfe.org/WiltonCT and or contact ACS Staff Partner, Grace Scinto ( grace.scinto@cancer.org) directly.
06897.title: Volunteers needed for the American Cancer Society Relay For Life of Wilton 2017-2018!

06897.description: Our volunteers fill two critical rolls in helping seniors in Wilton: 1. Providing local transportation for those who do not drive - in getting to medical appointments, grocery shopping, social events, and any other activity. 2. Provide simple homes fix-ups that do not require a proefessional such as changing light bulbs and getting computers working. In addition, we can use adminsitrative help for our operation: Fund Raising Membership Acquisition
06897.title: Supporting the needs of members of Staying at Home in Wilton
06897.org: Stay at Home in Wilton, Inc.

10703.description: Communicate Knowledge INC is 501(c)3 non for profit organization whose aim is to democratize access to science. We provide world’s leading classes on Robotics, Math, Big Data and 3D design for children and college students. Our classes are designed in an intuitive way of teaching Digital and Applied science. We strive to teach kids how to create and solve math problems in no failure way, make Robotics/3D easy to construct and exploit, organize team work, and sharpen leadership skills. Dates: September 25th - December 1, 2017 Scheduled Dates: 4.30 am-7.00 pm every day spots available. Evening or weekend training of Robotics, Coding and Singapore Math for additional 2 hours will be provided will be scheduled according to the personal preferences of the employees. All our staff with our students help out with games and camp events and serve as teachers/mentors/counselors. Please, be aware, that we strive to create and promote an atmosphere of the safe, coherent and careful place to stay and learn for our children, and employees/volunteers, and we must take measures to fulfill it. REQUIREMENTS AND WORK DESCRIPTION Teachers/Counselors/Volunteers are expected to: - teach and/or organize, interact, assist with the teamwork of 6-14 students in classes and during the breaks; - teach according to daily lessons curriculum, provide instructional support and use our creativity tools to create their own tasks if they feel confident and capable; - follow up the strategies that were proposed or develop their own that can be implemented when got approved by the leadership of Communicate Knowledge INC. - Provide feedback to students’ parents after the day stay, - be agile in various methods of engaging students into a teamwork and make recommendations for students as they move through the program. - Do you best to think and generate new and better ways to do things, drawing on what they've seen, read, and experienced, who replace \"I can't do that\" with \"Let's make it happen!\". - look for the opportunities and foster students with a passion for entrepreneurship who might be capable of helping lead their startups with an additional compensation of any positive initiatives proposed and executed. According to personal circumstances some compensations could be provided. Please, email information about you to: knowledgeexcels@gmail.com
10703.title: Intern, teacher or volunteer in Robotics, Math, Big Data, 3D classes

10703.description: Simply by using your vehicle you can save animals - Volunteer your time to transport animals along what is called a \"Rescue Relay Transport\". Each week there are hundreds of animal rescue transports taking place where animals are moved from high-kill shelters to no-kill shelters and rescue organizations, as well as foster homes and adopters. It's easy for you to get involved and help save more animals simply by driving a leg in this relay. How it works: Click the I WANT TO HELP button. When an animal rescue organization posts a transport request, we will search to see if it matches your profile (if you're available and within the distance) and then send you an e-mail. Then you simply click on the leg that you can cover and everyone else will see that you've signed up for that leg. You'll get communications from the transport coordinator and, once the transport is a \"go\", you simply drive to the meeting place, load up the animals, and drive them to the next meeting place to hand them off to the next volunteer. You'll get plenty of doggy kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. There are videos that walk you through the process and give you tips and tricks on how to do transport. It's simple - and we need volunteers across the country, so share with your friends and help save an animal today!
10703.title: Drive a leg – Save a life! - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: Loaning an animal your couch can save their life! - Every 16 seconds an animal is euthanized simply due to overpopulation.Shelters do not have unlimited space and unfortunately have to make room.Rescue groups do not have the facilities and rely on fosters to help.Simply by agreeing to foster you can save an animal’s life. How it works: 1.Click the I WANT TO HELP button 2.We’ll help match you up when there’s a need for a foster home.
10703.title: Let me crash on your couch… please? - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: Pilots to the Rescue is seeking active and inactive pilots to help save animals. Even if you lost your medical, are not able to be PIC, or just can't afford to fly regularly, we need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals to safety but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Pilots to the Rescue is partnering with Doobert to manage these transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances it’s more ideal to have pilots involved, but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll send you information to get up to speed on being a volunteer pilot, or training videos to be a coordinator. If you're interested in being a coordinator we'll get you connected with a Rescue or Shelter to plan the transports. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10703.title: Punch holes in the sky & save animals! - Pilots Wanted! - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: We need animal rescue transport coordinators to help organize rescue transports. So whether you are retired, not able to travel, or just looking for a way to save animals, we need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go, but we need volunteer transport coordinators to help set up and manage the trip. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport request, we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their transport. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10703.title: Do you have a computer and a phone?  You can save animals! - Yonkers, NY

10703.description: We need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. So whether you are a current pilot, retired pilot or you lost your medical, we still need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances, it’s more ideal to have pilots involved but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport flight request we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their flight. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10703.title: Are you a pilot?  Then you can save animals! - Yonkers, NY

10701.description: Neighbors Link is recruiting volunteers for our Parent Child Together Program occuring at our Yonkers Site. Thank you for your interest in volunteering in our Parent Child Together program. Parent Child Together provides parents with peer to peer learning opportunities with a focus on positive parenting skills, early childhood development and school readiness. While the parents learn, the children participate in activities within the classroom covering shapes, colors, numbers, letters, pre literacy concepts as well as helping them gain the social emotional and self regulation skills needed prior to entering Kindergarten. This is a 2 hour program in which the first hour the parents and children work separately and at this point, staff and volunteers help the children with separation and also carrying out the activities for the hour. In the second hour, parents and children come together for activities and the role of the staff and volunteers at this point, is to model techniques for struggling parents and assist when a parent has more than one child in the program.
10701.title: Parent Child Together program volunteer

10701.description: Neighbors Link is recruiting volunteers for our Parent Child Together Program occuring at our Yonkers Site. Thank you for your interest in volunteering in our Parent Child Together program. Parent Child Together provides parents with peer to peer learning opportunities with a focus on positive parenting skills, early childhood development and school readiness. While the parents learn, the children participate in activities within the classroom covering shapes, colors, numbers, letters, pre literacy concepts as well as helping them gain the social emotional and self regulation skills needed prior to entering Kindergarten. This is a 2 hour program in which the first hour the parents and children work separately and at this point, staff and volunteers help the children with separation and also carrying out the activities for the hour. In the second hour, parents and children come together for activities and the role of the staff and volunteers at this point, is to model techniques for struggling parents and assist when a parent has more than one child in the program.
10701.title: Parent Child Together program volunteer

10701.description: Neighbors Link is recruiting volunteers to participate in our ESL (English as a Second Language) tutoring program. The program is on Thursdays from 10-11:30 at our site in Yonkers. 320 Walnut Street, Yonkers.
10701.title: ESL  Volunteers

10701.description: We are hosting a Medicare Scams & Abuse Training for people interested in becoming a Certified Senior Medicare Patrol Instructor! Medicare is a very complex health insurance program, which makes it prone to fraud & scams! This free training will teach: Foundations of Medicare Differences between healthcare Errors, Abuse, & Fraud Common & recent Medicare scams & fraud schemes How to protect yourself & your Medicare Ways to get involved after becoming a Certified Senior Medicare Patrol Instructor! Volunteer Instructors lead workshops on Medicare fraud & Healthcare scams around Westchester! For more information, contact Victoria 212-398-6565 ext 235 or vthornton@liveon-ny.org Mission: The New York Senior Medicare Patrol works to empower seniors so that they can protect themselves against healthcare fraud, learn to detect errors on their medical statements and report Medicare abuse when suspected.
10701.title: Medicare Scams & Abuse Training

10701.description: Mentor wil develop supportive, consistent mentoring relationship with a child through recreational play and paraprofessional therapeutic techniques. Help children explore and cope with social and/or family struggles. The Reach & Rise program has changes the lives of many young people in Yonkers. We want to continue that trend, but we can not do it without your help. Come and bring a revolutionary change to Yonkers youth and become a mentor today.
10701.title: Volunteer Mentor

10701.description: The NY Senior Medicare Patrol (SMP) works empower seniors so that they can protect themselves against healthcare fraud, learn to detect errors on their medical statements and report Medicare abuse when suspected. With so many scams targeting seniors, volunteers have the unique opportunity to help stop healthcare fraud at the source! The NY Senior Medicare Patrol hosts sessions to teach seniors a variety of tips to ensure their healthcare benefits are safe & personal information is secure from scammers. What would a volunteer do? Senior Medicare Patrol volunteers will give education sessions to various audiences of Medicare beneficiaries, & caregivers about Medicare & Medicaid fraud/abuse. Sessions are hosted all throughout Westchester county. No prior healthcare education? No problem! New York Senior Medicare Patrol will provide comprehensive training to interested volunteers. 2018 Upcoming Training: Wednesday, February 7 & Thursday, February 8 at Riverfront Public Library. Register NOW! Contact Victoria Thornton, Volunteer Coordinator for more information! 212-398-6565 ext 235 , vthornton@liveon-ny.org
10701.title: Teach Seniors in Westchester!

10701.description: About Are you interested in a field that works closely with individuals who have intellectual and developmental disabilities? Would you like to share your interests with someone who enjoys it just as much as you? Partners Health Plan, a not for profit health plan that supports the lives of individuals with developmental and intellectual disabilities, is looking for volunteers for The PAL Program. The PAL Program discovers a member’s passion, interests, and matches up the individual with a person or place in the community sharing a similar passion or interest. We discover what you enjoy and how it could potentially match with a member of PHP. Member Information 40 year old male who would like to go to the movies, fun zone, etc. in Yonkers, and enjoys 80's freestyle music. He has a mild intellectual disability, and is a very vibrant sweet guy! How does it work? Meet with individual once a week, or once bi-weekly depending on schedule flexibility First outing will always be accompanied by Community Resource Coordinator Provide your own transportation to meet the individual at the destination Report to community resource coordinator with updates on the progress of outings Form natural friendship with individual based on similar interests Benefits Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of program Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers Hours: Approximately one a week depending on the activity and volunteer schedule Suggested Commitment: 6 months - 1 year PHP provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10701.title: PAL near Yonkers

10701.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
10701.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Westchester County NY

10701.description: Are you bi-lingual? Do you love to work with high school students? This program is for you. We need bi-lingual mentors (English/Spanish, English/Portuguese, English/Bengali) for our Introduction to America program. If you can commit to one hour once a week in Yonkers we will pair you up with a newly arrived teenage immigrant. Volunteers meet with their students once or twice a week, accompany them to their ESL class and help them with their converstational skills. This is an opportunity you don't want to miss - changing the life of a young immigrant by helping him succeed in school and a new culture.
10701.title: Bi-Lingual Mentor

10701.description: Have you ever wanted to help a young child with their homework and be a mentor? Look no further. Become a mentor and help elementary aged public school students with their homework and literacy skills in our Reading Buddies After School program. Studies show homework is important in reinforcing skills learned in class and just as important is a quiet, nurturing environment in which to work. The Reading Buddies After School Program pairs elementary school children with volunteer mentors who help students organize and understand their homework while showing them how to complete their assignments in a timely, organized manner. Just as beneficial is the strong relationship that is fostered between a student and his or her mentor. All it takes is one hour a week and a commitment to the school year, to make a difference in the lives of these children and their families. We train you on how to be an effective mentor by offering you monthly workshops on various topics throughout the school year. Mentors are matched with students in White Plains and Yonkers elementary schools. As this is an after school program, it is a perfect match for high school and college students to be involved in a community service as well as anyone who wants to help improve a child's literacy skills. Come join us, not only will you help with a child's academic skills, you'll also develop a close bond with a child in need.
10701.title: Reading Buddies After School

10701.description: SMART ( Students and Mature Adults Read Together) is an intergenerational literacy program, that brings adult volunteers into local schools to help students who are reading below grade level. Because the SMART program has been so successful, we are expanding and need motivated mentors between the ages of 18-99 to become volunteers. All you need is 1-2 hours a week throughout the school year. SMART operates in over 25 schools in the Yonkers, Elmsford, Greenburgh and Mount Vernon school districts. Some students need extra attention that the schools cannot provide. This is where you can make a difference. Become a trained SMART volunteer and work with students in the school setting during school hours. SMART makes it possible for students who need extra help to succeed. Volunteer mentors work one-on-one throughout the school year, building relationships while helping students with their schoolwork. Our mentors have a lifetime of experience they can share with their students and act as positive role models. This is your opportunity to help those in need build skills and confidence to help them succeed in school and beyond. In turn, we guarantee you'll be enriching yourself and making a difference in your community. An hour or two a week is all you have to give. Come join us in this life changing experience. .
10701.title: SMART Mentor

10706.description: Small, grassroots organization in lower Westchester seeks volunteer to help with administrative and clerical tasks. You are hyper-organized, a good writer and eager to make a difference. We are located in lower Westchester. Expert computer skills a plus.... 8-10 hours per week. Visit our web site for detailed info about our work: www.family-to-family.org Please send resume to: pkoner@family-to-family.org
10706.title: Volunteer Needed for Grassroots Hunger Relief Non-Profit!

10706.description: You can help save the lives of premature infants! Help us do this by answering phones, screening potential milk donors, checking in milk donations, assisting with processing of milk, delivering milk, running errands, and helping with administrative tasks. We are a small operation and our staff and volunteers must be able to do many tasks. This is a terrfic opportunity for high school seniors and college students to gain community service hours, for nursing or health related students to gain community hours. If you have between two and five hours to spare once a week, please contact us!
10706.title: Save the life of a premature infant, help us answer phones and deliver milk!
10706.org: THE NEW YORK MILK BANK INC

10706.description: Family-to-Family, a national hunger and poverty relief organization with headquaters in lower Westchester seeks a volunteer with grant writing and research skills.
10706.title: Grant Writer/Researcher needed for hunger relief non-profit.

10706.description: VOLUNTEER needed for POVERTY Relief Organization - Help Family-to-Family expand it's Birthday Giving Project - a program that provides the \"fixings\" for a Birthday Celebration for a child in need. We link donors who make the Birthday Boxes up with organizations that work with impoverished families. We are looking for volunteers to help us with these match-ups. We are located in lower Westchester. Expert computer skills a plus.... 5-10 hours per week. Visit our web site for detailed info about our work: www.family-to-family.org https://www.family-to-family.org/hands-on-giving/birthday-giving-project/ Please send resume to: pkoner@family-to-family.org
10706.title: THE BIRTHDAY GIVING PROJECT - VOLUNTEER NEEDED

07631.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE NOTE: The family is only looking for FEMALE volunteers. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
07631.title: Englewood, NJ: Autism Volunteer

11385.description: looking for 2 or 3 young adult volunteers with grade school knowledge and kid friendly to assist us with our Homework Club After School Program our children in this program range from Kindergarten to Fourth grade, our program runs Monday thru Friday from 2:30pm to 6pm.
11385.title: Homework Club Program
11385.org: the salvation army ridgewood citadel corps

11385.description: we are looking for volunteers to assist in our homework club program we pick up the children 1st to 3rd grade from the public school P.S. 88 which is right up the block from the center, we bring them back to the center give the children a snack and then we start assisting them with the homework for about an hour we also do reading time arts and crafts and paly time until the parents pick up the children.
11385.title: Ridgewood Citadel Corps
11385.org: the salvation army ridgewood citadel corps

11004.description: ProjectArt is in desperate need of anyone who is available over the next three weeks (now- September 1st) to assemble one cabinet in each of ProjectArt's 10 libraries! These cabinets will house each program's art supplies and will be a small but essential aspect of the free art classes we offer to youth. The cabinets are super simple to put together and just require a screw driver and about two pairs of hands. Here is a video for what assembly would look like: youtube.com/watch?v=y_WVyaFuvGw. I would say about two volunteers per library is all we would need to put cabinets together! In general if anyone is available during weekdays or Saturdays between 10am and 6:30pm, we could really use some help. Some libraries are open till 8pm depending on the day. Please let me know if any of you are available this month!
11004.title: Assemble a Cabinet @ Glen Oaks Queens Public Library

11004.description: We are looking for assistance to help patients find their way at our Ambulatory Pavilion at Zucker Hillside Hospital, our mental health facility. You will work near the registration area greeting and giving directions ( easy building to learn!) This is a great assignment for anyone looking to give back and help our patients! You will also gain experience in this setting...
11004.title: Volunteer Ambassador at Zucker Hillside Hospital

06807.description: Organized, energetic, creative and detail-oriented person interested in helping execute our much loved 24th Annual Garden Party at the Riverside Yacht Club, Riverside CT. Responsibilities include: *Assist Development Director & Marketing Coordinator in the execution and management of the silent auction, including the solicitation of auction items, managing spreadsheets, creating bid sheets and displays for the event. *Assist in the soliciting of local businesses for underwriting and sponsorship pledges. *Manage and help with mailings such as save-the-date and formal invitations. *Manage relationships with vendors, including caterer, party rental, liquor vendors and venue. *Help stage event venue for over 250 guests. Help assist with the management of promotional and event materials such as props and backdrops. *Assist with event ticket sales. *Work with public relations and social media to promote event *Answer logistical questions and help create invitation lists based on sponsorships, ticket sales and such.
06807.title: Development/Special Events Coordinator

06807.description: SafeTalk is a prevention program of Kids in Crisis that incorporates the Child Assault Prevention Program (CAPP) curriculum, an international program that began in 1978. CAPP is under the auspices of the International Assault Prevention Center (ICAO) and is currently implemented in 32 states and 10 other countries. An interactive, age appropriate empowerment program for children, grades 1-5, SafeTalk teaches children how to recognize and respond to potentially dangerous situations and empowers them with the skills needed to keep themselves safe. Key strategies reviewed include self-assertion, saying \"No,\" peer support and asking a trusted adult for help. We are looking for volunteers to role play during a one hour presentation led by two to three presenters. Children are then given the opportunity to talk privately with SafeTalk presenters. They are able to share stories and ask questions about the program.
06807.title: SafeTalk presentations for elementary school kids

07307.description: St. Lucy’s Shelter is a supervised 24-hour, 7-day-a-week, year-round emergency shelter for single women and men offering emergency housing and food for those in need. Volunteers play an important role in changing the lives of people in need by preparing meals for the residents, and helping sort and distribute food. When you arrive sign-in at the front desk and tell them you are a Jersey Cares Volunteer. You will be directed to the food pantry to sort as needed and then at 5pm you will serve food in the cafeteria. The Chef has a very specific process, please follow her guidance. She will provide you with gloves and an apron before service begins. Enjoy and have fun meeting new people! As you are serving meals please interact with guests in conversation and clear their tables as needed. Second servings will be at 5:30, only if food is remaining from the initial serving. Volunteers will be deployed as follows: Food Servers (2-3) Beverage Servers (1-2) Greeter (1-2) General Help (1) NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07307.title: Hunger Helpers in Jersey City

10038.description: About Reach the World is a New York City-based nonprofit organization that makes the benefits of travel accessible to classrooms, inspiring students to become curious, confident and compassionate global citizens. Every year since 2001, Reach the World has held an annual benefit to fundraise for the organization. The guest count is typically between 150 and 200 guests from diverse New York City and Connecticut-based industries. The event format includes cocktails, a silent auction, a sit-down dinner, and an award presentation at the end of the evening. This year's Cronkite Award will be given to a prominent honoree- stay tuned for the big reveal! The success of Reach the World's events are entirely dependent on the volunteer Benefit Committee members whose work and creativity make each event possible. Volunteering for RTW is a substantive way to gain event experience, network with other NYC professionals, and give back to a good cause. Reach the World welcomes all serious applicants to the 2018 Benefit Committee. The 2018 Benefit will take place on April 4 th, 2018 at the Boathouse in Central Park. To apply and for more information, please fill out this online application: https://www.tfaforms.com/4651651
10038.title: Join Reach the World's 2018 Annual Benefit Committee

10038.description: Do you have a passion for global education and international exchange? Do you believe in grassroots programs that leverage volunteer energies for a social good? Are you excited by events and production? Reach the World is seeking a mature volunteer looking to advance his/her networking, fundraising and event management skills for a 'team lead’ position of Reach the World’s 2018 Benefit Committee. This volunteer position (4-10h/week) reports to RTW's Development Manager. This position has a flexible start date between December 1, 2017 and January 2, 2018 and runs until the gala on April 6th 2018. The position is unpaid. The volunteer who secures the most donations receives two tickets to the event and is entered into the raffle! Responsibilities: Event Planning: Participate in bi-weekly evening meetings; lead the strategy for securing fashion prize donations for the silent auction; manage other volunteers Fashion Industry Outreach and Donor Management: Reach out to donors in person, through email and over the phone to secure a minimum of 25 fashion prizes for the silent auction (women’s, men’s, kids, home, office); leverage network to increase donations; manage relationships with donors in the fashion industry Gala Volunteering: Volunteer at the event (unless you plan to purchase a ticket and attend) Qualifications: Organized self-starter Fearless communicator Works well under pressure Team player Experience planning events and/or volunteering with a nonprofit is a bonus About Reach the World and the 2018 Annual Benefit Dinner Reach the World makes the benefits of travel accessible to classrooms, inspiring students to become curious, confident global citizens. Enabled by our virtual exchange platform, classrooms and volunteer travelers explore the world together. Every year since 2001, Reach the World has held an annual benefit to fundraise for the organization. The event includes cocktails, a silent auction, a sit-down dinner, and an award presentation at the end of the evening. This year's Cronkite Award will be given to a prominent honoree - stay tuned! The success of Reach the World's event is entirely dependent on the volunteer Benefit Committee members whose work and creativity make the event possible. Volunteering for RTW is a substantive way to gain event experience, network with other NYC professionals, and give back to a good cause. How to Apply Please submit a cover letter and resume by email to brianna@reachtheworld.org. No phone, email, mail, or fax inquiries will receive a response. Thank you for your interest in joining Reach the World on its exciting journey!

10038.description: American Youth Table Tennis seeks interested college students in the New York City Metro Area to teach high school students the sport of table tennis, leadership, fair play, respect and teamwork. Table Tennis expertise required. As a volunteer coach you will receive a small per visit stipend per visit to cover transportation costs and effort. We will assign you to a New York City High School Table Tennis Program as an Assistant Table Tennis Coach. Duties will include, teaching basic and intermediate table tennis - footwork, serve, serve return, backhand, forehand, tactics, loop, loop drive as well as serving multi-ball and providing a positive and exciting framework for play, and dialog. American Youth Table Tennis and New York City Department of Education have teamed up to make this opportunity available to you. Table Tennis is an official varsity sport in New York City. We will be accepting applications in November and through to the end of January. We are in need of expert collegiate table tennis players to assist in selected High School Programs for the 2017-18 season which begins in December and Continues through March 2018 As an Assistant Coach, you will be giving back to the New York City community by imparting your table tennis knowledge on receptive and interested high school students. This program will look good on your resume and will help the next generation of collegiate table tennis players.
10038.title: Youth Table Tennis Coach - Collegiate Internship Program

10038.description: Mentor a 13-18 year old student to provide guidance and broaden his or her horizons. Help a student grow to be confident, caring young adult by becoming a role model and someone he or she can rely on. Mentors and mentees are matched after carefully considering the goals of the mentee and what the mentor can do to support that goal. We are currently looking for more male mentors. The mentoring program is for males and females, but as of now, we do not have enough male mentors.
10038.title: Middle School/High School Mentor (male)

10038.description: Teach 4th and 5th graders the fundamentals of basketball and what teamwork really is. Coach the students and help them win games against other schools by guiding them through the seasons. Be the one to show the young students the love for the game.
10038.title: Volunteer Basketball Coaches Needed

10038.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10038.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 126 Jacob August Riis, Manhattan)

10038.description: We are looking for volunteers with dance experience to help run a weekly movement-based creative workshop for students with intellectual disabilities in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn, Wednesdays from 11-12. This opportunity takes place over 12 weeks, for a small group of middle and high school students. The workshop will culminate with an informal showing. We are also looking for volunteer yoga instructors in all boroughs.
10038.title: Looking for Dance Teachers and Yoga Instructors

10038.description: Our Junior Board is a unique way for young professionals, typically in their 20s and 30s, to help build the future of our overall organization. Becoming a member of the Junior Board is a way to ensure that our organization reflects a broad demographic, while developing the next generation of leaders. Through volunteer efforts, education, outreach and fundraising, the Junior Board has a measurable impact on our mission of providing health and human services to our select consumers. Each year, the Junior Board will select a focus for their efforts for the year, around which they will structure a fundraising initiative and hands-on volunteer activities. One of The URI Board’s Trustees serves as a mentor to the Junior Board -attending their meetings, acting as a general supporter of up-and-coming leadership, and serving as a formal liaison with the Board.
10038.title: Urban Resource Institute Junior Board of Trustees

10038.description: Looking for musicians who would be willing to present free concerts in our gymnasium to an audience of all ages. We are trying to create a performing arts venue for our Lower East Side Chinatown community that often does not have the opportunity to experience live musical performances. We need you!!We would like to host concerts in January, February, March, April and May 2018. No musical act is too large or too small.
10038.title: Showcase your music in our Lower East Side community

10038.description: Sign your corporate group up for a volunteer event to rescue food for the hungry! During these events, your corporate group will travel to one or more of our food business partners that are ready to donate their excess food. The group then rescues this food and takes it to a nearby homeless shelter or soup kitchen. More details will be provided after contacted.
10038.title: Corporate Group Volunteer Activity: Fight Food Waste and Feed the Hungry this holiday season!

10038.description: Host a Tutor Ambassador event to impact the futures for Read Alliance's bright and motivated tutors! Events can cover topics relevant to current highschool students on the path to bright futures, including but not limited to: College Readiness Financial Literacy Mock Interviews Building Your Personal Brand Events can be hosted at the Read Alliance offices (80 Maiden Lane) or at your company's offices. We can work with you to bulid a curriculum for a particular topic or tailor a prepared presentation to suit our tutor audience.
10038.title: Host a Tutor Ambassador Event

10038.description: We are looking for Volunteer Photographers for the Walk to End Alzheimer's. We will need photographers for the opening program, start/finish line, team photos, champion photos and other areas. The dates for the walks are: Queens- October 7th, Cross Island Parkway Whitestone, NY 11357 Staten Island- October 14th 1150 Clove Road Staten Island, NY 10301 Manhattan- October 28th 199 Water St New York, NY 10038 Brooklyn- November 4th 2001 Oriental Blvd Brooklyn, NY 11235 If you are interested or have any questions please contact me at tansari@alz.org
10038.title: Volunteer Photographer for the Walk to End Alzheimer's
10038.org: Alzheimer's Association New York City Chapter

10038.description: The Events volunteer will report to and work closely with the Annual Giving & Special Projects Manager and the Resource Development team to plan, execute and manage the logistics around fundraising events. This volunteer position also requires the planning and execution of non-fundraising events including groundbreakings and home dedications. We are looking for a candidate who can focus specifically on building a structure for annual events as well as bring creative ideas to each project. Assist in the planning and execution of our annual fundraising event, The Habitat House Party Assist in the planning and execution of new events that will help cultivate new donors and sustain Habitat New York City contacts with existing donors and other key stakeholders. Such events include special build days like Broadway Builds, Women Build and more. Assist in the planning and execution of organization-wide events, including but not limited to groundbreakings, home dedications, and family and volunteer recognition events. Coordinate logistics for corporate team build days. Assist in Manage creative programming, operations, logistics, production, budgeting, contracts, billing and result reporting for all events. Create a working calendar of special events and a timeline for planning each even which includes budgets. Assist the Grants and In-Kind Manager in soliciting Gifts-in-Kind donations and sponsorships as needed for events. Work with the Communications and Marketing team to create event collateral and marketing materials for each event, as needed. Assist in the preparation for events including correspondence, invitations, guest lists, mailings, vendor approvals, ticketing, auction items, marketing materials and more. Continuously stays abreast of event strategies, ideas and trends in the marketplace including competitive and industry brands. Utilizes this knowledge to create opportunities and inform all facets of events Required Skills and Qualifications: Minimum 1-2 years event planning/event management experience specifically in New York City. College/University experience applies. Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to think strategically and creatively. This includes database and budget management. Strong customer service including clients, donors, volunteers and vendors. Must be able to take direction, think creatively and proactively suggest solutions, and be able to prioritize tasks. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and presentation skills. Able to work nights and weekends as necessary. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. Ability to lift 30lbs. Passion and understanding of the Habitat for Humanity mission and the desire to promote it!
10038.title: Events Volunteer
10038.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

10038.description: This opportunity is available at different times throughout the week! 3:30-4 PM, Monday-Friday OR 5:30-6 PM every Saturday OR 6:30-7 PM every Sunday! Leftover bagels can make a difference. Just because they were not sold at the end of the day does not mean that they should not have a chance to make someone happy. Come and help bring a bagel to someone in need. This event will last 30 minutes and will finish at the Bowery Mission, located at 227 Bowery. Mediumweight: the average amount of pounds of food total is 30-40 lbs. Split between 4 people, each person will only carry an average of less than 10 lbs. SIGN UP DIRECTLY ON OUR WEBSITE: Monday 8/21/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21911 Tuesday 8/22/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21912 Wednesday 8/23/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21913 Thursday 8/24/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21914 Friday 8/25/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21915 Saturday 8/26/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21477 Sunday 8/27/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/19582 Sunday 9/3/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/19583 Sunday 9/10/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/19584 Sunday 9/17/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/19585 Sunday 9/24/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/19586
10038.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in SoHo!

10038.description: This opportunity is available every Saturday! Walk through FiDi to rescue leftover food that would have been thrown away. This event lasts just 30 minutes, and will end at the NYC Rescue Mission at 90 Lafayette (Lafayette and White Street). Heavyweight: the average amount of food is 60-80 pounds. Divided between 5 people, each rescuer will carry about 15 lbs. Sign up directly on our website: Saturday 8/19/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21409 Saturday 8/26/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21410 Saturday 9/2/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21411 Saturday 9/9/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21412 Saturday 9/16/17 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/21413
10038.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in FiDi 4:30PM-5:00PM

10038.description: Sign your corporate group up for a volunteer event to rescue food for the hungry! During these events, your corporate group will travel to one or more of our food business partners that are ready to donate their excess food. The group then rescues this food and takes it to a nearby homeless shelter or soup kitchen. More details will be provided after contacted.
10038.title: Corporate Group Volunteer Activity: Fight Food Waste and Feed the Hungry in Just 30 Minutes!

10038.description: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and getting food to those in need. This is a perfect opportunity for college students are interested in the nonprofit sector, to volunteer to rescue food and help those in need. Sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10038.title: Stop Food Waste and Feed the Hungry (College Students Looking to Give Back to the Community)

10038.description: The Next Chapter Book Club (NCBC) is an innovative community-based reading program for adolescents and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. The NCBC network includes more than 2,000 members meeting weekly since 2002 at nearly 300 book clubs in 31 states, four Canadian provinces, and three European countries. NCBC is the largest community-based book club program for adolescents and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities in the world. It is an opportunity to maintain reading and literacy skills beyond school. Volunteers: We are looking for leaders to commit to one hour weekly, 11-12 or 12-1 any weekday, in the Bronx, Upper West Side, and Upper East Side, for a minimum of 14 weeks.
10038.title: Next Chapter Book Club (NCBC)

10038.description: Help your community to stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be taking bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. This is a great opportunity to gain community service experience while helping others at the same time!!!! Please sign up for events directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10038.title: Stop Food Waste and Help Feed the Hungry This Holiday Season!!! (Great Way To Give Back)

10038.description: I-PREP (Interview, Practice and Review for Emerging Professionals): Work one-on-one to help people supported by AHRC gain confidence and sharpen their employment interview skills. Each hour and a half session provides them with two 30 minute mock interviews and feedback, and training for the volunteers. MONEY MAKES SENSE: Teach financial literacy skills to people supported by AHRC who need to understand how to save money. During a two hour workshop, volunteers work one-on-one with them to help improve their budgeting skills, understand credit, and increase their savings.
10038.title: I-PREP and Money Makes Sense

10038.description: Revitalize community spaces throughout New York City with Habitat for Humanity! Our Brush With Kindness (BWK) program enhances community spaces in all five boroughs by painting interiors and murals, landscaping and gardening, and performing minor construction tasks in public schools, playgrounds, community centers, and public parks. As a volunteer, you will have the opportunity to create your own schedule, meet new people, learn new skills, and most importantly, make a positive difference in the lives of others. No experience is necessary - just enthusiasm! Our sites are open Wednesday through Saturday 9:00AM - 4:00PM. Volunteers ages 14 - 17 may participate with a signed waiver from a parent or guardian. How to Sign Up: Learn more before signing up by visiting our website (habitatnyc.org) OR create a profile on volunteerhub and sign up for a volunteer orientation (see instructions below). Please note: orientations are optional and are not required for Brush with Kindness or Construction volunteers. If you are ready to start making a difference, follow the steps below to create your volunteerhub account: 1. Log on to habitatnyc.volunteerhub.com 2. Click the \"Create an Account\" button to create a new profile Choose a username and password Leave the Join Code field blank and click \"Next\" Input your full name, contact information, date of birth, and emergency contact's information 3. Select \"Construction\" and click on the event that interests you 4. Click on the \"Sign Up\" button and follow the directions to register for the event 5. You will receive a confirmation email letting you know you successfully signed up for a volunteer day! Please email volunteer@habitatnyc.org with any questions
10038.title: Paint with Habitat for Humanity NYC!
10038.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

10038.description: AHRC New York City's ONE-for-ONE program offers people with intellectual and developmental disabilities meaningful and enduring partnerships with volunteers from their local community. Volunteers are expecteded to meet with their ONE-for-ONE partners at least once a month for a minimum of one year and to check in regularly with a Volunteer Coordinator. Volunteers must be over 18, be good listeners, and be willing to provide support, friendship, and positive examples of community engagement. Participants are required to attend an Orientation/Training session and pass a security background check. Exact meeting locations, dates, and times will be determined by the participants, and can take place in all 5 boroughs. Contact Stefanie Nelson at stefanie.nelson@ahrcnyc.org or 212-895-3426 if you would like to volunteer, or for additional information. We hope you'll join our team of dedicated volunteers!
10038.title: Become a ONE-for-ONE partner!

10038.description: HFH NYC seeks a highly motivated and compassionate individual to work with partner families in areas such as sweat equity, homeownership education, and adjustment to new responsibility. The position’s primary importance is to support the Partner Family by empowering them through homeownership. RESPONSIBILITIES The position's primary responsibility is to engage future Habitat for Humanity New York City Family Partners through phone call follow up; email inquiry response; database management; answer questions about the Habitat home ownership program, the application. and selection process. * Explain the homeownership program * Describe the family partner selection process and timeline * Coordinate and schedule Information session attendance; open house attendance; panel interviews and 1-on-1 meetings * Perform such other tasks as may be needed or requested to facilitate a positive customer experience at Habitat-NYC * Perform other general office and administrative duties as directed by the Family Services team * Provide general assistance to customers, answering questions, and directing customers to the correct department
10038.title: Family Services Office Volunteer
10038.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

10038.description: Every other Tuesday evening from 6:00-8:00 p.m. fresh art has a sewing group that hand sews sock monkeys. The monkeys are sold via fresh art's website as well as select craft fairs to benefit the organizations fine arts programming for New York City artists with special needs. Knowledge of hand sewing is necessary and participants must be a minimum of 21 years of age. We provide all of the sewing materials. It takes about four-six hours to sew a sock monkey so we ask that you would come to at least two to three sessions in order to finish a monkey. If you wish to continue with the group, that would be great. We have volunteers who have been with us for many years. Please look at the website for fresh art's history of what we do: www.freshartnyc.org Volunteers also help with staffing at the two-three craft fairs fresh art participates in per year for selling the sock monkeys and at the organizations yearly benefit. For further information about the group and upcoming sewing dates, please contact our Volunteer Coordinator : Heber Sanchez: freshartnycvolunteercoordinator@gmail.com
10038.title: sewing volunteers

11214.description: Help us rescue produce from a great local market! We will deliver it to a social services organization's food pantry, located at 7708 New Utrecht Ave in Bensonhurst, where it will be distributed to the food insecure population they serve. This event will last about 45 minutes. This event needs volunteers 7 days a week! Offer as little or as much of your time as you'd like. **This rescue has an average of 100 pounds per pick up, so a car is preferred! Round up some buddies, drive on over, and help us feed those who will be so grateful for your effort and time. Sign up directly on our website: https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
11214.title: Food rescue events in Bensonhurst at 10am every day of the week!

11214.description: WE ARE IN GREAT NEED TO PROCESS GRANTS TO HELP WITH OUR OPERATIONAL EXPENSES. DUE TO THE HIGH DEMAND OF OUR SERVICES, WE ARE FACING OUR OWN CRISIS DUE TO LACK OF FUNDS. WE CAN REALLY CAN USE SOMEONE THAT CAN HELP APPLY FOR GRANTS ONCE OR TWICE A WEEK. Reaching Out Community Services was founded in 1992 to provide services and support to families in southwest Brooklyn. Reaching Out Community Services, Inc. reaches out to the community by providing food subsidies, referrals, and other services to families and individuals facing hardship. Working in partnership with other community organizations, Reaching Out fosters a caring atmosphere for the welfare of our community. We are dedicated to maintaining continuous growth in services to help our clients to improve their quality of life. Our intended outcome is to help clients meet their basic human needs. WHAT WE DO CAN BE VEIWED AR OUR WEB SITE AT: reachinout.org
11214.title: GRANT WRITER OR PROCESSOR

11214.description: Reaching-Out Community Services operates as a supermarket- style client choice food pantry plus program. Our clients choose thier food items through our Digital Touch Screen Program. It is designed so that our recipients are able to select food items based on their dietary needs. This program is one-of-a-few in the Brooklyn area. There are several advantages for this type of this food pantry. It is more dignifying for the patrons who come to this program to get help with food. Instead of being handed a bag of random food goods, they are able to shop for themselves and select food, based on their dietary needs. We try to offer a variation of nutritional food items along with fresh fruits & vegetables. We provide other social needs such as, helping with food stamps, Pa, referrals, etc. Summer tutoring, Free TAx Prep, Mobile Feeding Bus for the Homeless. Fun and friendly place to work at. Visit our web site for other info: www.Rcsprograms.org Volunteer opts Email: Info@rcsprograms.org
11214.title: Food Pantry Plus Program     Helpers Needed

07304.description: Be a Hospice Volunteer! Hospice Volunteers are needed for supportive visits to patients, offering emotional support and companionship. Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Jessicalee Huggins 973-916-1400 or email Jessicalee.huggins@cchnet.net
07304.title: Be a hospice volunteer in Hudson County

07304.description: Position Summary: The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Community Outreach Volunteer is a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. The Community Outreach Volunteer will assist the Community Outreach Coordinator with building strategic relationships, conducting a variety of outreach activities, and the recruitment of volunteers and members. Responsibilities: The Community Outreach Volunteer will assist the Community Outreach Coordinator with building strategic relationships, conducting a variety of outreach activities, and the recruitment of volunteers and members. The Community Outreach Volunteer will assist the Community Outreach Coordinator with the following tasks: Create and implement our outreach plan Develop and strengthen relationships between the Disability Allies and the community Develop partnerships with universities, social groups and community organizations, in particular those that provide social opportunities to young adults with disabilities Recruit and place Disability Allies volunteers within our committees Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement: Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of vendors and provision of services.
