This volunteer position is the first point of contact for guests and requires managing and directing guests and clients, answering and managing phone calls and light clerical work as needed such as filing and sorting mail. This is an unpaid position. STAR, Inc., Lighting the Way is a not-for-profit organization established in 1952 to serve individuals of all ages who have intellectual and developmental disabilities, as well as providing support services to their families. STAR creates opportunities for individuals to live full lives with independence, freedom of choice and personal growth by providing support, services and advocacy. Headquartered in Norwalk and with new offices in 15 Cross Street Norwalk and 111 Elm Street New Canaan, STAR is able to serve over 600 individuals from birth through their senior years in Fairfield County. They aim to inform and encourage the community to recognize and appreciate the value of all individuals. For more information about STAR, Inc., Lighting the Way, visit www.starct.org .
06851.title: Front Reception Desk Assistance needed at non-profit

06851.description: The Courage to Speak Foundation is a Norwalk based non-profit organization dedicated to saving lives by empowering youth to be drug free and encouraging parents to communicate effectively with their children about the dangers of drugs. We are currently seeking a part-time Administrative Assistant volunteer. The volunteer will be doing clerical work such as using Microsoft Word, Excel, sending emails, printing and organizing, as well as event preparation. For more information, contact our office at (203)831-9700 or email gkatz@couragetospeak.org. Please visit www.couragetospeak.org to learn more about our organization. Be a part of this organization and help to protect the future of our youth.
06851.title: Administrative Assistant Volunteer

06851.description: Do you enjoy helping others and giving back to your community? If so, join the Norwalk Health Department’s Emergency Response Team. This team of people donates their time and expertise to prepare and respond to emergencies, and to promote healthy living throughout the year. Emergency Response Team ( ERT) volunteers include community members with both medical and non-medical backgrounds . Interpreters, home makers, chaplains, office workers, legal advisors, medical and public health professionals are all needed for key positions in the ERT program. Lend a hand when there’s a need and help the Norwalk Health Department help others. Use your current skills and develop new skills while gaining additional experience. AND... meet other people who share your interests. We provide training and insurance. You provide your time and skills. After training, no time commitment required.
06851.title: Emergency Response Team

06851.description: Volunteers are the core of our organization, for they possess the special qualities of a loving heart and a unique call to serve. Some have had personal experience of loss, some bring professional skills or specialized expertise, but most are ordinary people who want to help. Volunteers provide caring compassion for both the person facing the end of life and those who love them. Orientation and training is provided in English for every volunteer. We want you to feel confident and competent. We believe in a team approach in all that we do, so you never feel alone or unsupported. We serve patients wherever \"home\" is: skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, retirement communities or their own residences. Patient and Family Support Volunteer Provide friendly companion visits Read aloud, write letters, share an interest Provide gifts of music, art, scrapbooking Actively listen and be supportive in hearing expressed fears and concerns Create a written legacy for other loved ones Offer prayers (and quiet presence) Assist in picking up medications, light errands, outdoor chores Bereavement Volunteer (Additional training Needed) Writing sympathy cards, other significant anniversaries or events Supportive telephone calls Participation in Greif Groups and Remembrance Services Community presentations in Grief Volunteers must have 15 hours of mandatory training and make a commitment of a few hours per week or per month Volunteers will learn the history of hospice, the goals and philosophy of care, and the emotional and spiritual needs of patients at the end of life. They develop the communication skills necessary to comfort and support patients and families because they spend quality time with patients, they often give valuable feedback to the care team. To volunteer today, call Marie Keogh, Coordinator of Volunteer Services at (203) 663-6732, or visit www.constellationhs.com
06851.title: Speak Spanish Fluently and wish to make a difference?  Become a Hospice Volunteer!

06851.description: Los voluntarios son el núcleo de nuestra Organización, por poséan las cualidades especiales de un corazón amoroso y una llamada única a servir. Algunos han tenido experiencia personal de la pérdida, algunos traen habilidades profesionales o conocimientos especializados, pero la mayoría son personas comunes que quieren ayudar. Los voluntarios proveen cuidado compasión para la persona que enfrenta el final de la vida y de quienes los aman. Orientación y entrenamiento es proporcionada en inglés para cada voluntario. Queremos que usted se sienta seguro y competente. Creemos en un enfoque de equipo en todo lo que hacemos, por lo que nunca se sienta solo o compatible. Servimos a los pacientes donde su \"hogar\" este: casas de reposo, comunidades de retiro, o sus propias hogares. El Apoyo a pacientes y familiares Proporcionan del voluntario con visitas amables leen, escriben cartas, comparten un interés personal ofrezcan participacioń a la música, el arte, el teatro escuchen activamente y ser solidarios con sus temores y preocupaciones Crear un legado escrito para sus queridos ofrezcan oraciones (y presencia silenciosa) ayuden en la recogida de medicamentos, recados y tareas Voluntariado El Duelo (formación adicional necesaria) escribir tarjetas de pésame, aniversarios importantes, eventos o llamadas telefónicas de apoyo. participación en grupos de Greif y Servicios y presentaciones en el dolor de la p`erdida. Los voluntarios deben tener 15 horas de formación obligatoria y hacer un compromiso de unas pocas horas por semana o por mes los voluntarios conocerán la historia del hospicio, los objetivos y la filosofía de la atención hospicio y el bienestar emocional y necesidades espirituales de los pacientes que se encuentren al final de la vida. Se desarrollan las habilidades de comunicación necesarias para consuelo y apoyo a los pacientes y familias. Porque pasan tiempo de calidad con los pacientes, dan información valiosa para el equipo entero que cuidan al paciente. Para ser voluntario, llame, Coordinador de Servicios de Voluntarios al (203) 663-6732, o visite www.constellationhs.com
06851.title: !Alto!  Se busca voluntarios

06851.description: Do you have a certified pet therapy dog? We are looking for canine good citizens to join our growing hospice program as a furry friend to our patients. If you have the passion, skills, and a heart full of love and would like to share your therapy dog with us we would love to meet you. Training is required for all handlers. 1. Trained/certified through Therapy Dogs, International, Pet Partners, or other programs. 2. Ability to communicate well with all people of diverse backgrounds and ages. 3. Able to respect confidentiality at all times. 4. Comfortable with the death and dying process. 5. Self-motivation, dependable and responsible. 6. Able to work independantly. 7. Able to work in an ever-changing environment. 8. Able to practice proper infection control. 9. Able to maintain appropriate personal and professional boundaries. 10. Must be at least 18 years of age. Responsibilities 1. Provide support to patients and caregivers. 2. Provide friendly companionship to patients. 3. Visit patients with therapy dog. Requirements 1. Complete online volunteer application at www.constellationhs.com, interview, background check, fingerprinting, health screening, TB test or chest x-ray if history of BCG exists per hospice program policy and volunteer and company orientation. 2. Provide proof of pet therapy training and documentation of dog's health records. 3. Able to make a commitment of a few hours per week/month for one year. 4. Maintains open communication with other team members, reporting events or changes in patient condition to the Volunteer Supervisor or other interdisciplinary team members. 5. Records accurate, objective, timely documentation of volunteer activities. 6. Completes mandatory in services annually. 7. Attends volunteer support meetings as needed.
06851.title: Looking for Certified Pet Therapy Dogs to Join Our Growing Hospice

06851.description: Join our growing hospice program serving all of Fairfield County including Greenwich, Stamford, Darien, Norwalk, New Canaan, Wilton, Easton, Bridgeport, Stratford, Shelton, Milford, Orange, Oxford, Hamden, New Haven and Wallingford. Orientation and Training is provided for every volunteer in our Orange and Norwalk Offices. We want you to feel confident and competent. We believe in a team approach in all that we do, so you never feel alone or unsupported. We serve patients wherever \"home\" is: skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, retirement communities or their own homes. Patient/Family Volunteer (wherever \"home\" may be) * Provide friendly companion visits * Read aloud, write letters, share an interest * Provide gifts of music, art, scrap booking (strong need for musicians) * Actively listen and be supportive in hearing expressed fears and concerns * Create a written legacy for other loved ones * Offer prayers and serve as a vigil volunteer (special training required) Bereavement Volunteer (requires additional training in bereavement) Volunteers learn the history of hospice, the goals and philosophy of care, and the emotional and spiritual needs of patients at the end of life. They develop the communication skills necessary to comfort and support patients and families and because they spend quality time with patients, they often give valuable feedback to the care team. *15 hours of training * Commitment of varies from person to person, visits are typically a minimum of 45 minutes per person and can ranged between 2-3 times a week and 2-4 hours per month.
06851.title: School is Back in Session... Volunteer While your Child is in School for Growing Hospice Program

06851.description: Administrative volunteers promote hospice care by helping perform clerical assignments in an office setting. These assignments can include helping process mail outs, filing, data entry, answering phones, restocking supplies, making packets, plus many other tasks. VITAS Volunteer orientation is provided free of charge to help you learn the skills required to be an outstanding Office Volunteer. Volunteers are needed between the hours of 8am and 5pm, Monday through Friday. For more information about VITAS visit VITAS.com.
06851.title: Help Provide Clerical Duties in Hospice Office - Norwalk

06851.description: Assist hospice chaplains by making follow-up bereavement calls, help lead remembrance services for all faith backgrounds and support other religious themed activities. Ability to wheel residents and patients back and forth from their rooms to services is a vital part of this experience. Interest in thantology and theology, and pastoral work preferrred.
06851.title: Pastoral and Bereavement Volunteers Needed

06851.description: Are you a recent retiree looking for something meaningful to do? Join our volunteer family and age with purpose. Participate in hands-on activities with hospice patients and clients who value your lasting contribution of time or volunteer a few times a month (or more) in our office. If you are looking for a work environment where you can utilize your passion, expertise and leadership skills we want you. We have many opportunities for volunteers of all backgrounds including office work, bereavement call bank, patient satisfaction survey administration, community relations, circle of care, etc... Call Marie Keogh to learn more about our current opportunities at 203-663-6732.
06851.title: Recently Retired?  Office Assistance Needed at Growing Hospice & Bereavement Program

06851.description: What we are looking for: Myth: Hospice is a place Myth: Hospice is for people who have no hope Myth: Hospice is only for people with Cancer Myth: Myth: Hospice is for people who have only a few days to live Myth: Hospice requires family members and friends to be available to provide care Are you looking for a way to give back to the community? Joining the Constellation Hospice team is an incredible and rewarding experience. Our volunteers support the hospice mission in many capacities. The majority of our volunteers provide direct services to our clients, their families and caregivers by generously spending time in the home of someone who is living with a life-threatening illness. Hospice volunteers are a specialized group of 'professional volunteers’ who offer many things including companionship, a silent prescence, emotional support and practical assistance to our clients, and short-term relief to client families and caregivers. Many practical and supportive tasks can make a significant difference to those who are living while they are dying. For some, volunteers bring normalcy to day-to-day life. From offering some warm companionship, reading stories or the local paper, talking about world events, to remembering past life experiences and the accomplishments that people have experienced...to name just a few. Many volunteers assist with life’s basic tasks such as organizing papers, writing letters or helping to make phone calls, to assisting with, light household duties, shopping assistance, providing comfort measures and personal care. For many families and caregivers hospice volunteers offer much needed additional support, including respite relief and 'listening ears’. Constellation Hospice also has other specialized roles for volunteers who have other professional experiences and interests. Complimentary Therapy volunteers are registered practitioners with experience in Registered Massage Therapy, Reiki, Healing Touch, Therapeutic Touch, Reflexology, Music or Expressive Arts Therapy; who are able to share their skills with our clients. We also offer a specialized training for volunteers to work within our Bereavement Support Programs. These volunteers work with bereaved individuals, families or groups. With the support of Constellation Hospice's volunteers, together with our professional staff, we assist hundreds of individuals and families/caregivers each year. Together we can make a difference, please consider joining our team. Due to the sensitive nature of our work, we are committed to ensuring that all volunteers are fully screened and trained prior to working directly with our clients. This process is extensive and requires a tremendous commitment to all that join our team. The process includes attending a volunteer information session, submitting an online application, an interview, reference checks, a background check and 12+ hours of initial training. We also offer ongoing professional development opportunities, volunteer support and social activities throughout the year.
06851.title: Provide Companionship, Dignity, Respect and Comfort to a Hospice Patient

06851.description: Is your group interested in making a difference in the lives of others? Do you fill your days with crochet? We are looking for donations of crocheted or knitted afghans, quits and lap robes in a variety of colors. Your donation will help individuals enrolled in hospice to live their lives with the comfort, dignity and respect they deserve. Please note we are especially looking for patriotic colors to be donated to veterans.
06851.title: Blanket us with Your Love, Make a Blanket for a Hospice Patient

06851.description: Join our growing hospice and palliative care program serving New Haven and Fairfield Counties! Orientation and Training is provided for every volunteer. We want you to feel confident and competent. We believe in a team approach in all that we do, so you never feel alone or unsupported. We serve patients wherever \"home\" is: skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, retirement communities or their own homes. Program Support Volunteer (in the Hospice Office) * Assist with mailings * Copies/Packet Assembly * Filing * Special Projects Patient/Family Volunteer (wherever \"home\" may be) * Provide friendly companion visits * Read aloud, write letters, share an interest * Provide gifts of music, art, scrap booking ( strong need for musicians) * Actively listen and be supportive in hearing expressed fears and concerns * Create a written legacy for other loved ones * Offer prayers * Assist in picking up medications, light clean up, outdoor chores Bereavement Volunteer (requires additional training in bereavement) Volunteers learn the history of hospice, the goals and philosophy of care, and the emotional and spiritual needs of patients at the end of life. They develop the communication skills necessary to comfort and support patients and families and because they spend quality time with patients, they often give valuable feedback to the care team. *15 hours of training * Commitment of 2-4 hours/monthly
06851.title: Looking for a Loving Heart and a Unique Call to Serve!

06851.description: Individuals and groups can assist with special events and activities for people with developmental disabilities. This position requires a positive disposition, tolerance and understanding of individual differences, and a sense of cooperation with STAR staff and other volunteers to assist in providing services to our clientele, staff and the public. Volunteers may assist with: A group project that benefits the population, such as organizing and helping update and fix our Clothing Exchange for low income adults with developmental disabilities A group project that benefits the population socially and/or recreationally, such as a sponsored outing with adults with developmental disabilities An interactive group project that benefits the population socially and/or recreationally, such as an activity for our day programs, such as arts, music, crafts, dancing. Assisting with upcoming events such as our Theater of STARs show on December 3. Individual volunteers may help with set-up, refreshments, photography, videography, ushering, packing up the trucks, programs. Another event or activity of your choice. STAR serves individuals with developmental disabilities throughout Mid Fairfield County. Contact Megan Johnson, Volunteer Coordinator, 203-846-9581 x339 or mjohnson@starinconline.com
06851.title: Assist With Events for Non-Profit Agency for People With Developmental Disabilities

06851.description: Provide computer, clerical and/or office assistance to agency that serves people with developmental disabilities. Part or full time support needed, Monday through Friday, between 9am and 3pm. Help needed for filing, sorting, mailings, computer database updates and/or assisting in clerical duties. This position requires a positive disposition, good spelling skills, and a mature individual who can work with a variety of types of office employees and clients who have developmental disabilities. STAR serves individuals with developmental disabilities throughout Mid Fairfield County. Contact Megan Johnson, Volunteer Coordinator, 203-846-9581 x339 or mjohnson@starinconline.com
06851.title: Office Assistance for Non-Profit Agency

06851.description: Looking for someone passionate enough to lead a task force involved in substance abuse prevention in Norwalk. Leadership requires bringing together a group of volunteers to work on this and related issues and recording notes of monthly meetings and activities. This group will set up a schedule to disseminate materials on substance abuse, underage drinking and tobacco use; work with representatives of local housing authority to prepare for Family Day events; help expand program activities. This will take approximately 10 hours per month.
06851.title: Are you passionate about preventing substance abuse??

06851.description: SCORE is seeking an SEO and ecommerce specialist to assist our clients, who are budding entrepreneurs, in utilizing the web to develop, market and grow their businesses. We help people in a supportive and non-judgemental manner to flesh out their ideas and bring them to fruition. We have over 100 business mentors with vast experience from many industries and services.
06851.title: SEO & E Commerce Specialist

06851.description: Office Administrator Assist with inputting of data and general office duties The position is strictly volunteer. The amount of time devoted is solely up to the individual. Any time spent is appreciated though we estimate the entire function to be 1-3 hours per week.
06851.title: Office Administrator

06851.description: Potential dual role: 1) Assist new or existing entrpreneurs with social media as a marketing tool using LinkedIn, FaceBook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Google+ and others. 2) Work with chapter media team to promote the brand and awareness of SCORE and its small business orientated services, face to face and email mentoring, workshops and education programs. The position is strictly volunteer and open to whatever time the applicant has to devote.
06851.title: Marketing & Social Media Specialist

06851.description: Part or full time clerical support needed, Monday through Friday, between 9am and 3pm. May be used for an internship if you obtain necessary requirements and paperwork from your school advisor. Help needed for filing, sorting, and assisting in clerical duties. This position requires a positive disposition, good spelling skills, and a mature individual who can work with a variety of types of office employees and clients who have developmental disabilities. STAR serves individuals with developmental disabilities throughout Mid Fairfield County. contact Peter Saverine, Director of Philanthropy psaverine@starct.org
06851.title: Internship-Clerical Support Needed to Assist at STAR Headquarters

06851.description: Assist adults with developmental disabilities in enjoying recreational activities such as bowling, movie night, game night (Wii), music/band night, dances, crafts and other activities. Experience with caretaking and/or individuals with developmental disabilities prefererable. Make a difference in others' lives and see what a difference it makes in your life!
06851.title: Bring smiles to adults with developmental disabilities- assist them with recreational activi

06851.description: Home with Friends: 1 hour weekly Your choice of day The Home with Friends program gives you the chance to get to know your Special Friend in the environment they are most comfortable in; their own homes. Together you can bake cookies, play games, create arts and crafts items, play in the snow, read books, or do just about anything you can think of! The opportunities are endless for the two of you to have a great time together - it's no wonder children with special-needs often wait the whole week for the moment their \"Friend\" (that's you) walks through the door! A Home with Friends volunteer coordinator will set you up with a family, tell you everything you need to know, and constantly keep in touch with you to make sure everything runs smoothly. So make the highlight of the child's week yours too - volunteer for Home With Friends today! Mother/Daughter, Father/Son Volunteer opportunities are available. Sunday Circle/Teen Scene: Sunday 2:00-4:00 PM - Monthly Sunday Circle/Teen Scene is a unique opportunity to spend quality time with your special friend, at the same time developing their skills and boosting their self-esteem. This two hour program takes place once a month on Sunday afternoons. You will work one-on-one helping a Special Friend, With the assistance of professional instructors, music and art therapists, you'll help the kids groove to tunes, jump start creativity, enjoy story-telling, and participate in all sorts of sports. Tuesday Adult Circle - 6:00-7:30PM - Monthly Spend some time with The Circle of Friends adult participants. Socialize, make arts & crafts, cook, bake, and enjoy music and dance with professional instructors.
06851.title: Volunteer with children  with special needs!

06851.description: You can volunteer just one hour a week right in your own neighborhood and make a huge difference in a young person’s life! The Norwalk Mentor Program is looking for caring individuals who can spare just one hour a week to be a \"mentor\". Following a brief training, you will be matched with a student in one of the Norwalk Public Schools. You choose the school and the grade. You then meet with your \"mentee\" at school once a week for an hour - talking, playing games, reading or enjoying other activities. You can be that student’s friend, confidante, role model and advocate. As a mentor you will feel rewarded just seeing the difference you make as the young person you mentor matures and grows to reach his or her full potential. If you’re interested in having a positive influence on a child or teen, contact Nancy Pratt, Director of the Norwalk Mentor Program at The Human Services Council at npratt@hscct.org or 203-849-1111.
06851.title: ONE HOUR A WEEK CAN CHANGE LIVES FOREVER..BECOME A MENTOR

06851.description: Home with Friends 1 hour weekly! The Home with Friends program gives you the chance to get to know your Special Friends in the environment they are most comfortable in; their own homes. Together you can bake cookies, play games, create arts and crafts items, play in the snow, read books, or do just about anything you can think of! The opportunities are endless for the two of you to have a great time together - it's no wonder children with special-needs often wait the whole week for the moment their \"Friend\" (that's you) walks through the door! A Home with Friends volunteer coordinator will set you up with a family, tell you everything you need to know, and constantly keep in touch with you to make sure everything runs smoothly. So make the highlight of the child's week yours too - join Home with Friends today! Sunday Circle/Teen Scene: Sunday 2:00-4:00 PM - Monthly Sunday Circle/Teen Scene is a unique opportunity to spend quality time with your special friend, at the same time developing their skills and boosting their self-esteem. This two hour program takes place once a month on Sunday afternoons. You will work one-on-one helping a Special Friend, With the assistance of professional instructors, music and art therapists, you'll help the kids groove to tunes, jump start creativity, enjoy story-telling, and participate in all sorts of sports. Tuesday Young Adult/Adult Circle - 6:30 - 8:00 PM - Monthly Spend some time with The Circle of Friends adult participants. Socialize, make arts & crafts, cook, bake, and enjoy music and dance with professional instructors Internships Please call or email us
06851.title: Volunteer with children  with special needs in Connecticut.

06853.description: The Courage to Speak Foundation, is a Norwalk-based non-profit organization dedicated to keeping our children safe from drugs. We have several volunteer opportunities available and are currently seeking enthusiastic volunteers to assist with our upcoming media event, The 14th Annual Courage to Speak Empowering Youth to be Drug Free Family Night. Volunteers are needed for checking in guests, greeting participants, setting up/ arranging student posters at the event, serving/overseeing dinner, tidying up afterward and more. For more information, contact Ginger Katz at (203)831-9700 or gkatz@couragetospeak.org. Please visit www.couragetospeak.org for more information.
06853.title: Courage to Speak Empowering Youth to be Drug Free Family Night 2018

08882.description: Embracing HospiceCare has Winter/Spring 2018 Internship positions available for the Winter/Spring Semester of 2018. Please e-mail Volunteer Match or call Dana Dillon, Volunteer Coordinator at 732-974-2545 for more information.
08882.title: Winter/Spring 2018 Internship

08882.description: Virtual volunteers use their talents to create lap blankets for our terminally ill patients. Many of our patients would enjoy the warmth and comfort a blanket can provide. If you possess talents in sewing, quilting, crocheting, and knitting or in the making of blankets, please contact Dana Dillon, Volunteer Coordinator at 732-974-2545 or simply send an email through Volunteer Match. Please keep in mind that you are volunteering so we don't ask for a specific time commitment or blanket quota. We just ask that you give what you can with your heart and your hands! Please include your phone number.
08882.title: Knitting or Crocheting Lap Blankets for Hospice Patients

08882.description: If you have a dog that has gone through a pet therapy program and is a certified pet therapy dog we would love to you both as a part of our team. Our pets visit patients in Assisted Living facilities, Nursing Homes and Private Residences. We also offer mileage reimbursement! Please e-mail Dana Dillon, Volunteer Coordinator through Volunteer Match or call at 732-974-2545. Please include your phone number with this email.
08882.title: Pet Therapist Volunteer

08882.description: Embracing HospiceCare is a family owned hospice that provides quality care to terminally ill patients and their families in Middlesex County, NJ. Our patients reside in Assisted Living facilities, Nursing Homes and Private Residences. Palliative Support Volunteers: We especially need Palliative Support Volunteers to meet the special needs of terminally ill hospice patients. Volunteers provide companionship, emotional and spiritual support for patients and families. Volunteers add a special dimension to Embracing HospiceCare's work. With a warm smile, a tender touch, a listening ear, a heartfelt willingness to help you can make that difference. Palliative Support Volunteer must be 18 years of age or older. Pet Therapy If you have a dog that has gone through a pet therapy program and is a certified pet therapy dog we would love to you both as a part of our team. Our pets visit patients in Assisted Living Facilities, Nursing Homes and Private Residences. Integrative Therapies Are you certified in Reiki, Massage Therapy, Music Therapy, Aromatherapy or Guided Imagery? We have a place for you at Embracing HospiceCare. The Professional Volunteer: Are you a licensed Hairdresser or Barber, Photographer, Event Speaker, Social Worker or Manicurist? If so you can make a difference in an individual's life through volunteering. Please contact Dana Dillon, Volunteer Coordinator at 732-974-2545 for more information. Please e-mail and/or leave your phone number. You will make a difference!
08882.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed

08882.description: Volunteers provide compassionate care and support for terminally ill patients. Reading, writing letters, listening, conversing--all make a difference to each patient. Volunteers are an important part of our hospice team in Middlesex County. The experience of volunteering will be a rewarding one! Come join us and make some lasting memories. We also offer mileage reimbursement! Please call Dana Dillon, Volunteer Coordinator at 732-974-2545 or e-mail through Volunteer Match.
08882.title: Hospice Palliative Support  Volunteers

10523.description: Seeking a volunteer who is willing to come in 1 - 2 days per week for 3 - 4 hours to assist in our Clinical Service Department by creating and scanning patient charts. Days and hours flexible.
10523.title: Office Volunteer

10523.description: Help Save Lives! Join the New York Blood Center Volunteer Team in the Hudson Valley area. Educate others about the importance of donating blood and enhance the donor experience at a blood drive. Greet and register donors, provide for donor safety by escorting and monitoring donors post donation. All volunteers are required to complete a volunteer application, a criminal background check and attend a 2 hour training/orientation session. Flexible assignments to choose from right in your own community.
10523.title: Ambassador Volunteer - Westchester Cnty

10522.description: Establish a long-term one-on-one relationship with a youth who is in need of a role model, friend and caring adult. Share your world with a youngster by taking him to a baseball game, bringing him to a family cookout, helping him write a poem or taking him fishing for the first time. You might encourage him to aim for college, introduce him to the world of work or listen to his dreams, his hopes and his fears. Minimum time requirement is ten hours per month with a commitment of one year. The Mentoring Program is ideal if you are over the age of 24. You would be matched with youth between the ages of 15 and 24. You may meet youngsters on our Dobbs Ferry campus, in the community or New York City. Visits are planned according to your schedule. You will give a youngster the opportunity to establish a meaningful friendship. The focus of the relationship may be social, educational or career-oriented. Matches are made based on
10522.title: Connections Mentoring

10303.description: When City Harvest was founded in 1982, it was run entirely by volunteers who connected a handful of neighborhood restaurants to food programs serving those in need. Now, more than 30 years later, City Harvest volunteers remain a critical part of our food rescue operations and our comprehensive Healthy Neighborhoods programming. Our two Mobile Markets on the North Shore of Staten Island are in high need of volunteers! Mobile Markets are bi-monthly farmer’s market style distribution of fresh produce to residents of our Healthy Neighborhoods. As a volunteer, you will help distribute thousands of pounds of fresh fruits and vegetables to over 400 families. Mobile Markets are a great opportunity to directly interact with the communities that City Harvest serves! The Stapleton and Mariner’s Harbor Mobile Markets take place from 8:45 AM-12:00 PM, one weekday and one Saturday a month. Volunteers will be able to complete an orientation online for this opportunity! Email volunteerservices@cityharvest.org for details on how to get involved!
10303.title: Fight Hunger in Staten Island!

06840.description: Bring your enthusiasm for and experience with beading and simple jewelry making to a group of adult patients (age 18+) in one of our transitional living programs. The ideal time for this group will be on Friday morning at 10:00 a.m. or on the weekends. Your and other volunteers' ongoing weekly presence offers you and the patients an opportunity to develop a rapport and to pick up any threads of conversations from the previous weeks. It's all in good fun and gives patients a creative, relaxing outlet. To ensure that you will have what you need each time you volunteer, you may select simple supplies and the hospital will reimburse you for your purchases. We hope to hear from you soon!
06840.title: Beading/jewelry making group

06840.description: Share your love and experience with dance and movement with the teens in our adolescent transitional living program. We have carved out Thursday at 1:00 p.m. as the ideal time to include a volunteer but if you are not available at this time, we could hopefully create a time that works for you. Ideally you have taken some creative movement and dance classes in your community or at school and have some experience teaching others. Volunteers are required to attend a hospital orientation (the first Monday of the month except when this Monday falls on a holiday then the training is on the second Monday of the month) and also submit to a criminal background check. Please tell us more about your personal and professional background and send a resume to lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or call 203-801-2320 for additional information.
06840.title: Movement/Dance Group for Adolescent Program

06840.description: We are seeking two volunteers to share a weekly schedule to lead a gentle movement or stretching group for the adult men and women in our eating disorder program. Experience teaching yoga, movement, dance, exercise, or meditation is preferred. Some possible times are Tuesday at 10:15 a.m. or Thursday at 7:00 p.m. We offer new volunteers an opportunity to attend a hospital orientation that is held on the first Monday of the month (except when the first Monday of the month a holiday Monday, then it will be held the second Monday of the month). You will have the opportunity to learn more about all of our hospital programs, as well as hospital policies and procedures. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320 to set up an interview. We hope to hear from you soon!
06840.title: Gentle Movement Group (Eating Disorder Program)

06840.description: We are seeking a few volunteers to take turns facilitating a mindfulness writing group for our adult men and women patients in the eating disorder program. Our preferred time is Thursday at 7:00-8:00 p.m. Experience with facilitating or teaching a group of any kind is preferable and of course, you must love to read and write! We have some existing formats of writing groups that have been held in the past and also welcome your ideas. Mature college and graduate students, teachers and anyone else who would like to share their passion for writing is welcome to apply. We offer new volunteers an opportunity to attend a hospital orientation that is held on the first Monday of the month (except when the first Monday of the month a holiday Monday, then it will be held the second Monday of the month). You will have the opportunity to learn more about all of our hospital programs, as well as hospital policies and procedures. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320 to set up an interview. We hope to hear from you soon!
06840.title: Writing Group for Eating Disorder Program (Thursday evening)

06840.description: Volunteers and their dogs who have been certified by a pet therapy program (e.g., Good Dog Foundation, Pet Partners, Therapy Dogs International) visit with their dogs on Wednesday and/or Saturday mornings in one or two of our patient programs. All visits are approximately 30 minutes in length and are in a group setting. New volunteers will receive an orientation from the director of volunteer services and supervision by our staff during each pet therapy visit. We love pet therapy at Silver Hill! We hope to hear from you soon and have you join our existing pet therapy team. If you have a loveable dog and would like to learn more about how to become a certified pet therapy team, contact the pet therapy certification programs listed above to learn more. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero 203-801-2320 or lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org for additional information about the pet therapy program and pet therapy visit schedule at Silver Hill Hospital.
06840.title: Seeking certified pet therapy teams!

06840.description: We are seeking mature college students, recent college graduates or graduate students who are interested in the mental health field and who would like to volunteer to support our teen patients (ages 13-17) during their school time period on weekday mornings (Monday-Friday 9:15-11:15 a.m.). Volunteers choose the days they are available and work with the teacher to support teen patients while they complete homework assignments or engage in other structured activities (puzzles, arts/crafts, board games). Volunteers provide supportive, positive dialogues that motivate and support our youngest patients who are in treatment for a psychiatric or addictive disorder. After being selected for this position, volunteers must complete a one-day hospital orientation that takes place on the first Monday of the month (except on holiday Mondays). Candidates must also provide one written reference and provide documentation of a negative PPD (TB screening). We look forward to hearing from you. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320.
06840.title: School Time/Group Activity Assistant-Adolescent Program

06840.description: Please volunteer at Silver Hill to share your love of baking and some simple recipes that allow a group of patients enjoy Friday or Sunday morning with you, each other and the staff. Our baking group volunteers arrive at 10:45 a.m. to set everything up in the kitchen of a residential program. You will teach the residents how to follow a recipe, organize the ingredients, and end up with a tasty (and sometimes healthy) treat for all to enjoy. You select the recipe and we will buy the ingredients or you may do so and we will reimburse you. You do not have to be a professional pastry chef; however you should be mature and comfortable with yourself and others. Ideally, we would like you to participate in one of our hospital orientations that take place on the first Monday of the month (except holiday Mondays). A background check (hospital conducts) and a current reference (you provide) are required.
06840.title: Calling All Bakers-Friday or Sunday morning!

06840.description: Show patients in our new residential eating disorders program located on the second floor of our Main House how to knit and to also appreciate the value of knitting. Choose Monday, Tuesday OR Friday from 6:30-7:30 pm to offer your talents and supportive conversation. Your ongoing (weekly) presence offers you and the patients an opportunity to develop a rapport and to pick up any threads of conversations from the previous weeks. It's all in good fun and gives patients a creative outlet for eating disorder recovery. To ensure that you will have what you need each time you volunteer, you will select easy to use (simple) knitting supplies and yarn and the hospital will reimburse you for your purchases. Hospital orientation and criminal background check are required and ongoing volunteer supervision is provided.
06840.title: Knit One, Purl Two: Teach Knitting to Patients

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors to the inpatient adolescent unit during regularly scheduled family programs and visiting hours on the weekends (12:45-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available weekend dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Adolescent Unit-Greet Visitors on Weekends

06840.description: We seek mature individuals to share their love of art in a relaxed home atmosphere with adult patients on Mondays at 10:00 a.m. You do not have to be a professional artist; however, if you love art, you have likely been dabbling in it for a while as a hobby or in a classroom setting. Alternate your volunteer schedule with other volunteers who also support this program that provides an enjoyable pastime for our patients. Hospital orientation required and ongoing supervision is provided. Please tell us more about yourself by writing to volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Monday 10:00 a.m. Art Group for DBT Program

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill Hospital who are struggling with addiction or psychiatric illness engage in many therapeutic activities, including volunteer-led groups that also allow volunteers to share a hobby, pasttime or talent. We are seeking volunteers to share their love of music and their musical talents (e.g., voice, guitar, keyboard) once or twice per month on an ongoing basis on Tuesday or Wednesday before lunchtime. You don't have to be a virtuoso, concert master or a stage performer, but you should be comfortable working in a group setting and have a relaxed, warm manner. We will provide you with an orientation and staff support. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at 203-801-2320 or volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Do you play an instrument or sing?

06840.description: Using any format that you practice, lead a 30-45 minute group of adult patients in a seated movement and/or meditation session that helps patients achieve a more relaxed state and acquire new skills. You must possess outstanding communication skills, practice meditation in your personal life and be comfortable leading an educational group. All volunteer-led groups are monitored by our professional staff. Hospital orientation and training session required. Must provide one reference and authorize a criminal background check. All volunteers must also have a recent TB screening test (PPD) prior to starting as a volunteer.
06840.title: Meditation/Seated Movement Group Leader

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors for our Main House facility during regularly scheduled family visiting hours and patient dining hours on the weekends (12:30-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Greet Patients & Families During Weekend Visiting Hours

06840.description: Have you made a difference in your community? Here's a great idea, change a life - with just one hour per week you can help a blind person continue toward their goal of independent living. Read their mail, drive them to the grocery store or bank, help them label household items. It's easy and you can set your own schedule! This is a great way to spring into action and dust off to achieve that olde New Year's Resolution to make your world a better place!
06840.title: Spring into Action:  Can You Change a Life in One Hour a Week?
06840.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06840.description: Patients in our Women's Transitional Living Program (28-day program) attend volunteer-led 12-step discussion groups and workshops as part of their therapeutic program and personal recovery journey. Volunteers who are women in recovery play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Volunteers use AA literature like \"Living Sober\" and \"The Big Book \"and discuss a variety of themes/topics, i.e., Slogans, Acceptance, Living Sober, Relapse Prevention with small groups of women at our Barrett House residence
06840.title: Women's Group 12-step Meeting Leader

06840.description: Adolescent patients in treatment for substance abuse disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step based discussion groups as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are also in recovery, active in a 12-step program and working with a Sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of messages of hope, as well as how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available in our adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential, 28-day program).
06840.title: Help Teens Overcome Addiction (12-step group)

06840.description: Patients living with psychiatric disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs designed to augment their medication protocols and provide them with new ways to understand their mental illness, along with better ways to relate and cope. Volunteers, who are living happier lives while in recovery from a psychiatric illness, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and healing, and how they maintain a balanced life while living with a mental illness.
06840.title: Psychiatric Peer Support Group Leader

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step practicum meetings as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are personally active in a 12-step program and are working with a sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available for both adult and adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential).
06840.title: 12-Step Discussion Group Leader

06840.description: Work directly with our patients and recreational therapy staff to provide recreational activities that enrich and enhance our patients' existing treatment programs in our adult psychiatric unit on weekdays at 2:00 p.m.
06840.title: Recreational Group Assistant

06840.description: Join our volunteer team as a Library Resource Assistant! We are seeking volunteers to serve as ambassadors to our residential houses to ascertain the residents' current book preferences and to make these matierials available to them using the resources of our library. The Silver Hill patient library boasts a broad selection of self-help, fiction and nonfiction books, magazines and newspapers for our patients and their families. Your job will be to help bring these resources to the residents in our houses and also help ensure that materials are returned before patients discharge. We prefer volunteers who could be available during the week to interact with patients during their free time (Mon-Fri 10:00-11:30 or late afternoon). Volunteers will receive a hospital orientation (offered on the first Monday of the month 10:00 a.m. to 5:00) and also access to our on-site medical education seminars. This is a great opportunity for a college or graduate student, recent college or graduate school graduate , or individuals wishing to enter the healthcare and mental health field in the areas of nursing, social work, medicine or clinical psychology. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at volunteer@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320. We look forward to hearing from you!
06840.title: Library Resources Assistant/Ambassador

06840.description: We are seeking a few volunteers to assist us with routine office tasks in the social work department, including serving as the front desk receptionist from 12:00-1:00 pm on weekdays when the office manager goes to lunch. Volunteers are scheduled on the weekdays when they are available. Other routine tasks include assembling binders of information for our patients and placing follow up calls to outside professionals to whom we have referred our patients after discharge. We invite all of our new volunteers to attend a hospital orientation which is held on the first Monday of the month (except for Mondays when it is a holiday) from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00. The orientation will familiarize you with our hospital programs and policies and procedures. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320 to set up an interview. We look forward to hearing from you.
06840.title: Social Work Department Assistant

06840.description: The Admissions Office at Silver Hill Hospital is where individuals experiencing distress due to psychiatric or addiction challenges first come to determine where they will be assigned in the hospital to receive the best possible treatment. You will work alongside the admissions staff, who are expertly trained to help people in crisis and to ensure that each patient will receive the most appropriate care. After training as an Admissions Office Greeter, you will use your interpersonal skills and empathy for others to offer support to patients and their families by providing written information, food and beverages, and descriptions of our programs and facilities. Your calm presence and good people instincts will guide you so that patients are made to feel welcome, respected and encouraged. Volunteer candidates are selected on the basis of their maturity, ability to handle sensitive situations in a discreet and professional manner and a willingness to also accept supervision and ongoing feedback.
06840.title: Family & Patient Greeter-Admissions Office

10280.description: WE NEED A SOUND DESIGNER BASED IN NEW YORK TO MIX A LOW BUDGET DOCUMENTARY-- A ONE HOUR BIOGRAPHICAL FILM WHICH WAS PREVIOUSLY MIXED BUT SINCE WE MADE SOME ADDITIONAL EDITING CHANGES, IT NOW NEEDS ANOTHER PASS.
10280.title: FILM SOUND DESIGNER

10280.description: WE NEED A LOGO DESIGNER TO COME UP WITH A CONCEPT /DESIGN A LOGO FOR A FILM COMPANY WHICH WE WILL BE USING FOR THE PRODUCTION OF A LOW BUDGET FEATURE FILM.
10280.title: LOGO DESIGNER

10528.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
10528.title: Harrison, NY: Autism Volunteer

07457.description: Change a life, it's forever! Become a Girl Scouts volunteer and use your expertise, skills, interest and life experience as a coach, mentor or advisor. Inspire and empower girls ages 5-17 to have a fun and enriching leadership experience as they reach their personal best.
07457.title: Volunteer - Direct Services to girls (work with girls)
07457.org: Girl Scouts of Northern New Jersey

07452.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07452.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Glen Rock

10118.description: Be our community champion! Community Options seeks business people to help further its mission. Among the goals set for the Business Advisory Council, or COBAC: To assist Community Options staff in its fundraising endeavors, To assist Community Options staff in networking with the business community, To help individuals with disabilities integrate into their communities, To ensure utmost quality in Community Options services, To educate local business owners and the corporate sector about persons with disabilities and the role that the business community can play in their lives, To attain a societal understanding and acceptance of a person with a disability as a productive member of the community. As a member of COBAC in your community, you're our champion! Join us today. Learn more about COBAC here: http://www.comop.org/get-involved/cobac/
10118.title: Business Advisory Council Committee - NYC

11577.description: Volunteers needed for social media writing and grant applications. Help Hair We Share raise the money necessary to create the wigs we give away free. Call donors from our data base to appeal for sponsorships both corporate and individual. Fill out grant forms for Fundraising events such as Airlines and other branded corportations.
11577.title: Fundraisers needed to help write grant applications

10115.description: The Farm Site Assistant will support the Corbin Hill Site Coordinator in managing distribution at a Farm Share location. The Farm Site Assistant should feel comfortable engaging Shareholders and co-facilitating distribution. This is a perfect volunteer position for those who are passionate about working with communities and are passionate about local food systems, food justice, health disparities, public health, and nutrition. Farm Site Assistants will receive complimentary fresh produce when they participate at sites. RESPONSIBILITIES: Support the logistics of distribution through: s et-up, review distribution list, review share composition, arrange and display produce, and assist Shareholders to collect their items. Support Shareholder Engagement by c reating a warm and engaging community at site by building connections with Shareholders, and inquiring about tastes and offering recipes.
10115.title: Farm Site Assistant

10115.description: Lutheran Social Services of New York has an opportunity for a Office Assistant/Recptionist volunteer, to start immediately. This is a great opportunity to develop your skills while you are supporting our Programs. we need a highly motivated, well-spoken, energetic, detail oriented individual who is comfortable and effective in a support position and able to excel in a fast-paced, creative environment. The office assistant will welcome visitors and directs phone calls to appropriate staff extensions. Assist by overseeing the general appearance and functionality of office space, also providing general support for other staff when needed.
10115.title: Office Assistant/Reception
10115.org: Lutheran Social Services of New York

10115.description: Our online platforms help us to service families, children, adults and seniors in need. We are looking to further develop and optimize our websites and Social Media Platforms. Are you experienced with web programming and/or Social Media Platform design? We would love to hear from you.
10115.title: Web development /Design /programming support - Please help us help those in need
10115.org: Lutheran Social Services of New York

11572.description: Volunteers needed to round on patients, offering blankets, pillows, water if permitted. Navigating visitors throughout Emergency Department and hospital areas. Assisting medical staff with running errands to Dietary, Admitting and all other areas of the hospital. Replenishing supplies as needed.
11572.title: Emergency Room Volunteers

11572.description: The Clerical Assistant will assist with clerical duties such as filing and collating, assisting with phone coverage and data entry.
11572.title: Clerical Assistant- Employee Health Services

11570.description: Be a part of our teaching initiative to inspire science learning in people of all ages. We are specifically looking for volunteers to assist on weekdays between 10am-4pm. Our three opportunities include animal care, desk attendant and exhibit interpreter. Our animal care volunteers help feed and clean the animals in our care as we prepare for renovations. The desk attendant will be the first face guests see, help answer our busy phone lines and greet our Nursery School families as they arrive. Lastly, exhibit interpreters will engage with guests in our new Dinosaur! Exhibit which opens in the fall. We are searching for interested individuals who would like to get their foot in the door at the beginning!
11570.title: Weekday Volunteer - Desk Attendant, Animal Care, Exhibit Interpreter
