Session I: October- December 2017, 9 Saturdays 9am - 12:45 pm Session II: January - April 2018, 13 Saturdays 9am - 12:45 pm GO School Fall Session Dates 2017 Oct 14, 21, 28 Nov 4, 11, 18 Dec 2, 9, 16 GO School Spring Session Dates 2018 Jan 6, 20, 27 Feb 3, 10, 24 March 3, 10, 17, 24 April 7, 14, 21 Locations Manhattan Locations: Avenues-the World School (1st - 5th Grade): 259 10 th Avenue, between 25 th and 26 th Streets Grace Church School (1st - 5th Grade): 86 4 th Avenue, between 10 th and 11 th Streets Grace Church High School (6th - 8th Grade): 46 Cooper Square, at 6 th Street LREI (1st - 5th Grade): 272 6 th Avenue, at the corner of Bleecker Street St. Luke’s (1st - 3rd Grade): 487 Hudson Street, at Hudson Street and Christopher Street Brooklyn Location: Berkeley Carroll (1 st - 2nd Grade): 701 Carroll Street, between 6 th & 7 th Ave Placement is based on a complimentary match between programmatic need and volunteer strengths. We will honor preferences when possible. Qualifications: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Interest in strength-based collaborative work, education and social services. Ability to speak Spanish. Prior experience in simultaneous and consecutive interpretation is a plus. Personal Attributes: The ideal candidate is exceptionally intelligent, warm, engaging and energetic. He or she also: Sees the possibilities as opposed to the obstacles and is creative and tenacious in solving problems. Enjoys working with others in a collaborative, creative environment. Has a strong work ethic and high standards for his/her own work and the work of others; is flexible and has a lively sense of humor. Benefits: How Can We Help YOU Personal gratification through enhancing the lives of young learners. Ongoing professional development and training opportunities. Leadership opportunities for sustained dedication and commitment. Being part of a vibrant and diverse volunteer community. How to Apply Application Form Cover Letter/Personal Statement explaining why you want to volunteer with the GO Project Resume (for volunteers 18 and older)/ High school transcript (for HS students) Personal reference Background check (for those 18 and older) If interested, please fill out the online form at: https://goo.gl/forms/iGs9YOzEUsNCujrk2 . The online application form can also be found on the GO Project website: goprojectnyc.org under \"Get Involved\" and \"Volunteer Opportunities.\" If you have any questions or would like more information about the available volunteer positions, please contact Emily Ong, Community Engagement Program Manager, at eong@goprojectnyc.org.
10014.title: Saturday Spanish Translator Needed!

10014.description: GO Project: Who We Are and What We Do The GO Project shapes the futures of low-income New York City public school children by providing critical academic, social and emotional support starting in the early elementary years. GO provides year-round educational and family support services to children who are performing below grade level and equips them with the confidence and skills needed to succeed at school, at home and in life. GO School Tutoring: How YOU Can Help During the GO School Saturday program, a professional teacher models a lesson, activity or project to a classroom of students. Volunteer tutors continue to work with small groups of (2) to (4) students on the lesson providing individualized attention which allows the students to thrive. Tutor Responsibilities Tutor small group of students in grades 1 st-8 th who are in need of academic intervention under Head Teacher’s guidance Punctual and consistent attendance; no more than 3 absences permitted per session. (Session 1: Oct-Dec, Session 2: Jan-April) Actively and enthusiastically participate - supporting instruction and engagement Help prepare, record and put away classroom materials Ongoing communication with Head Teacher regarding children’s progress &/or concerns, and with the Director of Community Engagement regarding overall volunteer experience. Time Commitment Session I: October- December 2017, 9 Saturdays 9am - 12:45 pm Session II: January - April 2018, 14 Saturdays 9am - 12:45 pm Attend mandatory orientation and training prior to start of session. *You can choose to be a Committed Volunteer to come each Saturday with 3 allowed absences per session, or a Floater Volunteer to come on the Saturdays that you are available. GO School Fall Session Dates 2017 Oct 14, 21, 28 Nov 4, 11, 18 Dec 2, 9, 16 GO School Spring Session Dates 2018 Jan 6, 20, 27 Feb 3, 10, 24 March 3, 10, 17, 24 April 7, 14, 21 Locations You can choose to tutor our students at one of the following 6 locations: Manhattan Locations: Avenues-the World School (1st - 5th Grade): 259 10 th Avenue, between 25 th and 26 th Streets Grace Church School (1st - 5th Grade): 86 4 th Avenue, between 10 th and 11 th Streets Grace Church High School (6th - 8th Grade): 46 Cooper Square, at 6 th Street LREI (1st - 5th Grade): 272 6 th Avenue, at the corner of Bleecker Street St. Luke’s (1st - 3rd Grade): 487 Hudson Street, at Hudson Street and Christopher Street Brooklyn Location: Berkeley Carroll (1 st - 2nd Grade): 701 Carroll Street, between 6 th & 7 th Ave Placement is based on a complimentary match between programmatic need and volunteer strengths. We will honor preferences when possible. Qualifications College students, professionals, retirees, and high school students in good academic standing. Commitment to and belief in all children’s ability to succeed and thrive Professional work habits Benefits: How Can We Help YOU Personal gratification through enhancing the lives of young learners. Ongoing professional development and training opportunities. Leadership opportunities for sustained dedication and commitment. Being part of a vibrant and diverse volunteer community. How to Apply Application Form Cover Letter/Personal Statement explaining why you want to volunteer with the GO Project Resume (for volunteers 18 and older)/ High school transcript (for HS students) Personal reference Background check (for those 18 and older) If interested, please fill out the online form at: https://goo.gl/forms/iGs9YOzEUsNCujrk2 . The online application form can also be found on the GO Project website: goprojectnyc.org under \"Get Involved\" and \"Volunteer Opportunities.\" If you have any questions or would like more information about the available volunteer positions, please contact Emily Ong, Community Engagement Program Manager, at eong@goprojectnyc.org.
10014.title: Help a Child Love to Learn: Volunteer Tutor with GO Project!

10014.description: Rescue leftover pastries from being thrown out and deliver them to Judson Memorial Church, located at 55 Washington Square S, New York, NY 10012! Light weight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is between 10-20 pounds. Sign up directly on our website: https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/38768 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/38768 https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/events/38770
10014.title: Food rescue event in Greenwich Village on Monday's at 9:30!

10014.description: This opportunity is available daily from 9:10 PM-9:40 PM! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and feeding the hungry. We are currently looking for Lead Rescuers to join our leadership team. A Lead Rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week, the same evert every week. Training is provided. Help rescue healthy roasted vegetables and protein that would have been thrown away and bring it to a nearby homeless shelter to feet those who need it the most! This opportunity is available in both Midtown East and the Village. Heavyweight: the average amount of food is a total of 60 1bs
10014.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for 9:10PM-9:40PM Food Rescue Events!

10014.description: No Walkathon is currently scheduled and we seek someone with skill and interest to do substantial leadership work in organizing one. IMPORTANT: For most activities, we require at least a year of experience - and several years for some activities. Except for those with high level, professional skills, we ask most volunteers to average at least 15 hours a week. Some exceptions to these guidelines are possible. You can speak with us about this before you come in. If possible, please include your resume.
10014.title: The End Poverty Walkathon

08840.description: Growing nonprofit needs volunteers to help develop and assist Executive Director with various duties. Help includes soliciting donations, distributing materials to local businesses, devleloping community partnerships, help with events, etc.
08840.title: Development Assistant

08844.description: Our cancer charity need an experienced, super creative, graphic artist to design flyers and t-shirts for our up coming events.
08844.title: Graphic Artist

08844.description: The signature fundraising event of Community Options, Cupid's Chase, is an annual 5K run on Valentine's Day weekend in more than 35 locations across the country. While its purpose is serious - raising funds to better the lives of individuals with disabilities through employment and housing supports - the race itself is fun and whimsical. Registrants identify themselves as either looking for love (Available) or already in love (Unavailable.) Some runners get really into Cupid character - we've seen many a pink tutu on the course. Our volunteer committee is crucial to the success of the race - without volunteers, we simply would not have the ability to hold this great event. Whether you have an hour a week to spare or lots of time on your hands, have some background in either race (or walk) planning or participation, we need YOU! Please help us improve the day to day lives of the individuals we serve and have some fun, too. Looking for people with strengths in the following areas: event logistics, publicity, sponsorship solicitation, refreshment acquisition, entertainment, fundraising, volunteer management.
08844.title: 5K Race Committee - Central NJ

07444.description: Grace Healthcare Services welcomes is looking for Hospice volunteers. We welcome your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give gunconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07444.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed!

07444.description: Stella Therapy Riding in Pompton Plains NJ is looking for volunteers to assist with therapeutic horseback riding lessons. This is a very rewarding program to be involved in. You will learn about horses and at the same time help a student learn how to ride horses. Sessions start in September and conclude in June. The riding year is ended with our Stella Showcase which is a yearly show we organize giving our riders the opportunity to showcase their talents to all of their family and friends. Volunteers must have the reliability, strength, endurance and communication skills necessary to assist participants during lesson activities.
07444.title: Bring the joy of horses to adults and children with disabilities!

06912.description: MusicLink is in need of music teachers in Connecticut. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check. Please see our website for more information: www.musiclinkfoundation.org.
06912.title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children

10279.description: Overview: The Guardianship Project’s volunteer program aims to assist our case managers in providing more frequent, friendly interaction with our clients. Volunteers not replace our current case managers visit Social interaction among the elderly and disabled greatly improves not only their quality of life, but their physical and mental health. Volunteers will offer clients with yet another friendly face from The Guardianship Project. This position helps extend the resources of The Guardianship Project to better assist our clients. Title: Friendly Visitor Work location: Variable (dependent on client location) Purpose of the position: The friendly visitor will serve as a companion to clients of The Guardianship Project. Volunteers will engage clients in activities like reading a book, talking, or just being a friendly face. Volunteers will be matched to clients on a 1:1 basis. Volunteers will visit clients weekly, for 30-60 minutes each time. Visits will take place where the client resides. Responsibilities and duties: Complete initial orientation/training and attend quarterly meetings of volunteers (quarterly sessions are optional unless otherwise noted) Establish a friendly relationship with an adult with multiple disabilities Engage clients in activities pertaining to their interests Offer companionship and friendship Visit clients weekly and provide friendly social interaction Notify the volunteer coordinator in a timely manner of any concerns about clients or absences from visits Provide ongoing communication to the Volunteer Coordinator Qualifications: Good listening skills; friendliness, patience and tact Must be dependable and punctual Ability to work cooperatively with a wide variety of individuals, including people with significant physical and mental impairments and varying socio-economic backgrounds Ability to hold information in confidence Strong desire to help people and to further the goals of the monitoring project Willingness to provide own transportation to make visits Experience with developmental disabilities and/or mental illness is not required Background check required Volunteer feedback: Feedback is essential for maintaining the success of our program. After each client visit volunteers are expected to fill out and return to the Volunteer Coordinator, via email, our feedback form. Age requirement: Volunteers must be at least 18 years of age. Commitment expected: A commitment of at least 6 months is expected. Contribute 2-4 hours per month; flexible schedule depending on clients’ schedules. Training: Volunteers must attend an initial Guardianship Project orientation and training session Ongoing support is tailored to each volunteers’ needs Ongoing trainings are held every 12 weeks, and are optional for attendance Training and supervision provided by Rebecca Dealy, Volunteer Coordinator
10279.title: Friendly Visiting

10278.description: Score NYC is the local chapter servicing the NYC business community. We have over 90 members. Currently we are seeking a dynamic digital marketing professional, to lead our digital efforts. Volunteering at SCORE is one of the ways for you to give back to our community, stay connected with business leaders, and use your knowledge and expertise to bring SCORE’s resources to the next generation of entrepreneurs in your community. We hope to hear from you. RESPONSIBILITIES: Partner with the Marketing Chair in formulating a high impact, multi-channel marketing program Lead digital advertising initiative on Google Adwords and Facebook to increase workshop attendance, mentoring clientele, participation at major trade events, and volunteer signup Monitor, analyze and optimize ad performance and landing page effectiveness to maximize ROI Develop and lead a content marketing strategy; work with key constituents to create content and publish to our blog and other relevant platforms Manage our local chapter website and analyze web traffic to improve user experience and optimize for search and conversion Help create and lead an internal team of volunteers to execute and sustain this initiative VOLUNTEER REQUIREMENTS - 3+ years of experience creating, implementing, and tracking results of a targeted digital marketing program Fluency with Wordpress, Google Analytics, Hootsuite; Familiarity with SEOMoz, Leadpages, RiteTag, Semrush, etc.; Knowledge of HTML/CSS a plus Experienced in blogging, use of Google Adwords and paid ads on Facebook Attendance at marketing committee meetings, usually 2 hours each, once a month, at 26 Federal Plaza NYC, during business week Time commitment of 8-10 hours per week. Work is flexible and can be done virtually. TO APPLY - Email to: VOLUNTEERNOW@scorenyc.org ** your resume, a brief note regarding the number of hours you could volunteer each week AND please let us know the days and times you are NOT available. Any personal information you feel would help us get to know you better, including the circumstances that allow you to volunteer at this point in your life. Best day and time for you to come in to meet our team Your contact information ** Interviews for this position will be conducted by MARY TAN so please email both volunteernow@scorenyc.org and tan@scorenyc.org
10278.title: Volunteer - Digital Strategist

10278.description: Volunteer Opportunity for: Corporate Directors and Senior Management Consultants Position: Practice Leader, Advisory Board Practice to Small to Medium-size Enterprises in Manhattan, Brooklyn and The Bronx. Background: For over 50 years, SCORE Mentors have been providing counsel and assistance to thousands of entrepreneurs and small business owners across New York City. Some SCORE client firms have grown to the point that they need to add outside perspective and expertise to help them shape their business strategy and to keep them looking beyond managing their companies on a day to day basis to focus on the broader picture. SCORE NYC seeks to recruit an experienced corporate director or management consultant to create this practice. Responsibilities: With the ability to schedule this SCORE volunteer commitment around your available time, and working closely with SCORE NYC's senior leadership: Lead the effort to develop this Advisory Board practice; including identifying contacting, and persuading established businesses that they in fact would be well served by creating an Advisory Board Create ideal candidate profiles for members of the Advisory Board team; Build a roster of potential Advisory Board members from the current roster of SCORE Interview Mentors and qualified external recruits; Create practices and standards necessary to build a resource that will serve SCORE NYC's clients with distinction; Serve on one or multiple Advisory Boards in order to set a high level of service to SCORE's clients; Contribute to the strength and growth of SCORE New York through adding your management expertise to this totally volunteer organization. Ideal Candidate Profile: 30+ years as a business leader; Senior experience in general management, or on board(s) of directors, or in management consulting; An ability to quickly assess business opportunities and problems; Excellent listening skills and the ability to act as a responsible advisor; Ability to establish rapport with successful entrepreneurs and small business leaders. A real desire to help others succeed. Compensation: Volunteering at SCORE is one of the ways for you to give back to your community, connect with fellow business leaders, and pass on your knowledge and expertise to the next generation of entrepreneurs in your community. Enjoy the satisfaction of contributing to the success of others; Share great experience with other SCORE volunteers and make new friends; Provide leadership for the local business community; Participate in life-long learning, growing professionally and personally. To learn more about SCORE NYC, go to www.newyorkcity.scorenyc.org and If you’d like to discuss this opportunity to serve the New York business community: EMAIL: humanresources@scorenyc.org or CALL: Diane Drey, Score NYC Chapter Chair at 212-264-4507
10278.title: Volunteer - Advisory Board Member - for established businesses

10278.description: POSITION: Human Resources Manager for 100-person Volunteer Organization WORK SCHEDULE: Set your own hours; work from our headquarters in lower Manhattan or from home. THE ORGANIZATION: SCORE, is a national business mentoring organization with 300+ offices and 11,000+ volunteers. It's mission is to provide FREE one-on-one confidential business counseling and affordable, skills-based workshops to small business owners and those wishing to start a business. SCORE NYC has five convenient offices located in Brooklyn, Bronx and Manhattan. Annually, it assists over 5,000 clients and conducts in excess of 8,000 client mentoring sessions THE CHALLENGE: We are continually looking for new members who are at at or near to retirement. We seek a Human Resource professional who can help us grow our volunteer resources through proactive recruitment efforts. The professional will create and execute a plan to recruit business executives and senior managers and professionals as our front-line volunteer mentors. THE OPPORTUNITY: To have a major impact on the growth of SCORE NYC and be the senior HR right hand to its Chairperson. COMPENSATION: This is a volunteer position. But the psychic rewards can be great: ■ Enjoy the satisfaction of being a key driver of the growth of an important contributor to NYC’s business health; ■ Share great experience with other SCORE volunteers and make new friends; ■ Provide leadership for the local business community; ■ Participate in lifelong learning, growing professionally and personally. RESPONSIBILITIES: With the ability to schedule your SCORE commitment to your personal convenience: ■ Work with the Chair to establish the specifics of a recruitment plan; ■ Work with senior SCORE Mentors to leverage their contacts as recruitment tools; ■ Establish relationships with other senior HR executives to spread the word of SCORE’s need; ■ Devise and execute the optimum use of social media to achieve our recruitment goals; ■ Devise strategies to enlist the aid of executive recruiters and outplacement firms to achieve our recruitment goals; ■ Contribute to the strength and growth of SCORE New York through adding your management expertise to this totally volunteer organization. IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE: • 5+ years experience working in the Human Resource field; • Availability to volunteer for 10+ hours per month • Willingness to participate in an orientation program (approx 40 hours - can be spread out over multiple weeks) • Desire to give back to the business community and work with other professional volunteers
10278.title: Human Resources & Recruitment Opportunity

10278.description: We are looking for an organized computer literate person who can assist in the prepartion and administration of the business workshops we put on annually for entrepreneurs. In addition to helping us you will have the opportunity to attend the workshops for free - so this is perfect opportunity for someone that is interested in going into business or having a business career. The workshops offerings cover 25 subject areas including marketing and sales, finance and accounting, leadership and management, and industry specific workshops. The Workshop Committee, which organizes these educational experiences needs qualified volunteer with event planning skills to participate in the team effort. AS EVENT COORDINATOR YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES ARE: Prepare the materials which will be distributed at the workshops Arrive at the workshop 45 minutes in advance to Meet and Greet the participants, check them in Make sure participants have paid the proper fee Collect and tally surveys on the workshop Prepare statistical information Introduce speakers (optional) REQUIREMENTS We seek individuals who can CONSISTENTLY volunteer four hours a week. Workshops are primarily given during the business day, although some are in the early evening.
10278.title: Volunteer - Event Planner - for Business Seminars

10278.description: We have an immediate opening for an administrative assistant to support our non-profit organization that mentors small businesses and start-ups. This is a key role because it is often the first point of contact for clients and volunteers visiting or calling our main offices. It also provides important support for the Membership and Workshop Committees. Responsibilities include - answering the telephone, - preparing promotional material, - responding to client inquiries, - assisting with workshop registrations - attending events and meeting and greeting prospective clients - assisting the mentors with a variety of administrative and computer tasks. We seek individuals who can consistently commit to at least one \"five hours per week\" at our downtown office. By joining our organization you will be making a significant contribution to New York City's small business community.
10278.title: Volunteer Administrative Assistant and Reception

10475.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Bronx: Tiara Moultrie, Coordinator of Volunteer Services; (347) 988-4043 or tmoultri@mjhs.org.
10475.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in the Bronx!

10475.description: Purpose Lead a weekly class to increase seniors’ knowledge of computers and internet applications. Responsibilities Create weekly lessons for a small group of seniors with varied computer abilities Guide seniors step by step through Microsoft office, navigating the internet and composing emails Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Additional tasks may include assistance with cell phones and iPads Skills Have a good general knowledge of computer operations including internet applications and Microsoft Office. Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Patience Strong communication skills Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens.
10475.title: Computer Coach - JASA Dreiser Senior Center

10474.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10474.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 48 Joseph R. Drake, NYC)

10474.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
10474.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (Hyde Leadership Charter, Bronx)

10474.description: West Side Campaign Against Hunger Mission Through a supermarket-style food pantry, West Side Campaign Against Hunger alleviates hunger and creates a culture that promotes self-reliance and works for change. West Side Campaign Against Hunger changes our perception of hungry people by working in partnership with them, providing food with dignity, and empowering customers to find solutions. Mobile Pantry Program Overview Our new Mobile Pantry Program works in partnerships with other agencies (Community Based Non-profits, Health Centers, Churches, and Senior Centers) bringing our customer-choice pantry model to neighborhoods in need, while making sure our customers are connected to resources in their neighborhoods. The Mobile Pantry is a specially designed truck staffed with a Pantry Manager/Driver, Community Resource Counselor, and Program Manager. Location & Shifts: 309 Drake Street Bronx, NY, 10474 Mondays, 9:30am-1pm/1:30-5pm Qualifications/Requirements: Must be at least 18 years old Experience working at a supermarket or food pantry preferred, though not required. Excellent communication and organizational skills Ability to lift up to 25lbs Can-do attitude and flexibility General understanding of food income insecurity and how it affects New York City. Responsibilities: Participate in an orientation before start date Assist MP staff with receiving food from our suppliers Ensure food is examined and apply quality control as needed Organize and repack inventory Assist with cleaning Participate in special projects based on need HOW TO APPLY Please contact Becker Rosales at brosales@wscah.org.
10474.title: Volunteer with WSCAH Mobile Pantry!

11520.description: Do you love photography? Are you always looking to add to your portfolio or give back to the local community? The Book Fairies may be your perfect match! We need a photographer for the second Sunday of the month any time between 10am - 2pm. Teachers and nonprofits \"shop\" for books to distribute to underprivileged children. Shoot one event or shoot multiple events throughout the year. We also have Free Children's Book Fairs where children \"shop\" for books to start their own home library. This is an awesome event and we are looking to capture happy faces receiving books for the first time. These events occur a few times a year, typically on a Friday, and are located in Nassau or Suffolk county New York. This can be a regular photography volunteer job or a one time gig. We are open! Contact us today!
11520.title: Photographer for The Book Fairies

11520.description: These small book clubs of 6-8 people offer adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities the opportunity to read for pleasure. Guided by a pair of trained volunteer facilitators, Next Chapter Book Clubs will meet once a week for an hour at select libraries across Long Island.
11520.title: Next Chapter Book Club Facilitator

11520.description: In addition to our one-on-one tutoring program, our brand new Small Group Instruction classes (SGI) are a great opportunity to have a positive impact with multiple students. To participate as a tutor in SGI, you must be a certified teacher and take the SGI Tutor Training Workshop.
11520.title: Small Group Instructor (Certified Teachers Only)

11520.description: Teach literacy skills to adults reading below a 6th grade level and/or English to new English language learners. Opportunity welcomes creativity and initiative! Volunteers work closely with student's identified goals, which can range from obtaining a job, studying for citizenship, or even reading a bedtime story to a grandchild. No previous experience necessary. You will meet at a library of your choice. Some of our high need areas are New Hyde Park, Westbury, Hicksville, Uniondale, and Freeport. If we don't have a student in your area, you may have to travel to a surrounding library.
11520.title: Adult Literacy Tutor

11520.description: The Special Events Coordinator will help create and plan special events and fundraising opportunities for The Book Fairies. We will supply the volunteers to run the scheduled events. This opportunity can be handled from home, but we request that you live local to Long Island. Average hours per week: 2-5 hours depending on the event.
11520.title: Special Events Coordinator for Book Fairies

11520.description: Help Sort Books Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays 10am-3pm Do you love books? Are you looking for a fun, relaxed and flexible volunteer position? Then, The Book Fairies is the perfect fit! Books keep tumbling into the warehouse and we need dedicated sorters to help fly through the books. We are searching for volunteers to help us on a consistent weekly basis. It would be one day a week or more, your choosing, with flexible hours. We are open Tuesdays through Thursdays from 10am-3pm (stay for the day or choose a few hours). The task is easy, you can sit or stand, no heavy lifting is required as we can bring the books to you. The task involves sorting through the books we receive from school book drives. We check each book for wear and tear and place them into categories from preschool through adult. The best part? You can take home any books you want as payment! Join us for a day and see if it's right for you. We would love to have you!
11520.title: Weekly Book Sorting Position

10472.description: Volunteers are needed at the following locations to help facilitate the \"We Are New York\" conversation program for Intermediate English learners.
10472.title: CONVERSATION GROUP FACILITATOR

10570.description: American Youth Table Tennis Organization and/or ZYP! Sports LLC seeks an aspiring college intern or senior adult with an interest in business and finance to assist the organization with its accounting, bookkeeping, and financial reporting. Primary Duties: Bank Reconciliation, Posting Journal Entries, an Generating Financial Reports, and Assisting The Director. Candidate will learn business accounting and gain valuable business insight into online software - Xero or Quickbooks. As a successful volunteer you will receive full acknowledgement of contributed hours, and opportunity to obtain future references. Position is unpaid, but may lead to a paid position in the future.
10570.title: Financial Reporting, Accounting, Bookkeeping

10570.description: Opportunity: American Youth Table Tennis (AYTTO) and or ZYP! Sports seeks one or two dedicated high school, college or senior volunteers to assist in building the organization / company existing social media and digital marketing strategy. AYTTO is a not for profit organization committed to providing school aged children in New York City an opportunity to participate in engaging after school programs. Our website is www.aytto.org AYTTO. We work in partnership with ZYP Sports, an online table tennis company that has national website. Expectations: The individual who applies for this volunteer position should have an interest and aptidude in social media - YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and in Google, Bing and Amazon digital marketing platforms. As an Intern, you will choose, develop and implement a small marketing campaign and track and analyze results. In the process you learn key marketing, implementing and evaluation techniques prevalent in today's business marketplace. Interns will receive full acknowledgement contributed hours, name recognition on finished product and opportunity to network amongst our friends and ability obtain future references. Position is unpaid (or stipend based), but may lead to a paid position in the future, depending on whether the project can drive additional dollars. For more information contact bennisbet@aytto.org.
10570.title: Social Media,  Digital Media, Data Analytics Internship Positions

10570.description: Opportunity: American Youth Table Tennis (AYTTO) and or ZYP! Sports seeks one or two dedicated high school, college or volunteers to create short table tennis instruction films at the Westchester Table Tennis Center and/or PS 126 in lower Manhattan. About Us: AYTTO is a not for profit organization committed to providing school aged children in New York City an opportunity to participate in engaging after school programs. Our website is www.aytto.org AYTTO has a working partnership with two premier New York City Table tennis clubs - Westchester Table Tennis Center. / www.westchestertabletennis.com/ and SPiN New York www.spinyc.com/. We also have a for profit business, TableTennisStore that sells table tennis equipment nationally. The two businesses are linked. Expectations: The individual who applies for this volunteer position should have an interest in film and film editing and posting these videos to social media. Footage will be shot of children or elite athletes playing table tennis and then edited using computer software and loaded up onto a \"Youtube\" account. As a successful volunteer you will receive full acknowledgement contributed hours, name recognition on finished product and opportunity to future references. Position is unpaid, but may lead to a paid position in the future, depending on whether the project can drive additional donation dollars. For more information contact bennisbet@aytto.org.
10570.title: Film Production - Social Media Internship

10573.description: Open Door needs 1-2 volunteers to read with preschool children and work on coloring sheets while their mother participates in a parenting class as part of our Baby Box Program. The parent will be either in the same room. We will provide training in bringing a book to life for the children and how to be interactive with the story. Volunteers need to enjoy working with young children. Goals: To provide an environment to allow the mother to participate in the parenting program To encourage children to enjoy books and reading, to better prepare them to become Kindergarten Ready. This is part of our Reach Out and Read Program, a national literacy program. Fun coloring sheets and some with targeted messages such as nutrition, wellness and self-esteem. Day: Second Tuesday of each month Time: Shift 1: 12:00pm - 1:30pm Shift 2: 2:00pm - 3:30pm Shift 3: 4:00pm - 5:30pm Location: Port Chester Open Door, 5 Grace Church Street, Port Chester, NY Call: Alicia Ward, Volunteer Coordinator for more information: 914-502-1468 or email: award@odfmc.org Requirements to volunteer: Application Background check 2 References Medical information PPD test and Flu vaccine (free of charge from Open Door if needed) Volunteer Orientation
10573.title: Read to Preschool Children in Port Chester
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10573.description: Love books, love kids, we need you! Volunteers are needed for Open Door Family Medical Centers Reach Out and Read Program. Statics prove that children read to at an early age are more successful in school. You can help change a child's world by becoming a reading volunteer for Open Door's Reach Out and Read Program. Volunteers read aloud with one or more children, model reading techniques for parents and have a conversation about the importance of reading with their children. Our Reach Out and Read Coordinators will train you about working with our families, what books are best by age and more to help you feel ready to make a difference. Wonderful flexible volunteer opportunity for everyone who loves to read and work with children. We are building our team of daytime volunteers especially and can use your help. If you are recently retired or at home and looking for a little something to do, give us a call. Many colleges have approved Reach Out and Read for required course hours. We also use after school support as well, so all of you high school students who need community service hours and are reliable, give our rewarding program a try. L ocations: Port Chester, Ossining, Sleepy Hollow and Mt. Kisco, NY Days/Hours: all business hours Shift: a shift is 1 hour or longer if desired Not sure? Come for a Reach Out and Read trial to see if our environment is a good fit for you. Then all volunteers complete a volunteer application and volunteer Orientation. Open Door Family Medical Centers is a non-profit community-based health organization. We are buliding strong, healthy communities. Join our team! Contact: Alicia Ward, Volunteer Coordinator at award@odfmc.org or call 914-502-1468.
10573.title: You Can Change a Child's World, One Story at a Time in Port Chester
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

07405.description: Matt is a 35 year old man with a mild developmental disability. He lives in a supervised apartment in Butler, NJ and would benefit from a friendship with with a person that would help him feel that he matters to someone as a family member would. He loves to talk about current events and sports, likes to go out to community events of any kind and is friendly and upbeat. He works a few hours a week in Shop Rite but other than this he has limited outside activities since he needs assistance making his way in the world. A weekly phone call from a volunteer would even be enough to put a smile on his face!
07405.title: Friendship will go a long way!

07407.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07407.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Elmwood Park

10080.description: This event is available at different times throughout the week! 5-5:30 PM, every Monday-Friday OR 6-6:30 PM, every Saturday & Sunday! Help get excess bagels donated from a really great food business! The final destination will be the NYC Rescue Mission at 90 Lafayette Street. Middleweight: the average amount of food is 15-20 pounds. Sign up directly on our calendar: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10080.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in FiDi!

07401.description: Be a Hospice Volunteer! Hospice Volunteers are needed for supportive visits to patients, offering emotional support and companionship. Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Jessicalee Huggins 973-916-1400 or email Jessicalee.huggins@cchnet.net
07401.title: Be a hospice volunteer in Bergen County

07728.description: How can you benefit by being a volunteer? Build your resumé - volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Develop interpersonal skills Increase meaning and purpose in your life Experience significant opportunities for growth and development If you are serving field placement or class-required volunteer hours, we are happy to complete any reporting required by your school Connect one-on-one with patients: Visit patients near your school or home Read to patients, engage sensory and emotional memories, assist with life review and activities, give a hand massage Contribute to our patients’ quality of life just by being there We offer you: FREE TB test Extremely flexible assignments - daytime or evening, weekdays or weekends Convenient FREE training that fits your schedule
07728.title: Direct Patient Contact – Perfect for Healthcare Students

07728.description: How can you benefit by being a volunteer? Increase meaning and purpose in your life Feel pride in making an impact Experience significant opportunities for growth and development Be appreciated Be a friendly companion: Visit patients near your school, work, or home Read to patients, engage sensory and emotional memories, assist with life review and activities, give a hand massage Contribute to our patients’ quality of life just by being there We offer you: FREE TB test Extremely flexible assignments - daytime or evening, weekdays or weekends Convenient FREE training that fits your schedule

07728.description: We are looking for someone to screen voice mail, return phone calls and aid our scheduler on a regular basis. There may also be light computer work/data entry and interaction with donors and shoppers. If you enjoy working with people and would like to be part of our daily treasure hunt, we’d love to hear from you. Ideally, we would like volunteers who are willing to commit to a particular day and shift on a recurring basis however we are very open to accomodate your availability. The ReStore is open to the public Wed - Sat from 10am - 5pm. The staff is also there on Tuesdays to accept donations and organize the warehouse. If this sounds like the opportunity to contribute that you've been looking for we'd be happy to meet you! \"You don't have to lift a hammer to help!\"

07728.description: We are looking for a volunteer who would like to commit to working with us on a regular basis to help us develop our volunteer base. We have openings for many volunteer positions and need someone to help us find, train and schedule new volunteers as well as help us to plan and execute volunteer events. Ideally, we would like volunteers who are willing to commit to a particular day and shift on a recurring basis. The ReStore is open to the public Wed - Sat from 10am - 5pm. The staff is also there on Tuesdays to accept donations and organize the warehouse. If this sounds like the opportunity to contribute that you've been looking for we'd love to meet you! \"You don't have to lift a hammer to help!\"
07728.title: Volunteer Recruiter and Scheduler
07728.org: Habitat for Humanity in Monmouth County ReStore

07728.description: We are looking for able-bodied helpers who can move furniture around the showroom, load and unload trucks, assist customers with loading purchases into their vehicles and unloading donations from donor’s vehicles. Ideally, we would like volunteers who are willing to commit to a particular day and shift on a recurring basis. The ReStore is open to the public Wed - Sat from 10am - 5pm. The staff is also there on Tuesdays to accept donations and organize the warehouse. If this sounds like the opportunity to contribute that you've been looking for we'd love to meet you! \"You don't have to lift a hammer to help!\"
07728.title: Warehouse Help - Loading and Unloading
07728.org: Habitat for Humanity in Monmouth County ReStore

07728.description: We are seeking individuals to assist our educators with our highly interactive Traveling Trunk Shows. These programs are presented to school children in the classroom, seniors at senior facilities and/or senior centers, at libraries and to scout groups. This is wonderful opportunity for someone who enjoys working with people. As an assistant to an educator you have the chance to handle artifacts, both reproductions and originals, wear period clothing, be part of a small historical vignette and tell a story. The hours are flexible and full training is provided. Come and be a part of spreading the past!
07728.title: Be the Voice of Yesteryear

07728.description: Monmouth County Historical Association is considered one of the finest mid-size museums in the country. We are seeking volunteers to assist our Administrative & Development Department with general office work; such as filing, bookeeping, typing, mailings etc. The hours are flexible and all skill levels are welcome. Come and be an integral part in keeping the history and culture of our area alive and relevant!
07728.title: Administrative & Development

07728.description: St. Peters Thrift Shop located in downtown Freehold is looking for happy, helpful people to volunteer in our very busy thrift shop. Work the hours that fit your schedule on a weekly basis or on a one time basis. Volunteers will help sort, sell and merchandise items for sale. We cater to a very friendly, appreciative clientele and run a very happy shop. Seniors, teenagers, at home moms....all are encouraged to volunteer!
07728.title: Volunteer at St. Peters Thrift Shop....the happiest shop in Monmouth County

07728.description: We have many volunteer opportunities for history lovers. Openings are available as museum docents, historic house guides, open-hearth cooking assistants, educators for school group programs, interpreters at special event programs, and researchers in our library and archives. We welcome all skill levels. The hours are flexible and training is provided. As part of the MCHA's volunteer staff, you will learn about a diverse number of subjects, gain the opportunity to meet interesting people from all parts of the country, and educate them about the history and cultrue of our area.
07728.title: Bring History Alive!

11411.description: CGI is seeking a Teacher to teach students with our partner corporation After School Program. (Stipend provided). Please contact us at 718-425-0900.
11411.title: Leadership Teacher for Public School

11412.description: MMIC is seeking a security Guard for their NEW After-School Program ASAP. This position will be Monday through Friday. Ideal candidate should possess prior experience. (Documents maybe requested) For more details please contact us at 347-393-9397.
11412.title: Security Guard

11412.description: Seeking a Dance Instructor for our After School Program. This schedule is from Monday through Thursday. Early Childhood experience preferred. Please contact us at 347-393-9397.
11412.title: Dance Instructor

11412.description: Seeking a Percussion Instructor for our Performing Arts After School Program. Please contact us for more details in reference to the schedule at 347-393-9397. (Early Childhood experience preferred)
11412.title: Percussion Instructor

11412.description: Seeking Assistant Program Directors for our After School Program. This schedule will be Monday through Friday. Child Care Experience preferred. Please contact us for more details 347-393-9397.
11412.title: Assistant Program Director

11412.description: About Are you interested in a rewarding field that works closely with individuals who have intellectual and developmental disabilities? Would you like to share your interests with someone who enjoys it just as much as you? Partners Health Plan, a not for profit health plan that supports the lives of individuals with developmental and intellectual disabilities, is looking for volunteers for The PAL Program. The PAL Program discovers a member’s passion, interests, and matches up the individual with a person or place in the community sharing a similar passion or interest. We discover what you enjoy and how it could potentially match with a member of PHP. Member Information 25 year old male who would like to spend time with someone who he goes to the movies with, shopping at the mall, and bowling. He has a mild intellectual disability, is very ambitious and sweet, and is also very independent! How does it work? Meet with individual once a week, or once bi-weekly depending on schedule flexibility First outing will always be accompanied by Community Resource Coordinator Provide your own transportation to meet the individual at the destination Provide your own funding for outings (will only be paying for self, individuals expenses are covered by themselves) Report to community resource coordinator with updates on the progress of outings Form natural friendship with individual based on similar interests Benefits Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of program Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers Hours: Approximately one a week depending on the activity and volunteer schedule Suggested Commitment: 6 months - 1 year PHP provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
11412.title: Movies, Bowling, Dancing!

11413.description: Hi! We are currently looking for passionate volunteers who want to give back to the community through the power of reading. Reading Empowers is a non-profit program for students in elementary school to show them the importance of the power of reading, by making reading fun. We engage students in activities and readings, as well as providing them with new books, and goals, every week to show the community that we can make a difference! Our website: http://www.readingempowers.org/ If you are interested in volunteering, please use the link below to fill out an application, and we will contact you with more information. http://www.readingempowers.org/application
11413.title: Reading Empowers - Volunteer with Children / Saturdays / Queens - P.S. 251

11413.description: Our objective is to provide a positive, nurturing and artistic atmosphere. We are endeavoring to serve you and our community by sharing the gift of dance, helping each person to discover their authentic talent within, and to build confidence in presenting and promoting artistic creativity. Our vision is to see the youth of the Community uplifted, motivated and educated. We believe this will boast self-esteem and confidence. Our goal is to mold individuals that will become assets to the communities in which they reside. This is also an opportunity for all of us to work together to reinforce morals, values, and to help achieve excellence through dance and performing Arts. We trust that as we all work together we will enhance personal and social growth, foster leadership skills, promote self-worth, teamwork, pride, respect, discipline and appreciation of music among dancers.
11413.title: "I BELIEVE IN ME" DANCE PROGRAM
11413.org: THE ARMS OF LOVE COMMUNITY OUTREACH INC

11413.description: Volunteer with Habitat for Humanity in Queens! Habitat for Humanity New York City transforms lives by building quality homes with families in need, and by uniting all New Yorkers around the cause of affordable housing. We build year round to move waiting families into their new homes and repair homes still badly damaged by Hurricane Sandy. Volunteers are at the heart of everything we do and we need YOU to help us continue making an impact throughout NYC! As a volunteer you will have the opportunity to: Make your own schedule - volunteer as little or as much as you would like Receive on-site training in construction - learn new skills or enhance the ones you already have Meet other volunteers committed to affordable housing Give back to your community in an amazing way Make a positive difference in the lives of others No construction experience is necessary -- just enthusiasm! _______________________________________________________________ How to Sign Up: Learn more before signing up by visiting our website (habitatnyc.org) OR create a profile on volunteerhub and sign up for a volunteer orientation (see instructions below). Please note: orientations are optional and are not required for Construction volunteers. If you are ready to start making a difference, follow the steps below to create your volunteerhub account: 1. Log on to habitatnyc.volunteerhub.com 2. Click the \"Create an Account\" button to create a new profile Choose a username and password Leave the Join Code field blank and click \"Next\" Input your full name, contact information, date of birth, and emergency contact's information 3. Select \"Construction\" and click on the event that interests you 4. Click on the \"Sign Up\" button and follow the directions to register for the event 5. You will receive a confirmation email letting you know you successfully signed up for a volunteer day! Please email volunteer@habitatnyc.org with any questions We hope to see you soon!
11413.title: Build with Habitat for Humanity in Queens!
11413.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

11414.description: GallopNYC uses therapeutic horsemanship to help riders in NYC with disabilities walk, talk and learn,inspiring them to live their lives as fully, independently and productively as possible. GallopNYC's vision is that every child with a disability in New York City has access to therapeutic horseback riding. Tasks Available for Volunteers Side Walking: Assist the instructor during therapeutic riding sessions by working directly with the riders. Act as an intermediary between the rider and instructor by assisting the rider in carrying out the instructor’s directions. Help prepare riders for lessons Assist with rider support during mounting and dismounting Walk (and jog) next to the rider throughout the class and provide physical support as necessary Help the rider follow directions given by the instructor Lead Walking: Volunteer will lead horses during therapeutic riding classes, working with a group of side-walkers, keeping primary focus on assigned horse (and not the rider) while maintaining communication with team Executes directions of the instructor during therapeutic riding sessions Depending on site, will bring horses in and out of arena We conduct lessons six days a week at locations in Forest Hills, Queens and Howard Beach on the cusp of Brooklyn and Queens. Check out our Volunteer page to learn more about the program, and how volunteers help with lessons. The process to volunteer with GallopNYC is quite simple: 1. Go to: https://volunteer.gallopny c.org/HOC__Volunteer_Registrat ion_Page, and make an account. 2. Complete the online orientation. 3. Sign up to volunteer by choosing your preferred day and location. After you sign up on the website, you will receive further updates on how to complete your registration. That’s it! *Experience with horses is helpful but not at all necessary. Please feel free to contact us for more info at volunteer@gallopnyc.org.
11414.title: Volunteer with a Therapeutic Horsemanship Program in Queens (Howard Beach)

11415.description: We have a lovely senior who is a survivor of the Holocaust. Loves to chat and so interesting to listen to. Females only please. If youwould like to hear more about this opportunity, please call Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100, ext 123. Thank you :)
11415.title: Friendly Visitor for senior in Briarwood

11418.description: For committed volunteers who would like to dedicate thier time to develop young talent and help fundraise to help keep Once Upon A Time Inc. alive.
11418.title: Help create an artist!

11791.description: Can your dog become a C.A.T.T.? We are looking for beloved pets, retirees from breeding or competition, released service dogs, registered therapy dogs and/or rescues. We welcome Puppies (beginning at 12 weeks) to Adults! Qualify your dog for our innovative canine-assisted activities program where children and adults come to interact with our certified dogs. You and your dog will engage with our participants (with and without special needs) who come to DogAbility Center by appointment. Our certified canine teams are taught to manage a small obstacle course, ride in a wagon, play tug games, run relay races, play \"find the ball\" and other assorted tricks, as well as assist in \"fear of dogs\" sessions. Very young puppies are introduced gradually in our supervised Puppy Pals activity. To become certified, all teams must pass an initial evaluation and then attend training sessions where our DogAbility Certified Training Staff will offer personal assistance. See website for fees ~ Fully insured
11791.title: WANTED - Great Dogs and Handlers

11791.description: Are you a professional who wants to give back? A retiree or stay-at-home parent looking to keep your skills fresh? A college student hoping to build your resume? DogAbility Center is looking for skilled volunteers and individuals with just the right expertise to join our team. We are looking for interested individuals with initiative to help steer the direction of our organization with your time and talents. Your skills will help form our team and will ensure that our organization remains effective and carries forward our mission of bettering the lives and well-being of children and adults of all abilities in our community. We are seeking volunteers for the following reasons: To increase awareness and understanding of our organization through the work that our volunteers do. To give our volunteer staff additional manpower to do more work and get as much done as possible within the confines of our budget. To act together to achieve a shared purpose.
11791.title: Volunteers Needed for Canine-Assisted Therapeutic Program for Kids & Adults of All Abilities

11797.description: Do you have a Certified Pet Therapy Dog? Are you interested in bringing smiles to patients and families? We could use your help! Hospice Care Network serves people facing life limiting illnesses. Opportunities are available to serve throughout Nassau, Suffolk and Queens. Please contact us if interested. Our basic requirements are a minimum commitment of one year, the ability to provide 2-4 Pet Therapy visits per month and medical clearance. An orientation to Hospice Care Network and ongoing support and mentorship will be provided. Current pet therapy certification and pet health clearance will be required. Interested candidates may apply directly by visiting our website, www.hospicecarenetwork.org, selecting the Volunteer tab and completing an online application. To request an application by mail or email, please call 516-224-6416 or send an email to sthorne@hospicecarenetwork.org. Please consider joining us...volunteers are the heart of Hospice!
11797.title: Pet Therapy Volunteer

11797.description: Hospice Care Network seeks NY State Licensed Cosmetologists to volunteer to provide haircuts to our patients living with an advanced illness in your community. Oftentimes patients are no longer able to get out to a salon and giving a haircut brings a smile and boosts their spirits! Our basic requirements are a minimum commitment of one year, the ability to provide 2-4 haircuts per month and medical clearance. An orientation to Hospice Care Network and ongoing support and mentorship will be provided. Interested candidates may apply directly by visiting our website, www.hospicecarenetwork.org , selecting the Volunteer tab and completing an online application. To request an application by mail or email, please call 516-224-6416 or send an email to sthorne@hospicecarenetwork.org . Please consider joining us...volunteers are the heart of Hospice!
11797.title: Cosmetology Volunteers to provide haircuts...

11797.description: In order to provide additional support to our patients and their families, and enhance their positive experience of Hospice, we have a dedicated group of Volunteers for our Hospice Angels Network! Volunteers \"adopt\" a family to call on a daily basis, to provide support, check in on them, and relay any concerns or needs they may have to our staff. This role is perfect for you if you would like to assist from home, enjoy flexibility and want patient interaction on a regular basis. A two day orientation in our Woodbury office to Hospice Care Network, and attendance at a brief call-specific orientation are required. Volunteers are asked to commit to a minimum of 1 year. If interested, please go to our website at www.hospicecarenetwork.org, click on the volunteer section and apply from there. We hope to hear from you!
11797.title: Phone Call Support Volunteer

11797.description: Hospice Care Network seeks compassionate individuals to provide companionship, respite, run errands, and provide support to people living with an advanced illness. Volunteers will be required to complete a 16 hour training program, be willing to travel within 30 minutes of their home and be able to dedicate 2-4 hours of service on a weekly basis. Interested candidates may apply directly by visiting our website, www.hospicecarenetwork.org , selecting the Volunteer tab and completing an online application. To request an application by regular mail or email, please call 516-832-7100 and ask to speak with a Volunteer Coordinator.

07101.description: - Provide day-to-day leadership in pursuing the GirlsInSTEM initiative - Deploy the implementation program Research-Advocate-Intervene and recruit volunteer to execute the specific tasks - Interact with corporate groups (Employee Resource Groups) focused on the promotion of women and invite their support - Be the liaison with the student sororities from local universities - Represent JerseySTEM (attend, speak) in public functions, conferences,... - Coordinate Grants requests relative to Girls In STEM JerseySTEM is a network co-op of parents, professionals, students and educators whose goal is to promote excellence in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (\"STEM\") education. 07102.description: CASA volunteers are community members who have a sincere desire to make a difference in the life of a child in foster care by becoming an advocate in court on the child's behalf. They are responsible adults who care deeply about the welfare of children and know that when they take on a case, they have the opportunity to change a child's life. As an advocate, a CASA volunteer will read Division of Child Protection and Permanency case files and interview all parties associated with the child and the case, such as biological parents, foster parents, school personnel, medical and mental health professionals and relatives. A CASA volunteer visits the child in the foster home every month in order to be familiar with what he or she needs. After gathering information, a CASA volunteer writes a report to be sent to the Family Court Judge who is presiding over the case. CASA volunteers are invited to appear at the actual Court hearing on the case to provide in-person testimony related to the report. CASA volunteers come from all walks of life and all kinds of educational, ethnic, and social backgrounds. Most work full time but some are students and some are retired. Objectivity and good communication skills are essential since a CASA volunteer must be able to work with a variety of people from child welfare professionals to birth parents. You must be at least 21 years old to volunteer. Completion of 30 hours of training in addition to a formal background check, references, and an interview are required. The first step in becoming an advocate is attending an information session. Visit www.tinyurl.com/CASAEssex for all upcoming dates and times. Can't make any of these? Email Jess at jearl@casaessex.org to schedule a phone call.
07102.title: Make a difference in a child's life - become a volunteer advocate
07102.org: CASA for Children of Essex County

07102.description: MusicLink is in need of music teachers in New Jersey. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check.

07102.description: Community Advisor - Newark, NJ Are you from Newark and looking to give back to the community? Join our team as a Community Advisor. MindRight is a Newark-based tech nonprofit with the mission of empowering youth of color to heal from trauma from systemic oppression, including poverty, violence, and discrimination. We provide mental health coaching over text message to teens. Our vision is to leverage technology to create opportunities for systemic healing in Newark and cities like Newark across the country. As a Community Advisor at MindRight, you bring expertise from your lived experience in this great city. You educate our leadership team and volunteer coaches on community historical and current contexts of trauma. You co-lead in-person presentations and workshops to youth in Newark with other members of the MindRight team. You provide feedback on our service and advise our leadership team in developing community engagement strategies. This is a part-time, volunteer role, with a minimum 2 hour weekly commitment. You will receive training on our texting service and work directly with our CEO and Co-founder in Newark. You will also work with our COO and Co-founder, Director of Coaching, and other Community Advisors. Interested or have questions? Email us at founders@getmindright.org Hear from one of our students here: https://vimeo.com/230341010 Featured in Forbes, https://www.forbes.com/sites/alanamatos/2017/08/31/meet-the-startup-healing-trauma-one-text-message-at-a-time/1
07102.title: Community Advisor, Newark

07102.description: Volunteers are needed to assist the Upward Bound Program, a grant-funded college preparatory program that serves highly motivated, low-income and first -generation college bound high school students. Upward Bound is organized as a partnership between Rutgers University - Newark and the East Orange School District, and is funded through a grant by the United States Department of Education. Volunteers are needed to assist the Upward Bound Program, a grant-funded college preparatory program that serves highly motivated, low-income and first -generation college bound high school students. Upward Bound is organized as a partnership between Rutgers University - Newark and the East Orange School District, and is funded through a grant by the United States Department of Education. The program’s goal is to provide fundamental support to participants in their preparation for success in secondary and post-secondary education. Scholars of the program participate in a year-long program (two Saturdays per month during the academic year and summer school for six-weeks during the summer). Volunteer tutors should be proficient in one of the following: S cience (Biology, Chemistry, Physics) T echnology E nginerring M athematics (Pre-Algebra, Algebra I and II, Geometry) Former volunteer experience in tutoring is necessary to being a susccessful volunteer at this opporunity and p revious exposure to low-income, first -generation youth is highly recommended. Volunteers are expected to help students learn independently. Volunteers are not expected to provide answers, but rather they should provide the necessary steps that students can use to find their own answers. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
