This is the perfect opportunity for those who have an interest in attaining a career in healthcare and having a positive impact on people's experience. We interview all of our candidates, because we look for those who are onboard with our vision and can assist us in making this a reality. if you accept, you'll be trained in the area and exposed to the rewarding opportunities that coincide with this program. If you have any questions or you would like additional information, please reach out to: Michael DeCicco - Access Control Coordinator ( mdecicco@northwell.edu)
11743.title: Lobby Ambassador Program

11743.description: Join our Team. Unique opportunity for those interested in healthcare or hospitality! Huntington Hospital is seeking volunteers who are customer service oriented and able to quickly connect with our patients’ families. In this role, you will orient patients’ families in our surgical waiting room and give them an overview of the process during their stay. Individuals must possess the following: Ability to volunteer a minimum of one 4-hour shift per week - (4-8 pm, M-F) Compassionate communication skills Ensure that any questions or concerns are addressed Work with our Perioperative Surgical Team to alleviate visitor’s anxiety while waiting for their loved ones If interested or for additional information, please contact Gina Torchon at gtorchon@northwell.edu or 631-351-2081
11743.title: Surgical Waiting Room Ambassador

11743.description: Role: Mother/Baby Ambassador Must be at least 18 years of age and interested in a healthcare profession, with a particular interest in the Mother/Baby area. In this exciting role you will enhance the experience of our new families by: *providing comfort items *welcoming and helping orient them to the unit *interfacing with health care professionals to enhance communication *answering call bells This role requires a commitment of 4 hours 3pm-7pm a minimum of once a week We will provide you with customer service training and orientation to the role.
11743.title: Mother/Baby Ambassador - Maternity

11743.description: Do you have Good Computer Skills? Are you capable of Multi-Tasking? Do you enjoy I nteracting With People? Are you Well-Organized? Do you have a Pleasing Telephone Personality? You will be keeping student records, answering the phone, and interacting with students as well as our volunteers, who are a great group of people. Our office is open weekdays only, Monday through Friday, morning and afternoon from 9:30 AM to 2:30 PM. Most of our office staff volunteer one morning or afternoon a week, though you can choose to spend more time with us if you wish. If you are a match for our small but busy office, we would love to hear from you. You can find out more about us on our website at www. seniornetLI.org or on Facebook at www.Facebook.com/SeniorNetLI.
11743.title: Like People?  Our SeniorNet Office Needs You
11743.org: SeniorNet Computer Learning Center at FSL-LI

11743.description: Our state-of-the art Computer Lab needs you if you have a technical background or just love to tinker, fix things and learn new skills. We are looking for help in: Maintaining and updating lab computers. Troubleshooting computers, printers and networks. Keeping other volunteers up to date on any hardware or software changes. Presenting lab reports at meetings. If you are enthusastic, outgoing, and would enjoy keeping our Computer Lab operating smoothly, SeniorNet is the place for you. Our Computer Lab is open weekdays only. Learn more about us on our website at www.seniornetLI.org or on Facebook.com/SeniorNetL.I.
11743.title: Are You Handy With Computers?  Our Computer Lab Needs You!
11743.org: SeniorNet Computer Learning Center at FSL-LI

11743.description: Help children grades K-6 with homework or tutoring after school, weekday afternoons. Opportunities in Bay Shore, Brentwood, Huntington, Riverhead & Yaphank.
11743.title: Homework Help
11743.org: Family Service League of Suffolk County

11743.description: Clerical Assistants help with filing, answering the phone, making appointments, scheduling and supporting Events. Lite computer skills needed at some locations. Opportunities in Bay Shore, East Yaphank, Huntington, Riverhead, some in a clinical setting. Very flexible in hours and days.
11743.title: Clerical Assistant
11743.org: Family Service League of Suffolk County

11743.description: Meals on Wheels is a volunteer, non-profit organization in need of drivers. You'll be paired with another volunteer to deliver meals to shut-ins in the Huntington area one day a week. Meals are delivered Monday through Friday at lunch time. By giving about two hours per week on a regular basis, you'll help improve your neighbors' quality of life.
11743.title: Drivers Needed for Meals on Wheels, Huntington NY
11743.org: Meals on Wheels of Huntington NY

11743.description: Our Award-Winning Don Weidman SeniorNet Computer Center offers computer classes for adults over 50. These classes are taught by an instructor with the assistance of several coaches. Courses range from basic to advanced computer skills, as well as one-session classes on the use of popular gadgets such as the iPhone, iPad, etc.. Classes are held weekdays only, Monday through Friday, mornings and afternoons. Instructors need a good knowledge of computer programs and the ability to communicate well with students. You must be patient - a sense of humor is a plus. Classes should be fun. Coaches assist the instructor and work one-on-one with students who are having difficulty and need support. You should have a basic knowledge of the course material being taught. Again, patience and a sense of humor help. Experience the tremendous satisfaction of seeing the seniors in your class learn to use the knowledge you've shared with them to enhance their lives. If you are interested in teaching or coaching, you can learn more about us on our website at www.seniornetLI.org or on Facebook at www.Facebook.com/SeniorNetLI.
11743.title: Know About Computers?  Help Seniors Learn.
11743.org: SeniorNet Computer Learning Center at FSL-LI

11743.description: Deliver flowers, discharge patients, escort visitors to various departments, etc. Retirees, stay-at-home moms, and college students are welcome. Volunteers wanted Monday to Friday from 12 pm to 4 pm.
11743.title: Wing Volunteers

11743.description: Are you interested in a career in healthcare - whether it's clinical or hospitality? Do you want to get some REAL experience interacting with patients, families and our Emergency Team? Or are you someone who just loves people and wants to give back and enjoys working in a fast paced environment? Then this is the volunteer role for you!! In this role, you will be working side by side with an expert clinical team to help ensure that comfort and communication needs are met. Here is what you will be doing in this role: providing comfort by offering pillows & blankets, beverages/meals under the direction of the clinical team interface with the clinical team to help keep patients & families informed help manage expectations for our patients & families ensure that call bells are answered quickly various tasks that support our Emergency Department Team and much more! Requirements: compassionate with excellent communication skills 17 years of age or older passionate about helping others able to stand on your feet for 4 hours & move stretchers & wheelchairs with patients onboard Interested individuals should contact: Cheryl Miranda RN, BSN, Director of Patient & Customer Experience cmiranda2@northwell.edu Alice Messina Coordinator of Patient Experience amessina2@northwell.edu
11743.title: Emergency Department Volunteer Ambassador

11743.description: Must be dependable and committed. Seeking volunteers to assist with meals, provide refreshments, visit with patients, etc. and be a welcoming asset to the environment. Hours are from 8 am to 12 Noon or 9 am to 1 pm - Monday to Friday.
11743.title: Nursing Unit Volunteers Needed

11743.description: Supervison of teens age 14-18 needed. Juniors run errands for Nursing units, mail room, discharging patients, etc. Hours are 4P-6:30P Wednesdays.
11743.title: Supervisor of Junior Volunteers

11746.description: We are currently seeking individuals with an interest in poetry, the arts, biography, history, education, and museum studies to volunteer at the Walt Whitman Birthplace, a historic site dedicated to Walt Whitman's life, spirit, and legacy. Volunteers provide the public with the history of the Walt Whitman Birthplace and guide guests through the home. This position may also include special events, programs, and group tours. We provide training and resources to learn about Walt Whitman and the house in which he was born. WWBA values its volunteers and depends on the generosity of individuals to help us maintain our mission to preserve and promote the legacy of Walt Whitman. We welcome volunteers of all ages, races, cultures, genders, and orientations. If you would like to volunteer approximately 2x/month on weekends (either Saturday or Sunday) between 11am and 4pm, please reply with your cover letter and resume. Thank you.
11746.title: Weekend Volunteers Needed at State Historic Site

11746.description: Food Not Bombs Mission Statement:Food Not Bombs recovers and shares free vegan or vegetarian food with the public without restriction in over 1,000 cities around the world to protest war, poverty and the destruction of the environment. Each group is independent and invites everyone to participate in making decisions for their local chapter using the consensus process. Food Not Bombs is dedicated to taking nonviolent direct action to change society so no one is forced to stand in line to eat at a soup kitchen expressing a commitment to the fact that food is a right and not a privilege. With over a billion people going hungry each day how can we spend another dollar on war? Hello Neighbor,I'm a volunteer with Long Island Food Not Bombs (http://www.LIFNB.com).We have Free Food Shares (Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.) throughout Long Island and Brooklyn. Depends what donations we get from stores, churches, neighbors and volunteers. Usually there are fruits, vegetables, milk, dairy, bread, cakes, pies, canned and dry goods, pet food, etc. We also have clothes, household & baby items, books, art, etc. depending what is brought to the Food Shares that day.Ask for Volunteer Jon or Rose if you have something to share. Say hello for me. Thank you, Volunteer Dennis A new release video: We start at 13:55: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fixP0UR_G_UCraigslist Post:Free \"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" Food SharesEvery Sunday at 2 PM, West Columbia Street & Station Plaza, Hempstead, NY 11550Every Tuesday at 7 PM, East 6th Street & Fairground Avenue, Huntington NY 11746Every Thursday at 7 PM, Horseblock Road & Woodycrest Drive, Farmingville, NY 11738Every Saturday at 12 PM, noon, 1556 Straight Path, Wyandanch, NY 11798Every Saturday at 3 PM, Lafayette Ave & Marcy Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11216All outdoors. Rain or Shine. No umbrellas or strollers by tables.Come Share With Your Community.Free Food, Clothing, Books, Baby Items, Household Items, Art, etc.Whatever is brought by our Volunteers, You (if you can) and Your Neighbors in Your Community.A Community is its Neighbors, not the towns they are in.Get there a few minutes before start time. Help us unload our Volunteers vehicles and set up tables.Bring empty bags, food, clothing, household items, baby items, books, etc to \"Share with Your Community\".See Volunteers if you do bring items to Share, or you want to volunteer to hand food and items out. Say hello for me, Dennis. Nothing to bring? Then bring yourselves.We'll help you get food and items you need. You don't need to bring any type of papers or ID to our Food Shares.Everyone is welcome to get Free Food, Clothing, Household Items, Baby Items, Books, Art, etc. Depends what is brought by our volunteers and other neighbors to share.We average 12,000 pounds of food and merchandise each Food Share.Just please be polite with your neighbors when we Share.We will not tolerate any type of racial slurs or bigotry.Please thank and help our Volunteers by taking recyclable cardboard (boxes to take home your food and items). Put out on your recycle day for pick up.More info go to our website: http://www.LIFNB.comStart Sharing:1) Pass this on to family, friends and neighbors in your community. 2) Copy flyers at LIFNB.com or this Craigslist post. Hand them out. Schools, Libraries, Senior Centers, Churches, Stores, etc.3) Maybe you are an owner, manager or employee of a store, supermarket, distributor, wholesaler, farm, or manufacturer. Do you have soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise you will be throwing out?Help us help you save money. Less carting fees. Great Community Relations.Call the Hotline (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.4) Next time you are in a store where you shop. Ask the owner or manager if they would like to donate soon to be expired food, drinks and/or merchandise they will be throwing out shortly. We'll pick up and they save money on carting fees and help the community. Give our Hotline Number (631) 223-4370 - 10 AM - 2 PM.5) Share on Facebook:\"Friend\" - Li FNB\"Like\" - Long Island Food Not Bombs6) Become one of our volunteers. Come and join us.No Food Shares in your area, volunteers will help you start one.We are not affiliated with any religion, church or political party. Community churches do donate food and items to our Food Shares.\"Long Island Food Not Bombs\" is the largest \"Food Not Bombs\" in the World. We are 4,000 Volunteers feeding 5,000 Long Islanders every week. 3 million pounds of food in 2014. Food that would have been thrown out. We do all this with no government funding, all volunteers. Volunteer to help us obtain funding. We are always in need of Plastic Folding Tables for our Food Shares. Donate when you can at: http://www.LIFNB.comThank you, Volunteer Dennis (48 yrs protesting war) peace
11746.title: Huntington Food Share - LIFNB

11747.description: Duties/Responsibilities May Include: Collaborate with office staff on volunteer needs for chapter events and in-office assistance. Maintain an updated and detailed database of volunteer contact information. Coordinate recruitment efforts for various chapter events and in office projects through community outreach. Present a positive image of the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society through all volunteer interactions and communications. Work in office one day per week. Manage time efficiently for weekly work both inside and outside of the office. Perform other duties as assigned.
11747.title: Volunteer Coordinator
11747.org: The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society, Long Island Chapter

11747.description: Responsibilities: -Assist in developing and contributing to public relations and marketing activities, including press releases, publicity materials and digital collateral -Collaborate on ideas for social media and e-mail marketing posts -Coordinate with news media, as assigned, in the development of news stories -Assist with updating and creating event-related materials using design programs -Maintain up-to-date records on media impressions and media contacts -Some travel required to distribute outreach materials and attend special events Minimum requirements: -Experienced with social media marketing on platforms including Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Instagram, LinkedIn -Proficient in Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Publisher) and Adobe Create Suite. -Able to quickly learn additional programs, as necessary (Constant Contact and RedDot CMS) -Incredible attention to detail, excelling in correct spelling, punctuation and grammar
11747.title: Communication / Marketing Volunteer

11747.description: Assist the Alzheimer’s Association in attending health fairs, community events and raising awareness about the disease. Support is needed in setting up displays, distributing information and conversing with the public about dementia and the services that we provide. Volunteers will receive training on the basics of the disease, the Alzheimer’s Association and our mission!
11747.title: Health Fair/Community Event Representative

11747.description: The role of the facilitator is to create a supportive setting where group members connect with each other and benefit from the shared wisdom and experience of living with Alzheimer's Disease. Assist with guiding participation in caregiver support groups or early-stage support for people with the diagnosis and/or their caregiver. Facilitators must have strong listening skills and be effective communicators. Experience with dementia as a family member or health care professional is preferred. Ability to be empathetic, create and maintain a safe environment and redirect and facilitate discussions is also required.
11747.title: Support Group Facilitators for Alzheimer's/Dementia

11747.description: Community Educators deliver a variety of Association developed presentations targeted to raise awareness about the disease, facilitate diagnosis, and encourage healthy living. Through these presentations, community educators discuss Alzheimer's disease and share information about local services. Training on the Association’s core education programs is required and will be provided to you. Must be an effective communicator with good public speaking skills and be interested in educating the public. Bilingual speakers needed.
11747.title: Community Educators for Alzheimer's Association

11747.description: Hospice Care Network provides modified massage therapy free of charge to patients and families at The Mary Ann Tully Hospice Inn, our 18 bed inpatient facility for those with a life limiting illness. All Volunteer Massage Therapists in our program are licensed by New York State. Our massage program offers individualized orientation and ongoing mentorship to enable volunteers to acclimate effectively and confidently into the hospice environment. We are looking for volunteers to be available 2-4 times each month for two hour shifts. For more information on the program, you may go to our website at www.hospicecarenetwork.org and click on the Volunteer tab and apply directly online. For more questions please call 516-224-6416 or email sthorne@hospicecarenetwork.org.
11747.title: Licensed Massage Therapist

11428.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11428.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 33 Edward M. Funk, NYC)

11423.description: Calling all professional community-oriented and dynamic women of the African diaspora, we want you! We're currently seeking volunteers to be paired as mentors to young women in Queens New York City public high schools. This is your chance, be part of the vision, be part of the movement, be part of the solution and help us to rebuild the village!
11423.title: Mentor

11423.description: Lively woman from Jamaica Queens with many interests desires a friendly visitor. She plays the key board, loves books and music of all kinds, going for walks, good conversation, etc. Join our team of volunteers and brighten the life of this lovely lady.
11423.title: Music lover desires a friendly visitor
11423.org: Catholic Charities Southwest Queens Friendly Visiting Program

11423.description: Lovely lady in Jamaica seeks a female friend for weekly visits. She is a multi-talented person, who loves painting, opera, going for walks, lively conversation, etc. This interesting senior prefers someone who is available any day of the week in the afternoon. She is a Holocaust survivor who recognizes the importance of telling her story so that the world may remember. We are eager to have you contact us so that we might find a companion for our client.
11423.title: Holocaust Survivor Needs Friendly Visitor
11423.org: Catholic Charities Southwest Queens Friendly Visiting Program

11423.description: One hour per week can make a difference in the life of a homebound older adult. Multiple volunteers are needed to visit seniors in Jamaica Queens. Our clients like to play cards, listen to music, watch old movies, do arts and crafts, learn technology or just chat. We will match your interests with theirs. Schedules are flexible, geared to your availability. If you are friendly and compassionate join our team and help us to brighten the world, one life at a time.
11423.title: Volunteers Needed to Visit Homebound Seniors in Jamaica
11423.org: Catholic Charities Southwest Queens Friendly Visiting Program

11423.description: The Daughters of Isis Foundation is looking for a dynamic professional to assist with development. The volunteer/intern will have strong organizational, writing and problem solving skills. Must be detailed oriented and an effective communicator with strong computer skills (Microsoft work, excel, Internet research nd PowerPoint) Individual must be flexible, team player with a willingness to take on new and varied tasks to achieve organization's mission. Duties and Responsibilities: Developing and maintaining individual donor program. Creating and maintaing donor database, acknowledging and reporting on gifts and donations received. Attending trainings on grat guidelines and deadlines. Assisting in the writing, editing and distribution of grant request and proposals. Managing fund raising related correspondence. Conducting prospectus research on individuals, organizations, corporations and foundations. Developing styrategies for approaching foundations and corporations. Maintaining files and doing reports oof foundations and corporations approached and grant requirements. Assisting in organizing and implementing fund raising events. Assisting with financial reporting of all gifts and donations.
11423.title: Fund Developer

11423.description: Looking for volunteers and interns 18 and older, (High School students, High School Graduates, College students and or graduates), to assist with our Rites of Passage Program, community outreach, fund raisers/events, web site design and development and other services as needed. Volunteers/interns must be professional and willing to travel. Be willing to work with a diverse background of clients. Able to develop willing groups for young women on areas such as self-esteem/self-development, All volunteers/interns must complete background check.
11423.title: Volunteers & Interns

11422.description: We are looking for volunteers who can assist with the curriculum. We will have six workshops on the third Saturday of each month , 12-2pm. We are also planning a cultural enrich field trip plus community service days. Volunteers will help facilitate the workshops and the events. We are looking for a retired teacher that could possible serve on the board
11422.title: Help4AYES

11427.description: SNAP (Services Now for Adult Persons, Inc) is starting a Social Adult Day Program in November for adults 60 and over that have been diagnosed with Early stage Dementia or Alzheimers. Programming for this group will take place in our center every Wednesday from 9:30 AM till 2:30 PM. There will always be a staff member and a Health Aide in the room. Volunteers are need to assist the clients in planned activities (at the present time there will be a maximum of 5 clients). You might help with an art project, assist them in the music program, bring their lunch to them (you get lunch too if you work the full day) and just chat and listen to the stories and experiences they want to share. Two volunteers are needed for each session so whether you can commit to every Wednesday, one Wednesday a month or just half a session, we would love to hear from you. Training will be held for all volunteers. You will NOT be providing any type of medical or health care. If this opportunity interests you, please call Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100 for further information.
11427.title: Social Adult Day Assistant

11427.description: This opportunity calls for a female that can get to Cambria Heights once a week for about an hour just to have some nice conversation with a lovely woman who loves Soap operas and good conversation. If this opportunity interestsyou, please contact Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100, ext 123
11427.title: Chit Chat in Cambria Heights

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia.
07650.title: Talent Sharing

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia. Classes are from 4:00 PM to 6:10 PM on Monday to Thursday.
07650.title: ESL TEFL TESOL tutoring, Art work for kids

07652.description: Jewish Federation of Northern New Jersey's Bergen Reads progrma is a youth literacy program dedicated to inspiring low level readers in grades K-4 with a love of reading, thereby enriching their lives and opportunities for future success. We work in Hackensack and Teaneck NJ public elementary schools. Spend one hour per week during the school day (you will be assigned a time slot Monday through Friday from 8:30am-3:00pm depending on your availability and teacher needs) working one-on-one with two students in grades K-4 as a Bergen Reads Reading Buddy. You will spend one half hour per week with each student, for a total of one hour of volunteer time weekly. No experience necessary; we will train you. Program runs from October through June.
07652.title: Change the world. One child at a time
07652.org: Jewish Federation of Northern New Jersey

07652.description: Compassus Hospice offers undergraduate human service and family service internship opportunities throughout Bergen, Passaic, Morris, Essex and Sussex counties. Interns are trained to provide physical, psychosocial, and spiritual support to the hospice patient and family. Interns visit with our patients to provide socialization, companionship, respite care, and helping caregivers with errands. As an integral member of the hospice interdisciplinary team, the intern’s interventions relieve patients’ symptoms of depression and anxiety by offering interactive music, reading to patients, leisure activities and expressive art and writing activities. In addition to patient care, intern’s responsibilities often include volunteer recruitment, program planning and community outreach activities. Our interns work in the office as well as in the field to provide support to both the staff and our patients. To us, hospice care is not about the end of life, it is about inspiring life - making each moment meaningful. Contact us to learn more.
07652.title: Human Service and Family Service Internships

07652.description: Massage Therapy Volunteers, Reiki Volunteers and Alternative therpay volunteers are certified and/or are professionally trained. The volunteer provides comfort and relaxation to our patients and their families. Any of these specialities are a great benefit to our patients. Join our TEAM as a Volunteer. Locations available in Bergen, Passaic, Hudson, Essex, Morris, Union, Warren, Sussex and Hunterdon Counties in NJ. Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patients' quality of life Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Provide Massage therapy, hand rubs, Reiki, or Aromatherapy to patients and families Give your time to someone in need.
07652.title: Massage Therapist, Reiki Trained and/or Alternative Therapy Volunteers Needed

07652.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07652.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Paramus

07652.description: Seeking volunteers to assist with our grant research and fundraising/development department. This is a multifaceted position where you would gain experience in grant research and writing, donor development, planned giving, marketing research, strategic marketing, and general knowledge of fundraising and events at small but very hands-on non-profit organization. These skills would allow you to learn the duties and challenges of a non-profit while learning how to expand a marketing and development department. Duties would include: Statistical Research Creating letter and calendar templates Donor Research Social Media Strategic Marketing PowerPoint Presentations Constant Contact email marketing And much more! Skills Required: Telephone skills, Microsoft Office computer skills- as mentioned. Must love multi-tasking and getting involved directly with multiple projects. This is excellent hands-on experience for the right candidates!
07652.title: Marketing, Fundraising & Development Internship

07652.description: Seeking volunteers to assist with motivational client support calls in our Patient Support Services Program. These individuals work to connect people living with diabetes that are uninsured or underinsured to long-term prescription assistance programs, medical facilities and ongoing health and wellness resources. Our callers assist those who have utilized the Foundation’s short-term emergency medication assistance program to find long-term assistance to ensure that each patient will not experience a lapse in their diabetes treatment plan. The volunteer will also speak with individuals who call in to the office with questions, issues and concerns related to their prescriptions, medical care, and overall health. Bilingual English/Spanish proficiency a plus but not required. Great for retirees, medical professionals with spare time, those living with or caring for someone with diabetes, or anyone interested in helping via support calls! Experience speaking with patients or customers via phone, and/or familiarity with diabetes is a huge plus, but also not required. Volunteers must be friendly, empathetic, and be interested in helping others improve their health and well-being. Basic computer proficiency and typing skills are required for use of our client database. Due to the training involved, this opportunity does require a minimum 1 year time commitment from volunteers, ideally 1-3 times per week.
07652.title: Patient Support Services

07652.description: Our organization works feverishly to help people in New Jersey with diabetes to obtain affordable medication, education and additional resources so they can live healthier lives. The volunteer will have an interest in answering busy phones and inquiries, creating fundraising and donation letters, researching educational resources, developing and editing spreadsheets, data entry, handling event data organization and fundraising mailings- and much more! These are just some of the things that need to happen everyday to make our organization run! We need great people to help us keep the workflow going and to reach as many people in need as possible. If you are comfortable using Microsoft Office and answering phones, we need you! The ideal candidate can come to our Bergen County Office 2 to 3 times a week. Flexible hours. Please apply via the VolunteerMatch site, by emailing a resume or letter of interest to info@diabetesfoundationinc.org, or filling out a short volunteer application on our website- www.diabetesfoundationinc.org
07652.title: Love office work? Your skills are needed in a busy diabetes organization!

07652.description: Volunteers primarily serve as friendly visitors to elderly terminally ill patients. About half of our patients have dementia. Depending on the patient's functioning level, the volunteer may listen/speak to the patient, read, write letters, pray, or watch TV with the patient. Volunteers may also interact with the patient's family members. Volunteers are expected to visit patients 2 hours a week, during the daytime, on either the work week or weekend (volunteer can choose). Volunteers are required to submit brief patient notes, one day after visitation. Training and ongoing supervision is provided by experienced healthcare professionals.
07652.title: Hospice Friendly Bedside Visitor

07871.description: One of the challenges this 100% volunteer run organization faces is getting the word out and getting people to attend the fund-raising events. If you are a good networker, good with people, have good selling skills you could be a great asset as a volunteer to this organization. IES Brain Research Foundation raises money to support research that will lead to effective treatments and cures for serious brain diseases and condisitons such as: autism, Alzheimer's & Parkinson's disese, brain cancer, stroke, Traumatic Brain Injury (concussions, etc.), addiction, pain, eplilepsy, MS, etc. This volunteer non-profit organization attracts bright young minds to the field of neuroscientce through the Summer Student Fellowship Program. Help us spread the word of how important this basic research is! Help us get sponsors and attendees for our events.Share your time and skills with us.
07871.title: Good Networking and Sales Skills to help Brain Research Foundation

07871.description: Are you a good listener? Do you enjoy meeting people? Are you able to provide a comforting touch? Do you enjoy making an immediate difference in someone's life? If you answered \"Yes\" to any of these questions, then this volunteer opportunity is for you! We are a hospice program that provides services throughout Sussex County. ***Free training is provided*** How Can Volunteers Help? A trained volunteer can provide the following: - Relief for the Family - so they can run errands, companionship when family cannot be there, and Respite Care - Primary Caregiver - by sitting with the patient, making phone calls, support for the patient and family - Emotional Support - active listening to the patient and family, holding the patient's hand when he/she is scared, by just being there when they need to talk - Patient and Family Assistance - running errands, helping with light housework, preparing a light meal Volunteers can also come into the office and do office work: - Admission Packets - they put together the admission packets, make copies for the packets - Filing - do some light filing of patient's paperwork for their files
07871.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed for Sussex County, NJ

07442.description: Alexis is a kind young man who a mild developmental disability. He lives in a group home where he is quite independent. He volunteers every week at a local library and attends a day program twice a week. He has basic reading skills and has his own laptop that he uses for games and reading about movies which is one of his favorite hobbies. Alexis would enjoy a friend to go to the movies with or for a burger and is open to trying new things. He will benefit from a male role model since he only has a younger brother and minimal contact with his foster family. Alexis has a great sense of humor and is fun to be with. Anyone who is his friend will consider themselves blessed to know him.
07442.title: Be a friend, change a life

07656.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed.
