The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and Amie's Place Foundation and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule and is located (ideally) within 30 minutes of your home or office.
11104.title: DOG Lovers in Rego Park/ Forest Hills!!- Help a Senior Care for their Dog!

11104.description: I have several non-English speaking clients who are lonely and desperately need socialization. If you have a little free time you could dedicate to getting to know someone and speak Spanish, Russian, Cantonese, French or Polish, please contact me! Friendly visiting is an easy, fun, rewarding way to become involved in your community. Other languages are also needed! The Friendly Visitor Program is run by Sunnyside Community Services and covers areas of Western Queens including Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside and more. I have lots of seniors throughout Western Queens, all waiting for a volunteer to visit them! Friendly Visitors are volunteers who visit home bound elderly for about an hour each week in their homes. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule. Many volunteers visit on evenings and weekends. Volunteers must be 18 years old.
11104.title: Adopt a Grandparent!!! bilingual volunteers needed!!

11104.description: Change the life of a homebound senior by visiting them for one hour per week! The Friendly Visitor Program at Sunnyside Community Services covers all parts of Queens, including Astoria, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Rego Park, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside and more. Friendly Visitors are volunteers who visit homebound seniors for about an hour each week in their homes. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule.
11104.title: Friendly Visitors needed in All areas of Queens

11771.description: CCH’s Afterschool Enrichment Program is a program that helps support students from grades K - 6th. The majority of these students come from homes where English is not the first language spoken, and as a result parents often do not understand English sufficiently to help them with their homework and other academic activities. Through this program we hope to develop responsible youths for the community, and help foster the skills necessary for them to succeed in school, participate in extra-curricular activities, and increase their chances to attend a college or university. Since we are a non-profit, we ask for the help of those in our community to achieve this goal. We need volunteers to donate their time to help these students. The program is held Monday through Friday (school calendar) from 3:30PM to 5:30Pm in Oyster Bay. THIS IS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY FOR A HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT LOOKING TO VOLUNTEER!
11771.title: Volunteer needed for Homework Help and Tutoring
11771.org: CENTRO CULTURAL HISPANO DE OYSTER BAY EAST NORWICH

07945.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. You CAN decide which program you want to be a part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become familiarized with Homecare Homebase software Work on Special Projects when needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patients' quality of life Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Benefits Increase purpose and meaning in your life by positively impacting other lives Experience significant opportunities for personal growth and development Convenient FREE training that fits your schedule Internship Credit (if applicable) Develop interpersonal skills Build your resume Reference Letter after a period of commitment
07945.title: Hospice Volunteers in Mendham, NJ - No Experience Needed

07945.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. You CAN Decide Which Program You Want to be Part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become Familarized with Homecare Homebase Work on Special Projects as needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patient's quality of life Visit patients in facilities or their homes in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Specialized Volunteers Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers Certified Reiki Practitioners Licensed Message Therapists Program Benefits Increase Meaning and Purpose in Your Life by Positively Impacting Other Lives Experience Significant Opportunities for Personal Growth and Development Convenient FREE Training that Fits Your Schedule Free TB Test Develop Interpersonal Skills Build Your Resume Reference Letter Join this fun opportunity and help make a difference!
07945.title: Hospice/Healthcare Volunteer in Mendham - No Experience Needed

10028.description: Are you a singer, guitar player, or have other musical talents appropriate for young mothers and their babies? The babies are all under 2 years of age. If you have appropriate musical experience and talent and would like to entertain in such a situation and you are available week days, we would like to hear from you. Events typically last 2-3 hours; frequency would be once a quarter or more. Please send a note describing your musical background;experience with very young children a big plus. SEND YOUR RESUME AND PHONE NUMBER.
10028.title: Musical Entertainer for Mother/Baby Events
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10028.description: Enthusiastic volunteers are needed to introduce school children to art and museums. We will train you to give guided tours at the Brooklyn Museum of Art and Metropolitan Museum of Art, and to go into the classroom to prepare the students for their visit. Tours take place Monday through Friday, during the school year, between the hours of 10am and 1pm. ArtWorks volunteers are in 20 schools throughout the five boroughs and our classroom teachers love us!
10028.title: "Introduce Children to Art and Museums"

10028.description: Our organization helps low-income first-time mothers in the boroughs get their babies off to a good start. We need volunteers who want to help out at our LEAP programs which bring moms together for socialization, peer support and life-skills education. Participation would be at least quarterly at various sites around the city. If you have experience in child development, literacy, nutrition, money management, you can help us develop and deliver our programs. If not, you can help us with hospitality tasks (setting up, serving food, assisting with projects, etc) and cuddling and/or managing the infants and toddlers. Events are held during the day and last 2-3 hours. SEND RESUME AND PHONE NUMBER
10028.title: Volunteer to Help at Mother & Baby Learning Events
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10028.description: Help us fight climate change and hunger by delivering excess food to a local homeless shelter. You will be walking with bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. You will visit the store a few minutes before closing time, pick up the edible food in a plastic bag, and deliver the food to a local shelter.
10028.title: Feed the less fortunate

10028.description: Help us rescue food from a great bakery! You will help deliver this food that would otherwise have been thrown away. We will walk for this 30 minute event and will finish at the Bowery Mission, located at 227 Bowery. Lightweight: the average amount of food rescued during this event is 5-15 pounds. (ignore UES zipcode) SIGN UP HERE!!! https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10028.title: Food Rescue Event Opportunity (7PM-7:30PM, weekends)!

06880.description: CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has background in strategic marketing, which ideally includes a blend of marketing planning and execution, with direct experience at an advertising agency or on the client side, with branding, advertising and communications experience. Advocacy experience is also highly regarded. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide - including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, members, collaborating organizations and legislators as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Excellent written and verbal skills are a must. Responsibilities to include the following: Collaborating with the Executive Director and Board leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive marketing and communications plan employing strategies that will broaden programmatic reach and deepen impact, including hands-on experience with all appropriate aspects of social media Managing the ongoing promotion of major programs and developing and executing messaging for new initiatives Identifying and crafting stories that communicate the essence of the organization’s mission and successes Working with the technology-development team to identify a set of meaningful touchpoints with our targets - new member joining, annual pledging - and creating an array of appropriate communications to be automated and sent, in order to stay current and ensure maximum engagement and support from our stakeholders. Working with all CAG committees, specifically including Development and Programming, to assist with execution of their annual plans and to help further corporate engagement efforts Identifying significant media and public policy issues that can be leveraged to support CAG’s work, and creating and implementing plans to exploit them
06880.title: Connecticut Association for the Gifted - BOD Opening in Marketing/Advertising

06880.description: The Connecticut Association for the Gifted (CAG), founded in 1969, is the pre-eminent parent, teacher and school resource and legislative advocate for Connecticut’s talented and high-ability students. CAG provides families with information, resources and programs to benefit their gifted and talented children; educators with high-quality professional development; and Boards of Education with the tools to support talented students. CAG is committed to increasing public awareness statewide that talented and high-ability children exist in all socio-economic, ethnic, and racial groups. CAG also is interested in extending its reach to traditionally underserved populations. CAG is seeking an individual to serve as Treasurer of the Board of Directors. As Treasurer, your responsibilities would be to: Serve as Ex-officio of the Finance and Audit Committee Be an authorized signer on checks and contracts Create and maintain policies related to the budget, audit, investment, financial controls and fiscal management philosophies Lead budget development and monitoring process Prepare reports for Board of Directors meetings on the status of the current budget, investments and any financial issues requiring Board review and/or approval Arrange payment of CAG expenses Train and oversee bookkeeper who: Enters monthly transactions with account and class categorizations into QuickBooks Issues financial reports, as needed Files tax returns annually Distributes 1099s Arrange for annual Financial Review, and provide information to CAG’s public accounting firm Fulfill other duties as assigned by the Board President. This is an unpaid (volunteer) position. To apply or for further information contact Lisa Garner at execdirector@ctgifted.org
06880.title: CAG Board of Director Member to Serve As Treasurer

06880.description: The Connecticut Association for the Gifted (CAG), founded in 1969, is the pre-eminent parent, teacher and school resource, and legislative advocate forConnecticut’s talented and high-ability students. CAG provides families with information, resources and programs to benefit their gifted and talented children; educators with high-quality professional development; and Boards of Education with the tools to support talented students. CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has a hands-on background in public relations, including firsthand social media experience. The ideal candidate would possess a working knowledge of strategic marketing that includes a blend of media relations, marketing planning and advocacy. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide -- including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, legislators and collaborating organizations, as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Must also possess excellent written and verbal skills. Responsibilities to include the following: Identifying and crafting stories that communicate the essence of an organization’s mission and successes Collaborating with the Executive Director and Board leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive communications plan employing strategies that will broaden programmatic reach and deepen impact Developing and refining \"core\" organizational messages to ensure consistency across all platforms Identifying significant media and public policy issues that can be leveraged to support CAG’s work, and creating and implementing plans to exploit them Managing messaging for ongoing promotion of major programs and developing messaging for new initiatives Along with ED and officers, representing organization at public events, conferences, workshops, networking groups and media events Developing and supporting relationships with CT media Working with all appropriate committees including Development and Partnership, to assist with corporate/small business/like-minded organization engagement efforts Serving as Executive Editor for the organization's website Along with Program Coordinator, overseeing organizational response to inquiries about CAG Coaching and supporting all staff and board members as spokespersons Previous experience on a non-profit board is helpful This is an unpaid (volunteer) position. To apply or for further information contact Lisa Garner at execdirector@ctgifted.org.
06880.title: Connecticut Association for the Gifted - Board of Directors Member Experienced in Public Relations

10040.description: The Friendly Visiting Program pairs volunteers with home bound seniors to provide company and friendship. We provide friendly visitors to seniors that resides from North 110th street and West of Fifth Avenue to the Northern tip of Manhattan. One visit per week for a minimum of six months can make a difference in a senior’s life. Friendly Visiting Coordinator Elissette Reyes De Jesus 212-342-9694 646-228-1812 ereyesdejesus@isabella.org
10040.title: Friendly Visiting Program
10040.org: Isabella Geriatric Center Friendly Visiting Program

11370.description: We are currently looking for an individual to work on our team as a WebSite Designer. Our 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization (www.alertnfp.org) Alert Inc is a non-for-profit organization which deals with the securing of our educational institutions to better safeguard the welfare of students, facility and staff of schools through numerous programs and network support. IT personnel needed to help with designing websites and maintaining and upgrading them-Depending on applicant opportunity may lead to full time paid position
11370.title: Website Developer

07608.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07608.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Teterboro

11226.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org . To register to attend a Volunteer Information Session, please click here.
11226.title: Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11226.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11226.description: Did you know, a wish is not simply a wish. Independent research has proven that the impact of a wish improves medical outcomes for wish kids bravely frightening against their illnesses? Last year we granted over 700 wishes in Western and Metro NY. We have a long list of amazing children in Brooklyn waiting for their wishes to be filled. Become a Wish Granting volunteer. Wish Granters grant the child’s one true wish and are essential to our commitment to bring hope, strength and joy to children battling critical illnesses. A wish is not simply a wish. In the fight against critical illness, wishes spark renewed strength and encouragement for every child and family on their journey. A majority of the service is done via phone, email or text. However, to meet the child and their wish family, you will be paired up with another volunteer to meet them in their home. Currently there are many children living in Brooklyn and Bronx waiting for volunteers to help fulfill their wish.
11226.title: Is Brooklyn in the house? We need Wish Granting Volunteers in your area
11226.org: Make-A-Wish Metro New York and Western New York

11226.description: Notes for Notes - Brooklyn is looking for people with music experience to work with youth and help them advance their skills on guitar, bass, drums, piano/keys/synths, singing, DJ turntables, songwriting and DAW production skills. Youth participants are between the ages of 5 and 18 and come in to the Studios to explore, create and record. Some are trying an instrument for the first time, others are advanced and looking to collaborate, build a band and record tracks. If you have a passion for music and want to share it with the younger members of our community, please consider volunteering! Commitments and hours are flexible and we’re open to new collaborative ideas. The Brooklyn Studio is currently open Mon-Fri from 3pm to 8:30pm.
11226.title: Looking for Volunteers to help with Music Instruction and Production!

11226.description: Be our community champion! Community Options seeks business people to help further its mission. Among the goals set for the Business Advisory Council, or COBAC: To assist Community Options staff in its fundraising endeavors, To assist Community Options staff in networking with the business community, To help individuals with disabilities integrate into their communities, To ensure utmost quality in Community Options services, To educate local business owners and the corporate sector about persons with disabilities and the role that the business community can play in their lives, To attain a societal understanding and acceptance of a person with a disability as a productive member of the community. As a member of COBAC in your community, you're our champion! Join us today. Learn more about COBAC here: http://www.comop.org/get-involved/cobac/
11226.title: Business Advisory Council Committee -BKN

10024.description: Intergenerational Chess at DOROT Youth volunteers needed to play chess with older adults and brighten their day. Share a friendship across the chess board and gain community service hours. \"One of the best things about playing chess with Mr. B is how excited we are to see each other.\" -Zach, age 13 Registration is still open on a rolling basis! Fall/Winter: Jan. 29 - May. 14 from 4:00-5:30pm Students and DOROT Seniors will get to know each other and play chess together. Refreshments will be served. Free. Requirements: for 6th - 12th grade students must commit to all sessions understand the game of chess understand the different chess pieces and how to move them Intergenerational Chess at DOROT is sponsored by the Targoff family and friends
10024.title: Intergenerational Chess - Youth Needed to Play Chess with Seniors

10024.description: Digital Grandparents (DGI), We are seeking volunteers to assist older adults with improving their technology skills during our community service program. Volunteers are needed to engage in one -on-one tutoring with older adults on Saturdays from noon to 2 PM. The organization has had 501(c)(3) status since 2010. Send an email to info@dg-inc.org with the subject line \"I want to volunteer\" if you are interested in applying to become a DGI tutor or to learn more about our program.
10024.title: Volunteers - Assist Older Adults  with the Digital World

10024.description: Volunteers at Star tutor students from low-income families who need help with reading, writing, math or other subjects. The students range in age from 2nd to 12th grade, and attend public and parochial schools across the city. About 65% of students come from families where Spanish is the primary language spoken at home. Tutors complete a written application form and interview, and are matched with an appropriate student. Once the tutor is matched, he/she receives an orientation, and then works one-to-one with the same student each week for two hours. The Center is open for tutoring on Mondays and Wednesdays from 3 to 7 pm, and on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays from 3:30 to 6 pm. You do not need to speak Spanish for this position. ***WE CURRENTLY HAVE A NUMBER OF HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WHO STILL DO NOT HAVE TUTORS! These students need primary help in Math and Science classes. The ability to help with other subjects, such as writing, would be helpful. You can apply now by visiting https://www.goddard.org/grcc/volunteer/starlearning/ and completing the Tutor Application: School Year.
10024.title: Math and Science Tutors Needed for HS Students!

10024.description: Folding, Stuffing and Mailing year end donor letters.
10024.title: Mailing

10024.description: Ms. P is a lovely senior living on the upper west side with her husband. Ms. P is a retired actor and costume designer on Broadway. Ms. P would love a friendly visitor to converse with and liven up her week. She is a very pleasant person and is sure to put a smile on your face. Ms. P has Alzheimer’s, and it limits her conversational abilities. We are looking for volunteers who have experience with Alzheimer’s disease (in a professional or personal capacity). This opportunity is part of Encore Community Service's Friendly Visiting Program. We ask for a commitment of 6 months, during which time visits take place every week. There is a short interview and orientation process, as well as a background check.
10024.title: Visit with the charming Ms. P., Retired Actor and Costume Designer

10024.description: Help us fight climate change and hunger by delivering excess food to a local homeless shelter. You will be walking with bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. You will visit the store a few minutes before closing time, pick up the edible food in a plastic bag, and deliver the food to a local shelter.
10024.title: Assist in battling hunger

10024.description: Volunteer as an EMT or non-medical provider with CPMU! http://www.cpmu.com/index.php/join-cpmu/
10024.title: Volunteer with the Central Park Medical Unit!

10024.description: Teens help alleviate loneliness and social isolation of DOROT's seniors through a variety of hands-on experiences in the community and onsite at DOROT. Apply here: http://www.dorotusa.org/site/PageServer?pagename=vol_school_year_internship#.WgyTp9QrLeM From a teen who visited a DOROT Senior: I LOVED THIS VISIT SO MUCH!!! It was really heartwarming and gratifying to see how elated Angie was after she opened the gifts that were in the birthday package. It was so nice to see someone so happy by our visit and what we brought with us. I felt very at ease and it was great talking to her and seeing her reaction to the gifts. -Jessica, 10th grade Teen Interns may: visit seniors in their home for companionship. teach seniors how to use a computer, iPad, iShuffle, and other types of technology. celebrate seniors’ birthdays. deliver meals to seniors. send birthday cards out to seniors. read to visually impaired seniors. shop and delivery groceries to seniors. play chess, cards, scrabble, and other games with seniors. assist with office work at DOROT. take part in a variety of other opportunities and experiences. Time Commitment: 1 day a week (Monday - Thursday) 2 hours a day (after school - no later than 4:00-6:00pm) 1 semester (minimum of 10 times at DOROT) Our Teen Internship has limited spots and is competitive, so teens must go through an application process. As a prospective intern, the first step is to fill out the interest form, then contact Shai Rosenfeld at 917-441-5051 for a brief phone interview. We take great care to find teen interns who are committed, responsible, reliable, and enthusiastic about working with seniors. Eligible teens are in 9th-12th grades.
10024.title: DOROT School Year TEEN Internship

10024.description: This opportunity is available every night! Excess bread can be combined with other ingredients to create meals to feed the hungry at a nearby food pantry rather than being thrown out. Help us walk with the food that would have been thrown away! We will get bags of bread and walk for this fifteen minute event, and will finish at the Rectory at the Holy Trinity Catholic Church at 213 W 82nd Street. Light Weight: the average total amount of food is 10 lbs. Sign up directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10024.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Upper West Side 8:05PM-8:20PM

10024.description: Love to knit? crochet? Want to learn more? Join DOROT's knitters and crocheters to create warm blankets for homeless seniors, or those that are at risk. Knitting and Crocheting Afghans for Seniors Gather twice a month with other volunteers to knit or crochet Afghans that will be given to seniors at DOROT’s Homelessness Prevention and Aftercare Program. Wednesdays & Thursdays, 10:30 AM - 12:00 PM 2018 Wednesday, January 3rd Thursday, January 18th Wednesday, February 7th Thursday, February 15th Wednesday,March 7th Thursday, March 15th DOROT will provide some supplies, bringing your own is preferred. For more information and to register, please contact Debbie Weiss, Coordinator of Adult Volunteers at dweiss@dorotusa.org or 917-441-5069.
10024.title: Knitting & Crocheting Afghans for Seniors- Upper West Side

10024.description: Bring the knowledge and skills you've developed to make a significant impact on the lives of older members of our community. Our DOROT seniors will benefit from your time and expertise. You will meet other volunteers and make new friends that share similar interests and are as passionate about volunteering as you. Volunteer Opportunities Inlcude: Cooking for DOROT's Homelessness Prevention Program Knitting Group Intergenerational Programs Vist our website for more information: http://www.dorotusa.org/site/PageServer?pagename=vol_older_adult#.VkEWgLeFNdg
10024.title: Retired, In transition? Volunteer with DOROT to assist seniors.

10024.description: Volunteer tutors needed for low income students for the 2017-18 school year. You will be matched one-to-one with a student for just two hours, one day a week. Students range in age from 2nd to 12th grade. There are no weekend hours available.
10024.title: Volunteer Tutors Needed!

10024.description: Heat and serve dinner, socialize, and facilitate conversation at DOROT's transitional housing facility. Volunteers are needed Monday and Friday nights. DOROT social workers support you in your volunteer efforts. Interview, training, references, and background check are required responsible and mature volunteers 18
10024.title: Serve dinner &  socialize with seniors at DOROT's transitional housing

10024.description: Escort a senior to a cultural event such as a concert, movie, theater or museum. Interview, training, references and background check is required.
10024.title: Escort a senior to a cultural event

10024.description: Teach basic computer skills and internet navigation to a senior in their home. Lessons are 3-4 sessions, depending on the senior’s needs, for approximately one hour. Interview, training, references and background check are required.
10024.title: Teach computer skills to seniors in Manhattan

10024.description: Make a friend for a lifetime! Visit a senior and forge a new friendship. Enjoy conversation, companionship and share mutual interests. These weekly one hour visits occur within the home of a senior residing on the East Side or Upper West Side of Manhattan. You will be matched by a professional social worker to establish a meaningful and rewarding relationship. A volunteer orientation,interview, training, references, background check and year-long commitment are required.
10024.title: Become a Friendly Visitor with a local senior

10024.description: Help frail seniors with grocery shopping, getting to medical appointments or just taking a walk in the park! Interview, training, references and background check is required.
10024.title: Help seniors with grocery shopping and errands in Manhattan

07601.description: BVMI provide free primary healthcare to low-income Bergen County residents who do not have health insurance. We are running a support group on Thursday evenings and most of our patients bring their children to the group. We would love to have one or two people to supervise the children while the parents attend this group. There are no babies in this group. Teenagers are welcome and community service letters will be signed,
07601.title: Babysitting

07601.description: BVMI provides free primary healthcare to low-income Bergen County residents who do not have health insurance. We are looking for volunteer doctors, physician assistants and other healthcare professionals to treat our patients. PCPs are especially welcome, but specialists are always needed to practice at BVMI, either in our office and/or for us to refer to. All volunteers must have a valid license to practice in NJ. BVMI provides free malpractice insurance to those doctors seeing patients in our office at 75 Essex Street.
07601.title: Volunteer Physician /Physician Assistant - On-Site

07601.description: BVMI provides free primary healthcare to low-income Bergen County residents who do not have health insurance. Our patients lack the means to pay for medical care; BVMI keeps our patients out of local Emergency Departments. Our patients come from many different backgrounds so we are looking for an interpreter to sit with our social worker one afternoon a week as she interacts with potential clients. If you are ready to give back to your community and speak Spanish, BVMI is the right place for you. For more information about BVMI, please visit www.bvmi,org.
07601.title: Interpreter - Spanish

07601.description: BVMI provides free primary healthcare to low-income Bergen County residents who do not have health insurance. Our patients lack the means to pay for medical care; BVMI keeps our patients out of local Emergency Departments. Healthcare professionals are at the heart of BVMI. A team of 65 volunteer physicians, nurses and other medical scribes provide medical care for BVMI’s patients. Our scribes specialize in charting physician-patient encounters during medical exams. If you are a student getting ready to attend medical school or presently in medical school and are looking for experience, BVMI is the right place for you. This volunteer position offers one-on-one collaboration with a physician and is unprecedented in terms of exposure to real medicine in practice. Our scribes learn about patient care on the job in real time. The center is open Monday - Friday, 9am - 5pm. Thursday we are open until 7pm and we are flexible in terms of how often and how much time you spend at BVMI Our patients come from many different backgrounds; please let us know if you are bilingual (Spanish, Korean, Chinese, etc). For more information about BVMI, please visit www.bvmi,org.
07601.title: Medical Scribe

07601.description: Volunteers needed to represent BVMI at health fairs throughout Bergen County. We will train and provide information about BVMI for distribution.
07601.title: Health Fair Representative

07601.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07601.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Hackensack

07601.description: As part of our mission we deliver workshops to existing clients and the public on a variety of small business topics. The topics range from very tactical such as how to use specific accounting software to strategic planning for a business. We are seeking a few people to help grow our workshop program by helping us define and develop workshops to be delivered in the Northeast NJ area. The right candidate will understand how to define what topics are needed based on market research and past program performance. They will be able to seek out and establish relationships with presenters. They will evaluate the content and presenters and submit them for approval by the Workshop committee. The Workshop developer will review the client feedback to determine if the workshop should be repeated, the frequency and any changes required to make the program more effective. The actual execution of the workshops may be turned over to workshop administrators or retained as appropriate and desired. The work can largely be done remotely but occasional meetings at our office in Hackensack NJ will be required as will attendance at some number of workshops.
07601.title: SCORE Northeast NJ - Workshop Leader/Development

07601.description: BVMI is seeking individuals to conduct financial screening of new and existing patients to determine qualification according to established eligibility criteria. Screeners collect required financial records and other documents, and utilize a custom spreadsheet as well as BVMI's medical record software during the interview process. Interviews are done by appointment. There is a need for interviewers who speak English, Spanish and/or Korean.
07601.title: Patient Interviewer

07601.description: BVMI is looking for special volunteers to help interpret for patients and practitioners. Spanish speakers are in high demand, especially those with a medical background. Other languages, including Korean, are also needed.
07601.title: Interpreter

07601.description: BVMI is looking for volunteers to assist with administrative tasks that keep the healthcare center running! If you are good with the computer, like to make phone calls, love helping with special events or just like to stuff envelopes, we can put you to work. We have a special need for individuals who are bilingual Spanish.
07601.title: Office Volunteer

07601.description: BVMI is looking for volunteer nurses, nurse practitioners and other healthcare professionals to treat patients. Our volunteers work, on average, four-hour shifts every other week and have schedules that provide flexibility for vacation, work and/or travel. Volunteers must have valid license to practice in NJ.
07601.title: Nurse Volunteer

07601.description: The laboratory trained students for over 15yrs. Interested in training early stage student/yourg professional via volunteer program Mainly looking for biology-related trained post-college/Masters degree, PhDs and MDs. All volunteers/interns are supervised under my senior postdoctoral fellows (PhDs). This program is not paid position, so no salary or compensation of any kind involved. Program is for volunteers and non-paid internship. Some are under OPT- this is unpaid training. You are expected to be trained for scientific research and get cancer research experience. I do have set guidelines for this program. Must work minimum 5hrs/day, 4 days/wk (flexible) Must stay with the lab for minimum 1yr. Must publish papers as coauthors with us If wish to stay with the lab and funding is available, we will consider hiring (you must show high productivity via publication records) Will get some junior student supervision experience Most of my trainees get trained while they prepare for industry jobs, PhD program, medical school or MD residency. I do need to evaluate CV for qualification and interview them.
07601.title: Cancer Research Volunteers/ Non-Paid Internship, OPT and Training

07601.description: The CHEER Program is looking for volunteers to provide supportive services to senior citizens of Bergen County. We provide grocery shopping and errands for the seniors. The CHEER Programs needs to have a commitment of 2 hours per week. Individuals and parent/child teams are welcome.
07601.title: Visiting Homemaker Home Health Aide Service of Bergen County
07601.org: Visiting Homemaker Home Health Aide Service

07601.description: We are seeking Professional Advisory Committee members to provide guidance in speciality areas such as home health care, social services, senior care, Medicaid, quality assurance, fundraising, information technology, financial, legal, program development, building maintenance. Our immediate desire is to have six to eight members on the professional advisory committee that would meet one to two times per year and be available for consultation by telephone as needed. Educational and professional experience in the speciality areas listed is preferred.
07601.title: Professional Advisory Committee Members
07601.org: Visiting Homemaker Home Health Aide Service

07601.description: Cheer volunteers visit frail and isolated elderly persons over the age of 60. They provide socialization and assist clients with tasks to help maintain the client's independence. Specific tasks vary with the individuals, but the majority needs are food shopping and local errands.
07601.title: Cheer Volunteer
07601.org: Visiting Homemaker Home Health Aide Service

07601.description: The Board of Trustees has the ultimate authority, responsibility and accountability for the operation of the agency. The responsibilities of a member of the board of trustees are: To support the agency mission To attend Board meetings To participate on a least one standing committee. To participate and assume the responsibilities and function of the board which includes: To be accountable to the people served by the agency's programs. To be accountable to the members of the larger community and their needs. To assist the establishment of goals and the development of policy for the organization. To review agency personnel policies To conduct annual evaluations of the agency's program services. To strengthen the financial agency base through assistance with resource development To Manage the assets of the organization productively. To Establish personnel policies, including benefits To Review the by-laws and administrative policies of the organization. To Oversee all contracts made by the agency. To evaluate organizationial compliance in respect to all laws and regulations. To function as an ambassador for the organization both in heightening awareness about its mission, and bring vital information to the organization. To participate in the annual planning process and three year self evaluation study.
07601.title: Board of Trustee Member
07601.org: Visiting Homemaker Home Health Aide Service

11224.description: When volunteers visit with homebound seniors something very moving emerges! Visit a homebound senior in your area, (maybe even down your own block!) and see the impact 1 hour makes! To be a part of an amazing experience and true kindness please consider reaching out to find our more information on how YOU can be involved. Just one hour a week is all it takes!
11224.title: Be Kind to Your Neighbor
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: P.S. 329 hosts a Teaching Academy for 4th and 5th graders, where they learn about dance, sports and fine arts. They want to add a cooking component onto the Academy so the students can learn all about their favorite foods and dishes, how to prepare them and much more! We are in search of professional chefs and cooks who have experience teaching children or classes about cooking. Our goal is to enrich the students' experiences and build their self-confidence in these specialized fields. Ideally this will be a weekly or bi-weekly session running 90 minutes during the school day. Not able to commit to a weekly visit? Not an issue! We are looking for multiple guest cooking teachers to visit the students for the Academy. About P.S. 329: \"The P.S. 329 Family is committed to empowering young people to believe in themselves. We promote excellence within our students by setting high standards, nurturing their talents and encouraging creativity. We inspire the leaders of tomorrow.\" Please contact Amy Guthrie (aguthrie@changeforkids.org) with any questions!
11224.title: Teach 4th and 5th Graders to Cook at P.S. 329 near Coney Island

11224.description: As the warmer weather approaches we continue to look for volunteers who will join our wonderful program, and bring a bit of warmth and sunshine to our sernior friends. Find out what you can do to help the seniors of your community by calling us at 718-449-5000 ext. 2311
11224.title: Our senior friends would love to meet you!
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Purpose JASA is seeking a volunteer to lead a group of seniors through a variety of dances, providing valuable physical exercise while having fun with a lively group. Responsibilities * Lead a group of seniors in a weekly dance class * Create routines suitable for varied skill levels and physical abilities * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Exercise/dance certification * Experience leading seniors in exercise/dance * Knowledge of line and/or folk dance * Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity, weekday availability only * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Long Island.
11224.title: Dance Instructor - JASA Luna Park Senior Center

11224.description: Visit a homebound senior in your area! Not only will you make a difference in their lives but you will learn so much form them! We have a few seniors who are pet lovers and would enjoy a friendly visit where they can introdice their pets to you! Learn more by visiting us at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and register online or call us at 718-449-5000 ext. 2212.
11224.title: Cat's got your tongue? Friendly Visiting
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: You can volunteer and make a real difference in a homebound individuals life in so many different ways. We are a dynamic and diverse group of volunteers who visit homebound individual in their area each week. Every member of our team is willing and eager to share their time with someone who is older, wiser, and has had a lifetime of experience.
11224.title: Exercise your heart and visit a senior!
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Purpose The ability to understand English is an important skill at any age. It’s never too late to learn! Facilitate a class that allows seniors to practice speaking, reading and writing English. Responsibilities Lead a weekly class in ESL (English as a Second Language) Create lessons suitable for people with varying knowledge of English Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Experience teaching ESL Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required Good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks Strong communication skills Patience Knowledge of Russian is helpful, but not required Comfort leading a group of varying levels Other Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week during business hours Ongoing opportunity Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens.
11224.title: ESL Teacher for Russian Speakers - JASA Luna Park Senior Center

11224.description: If you live in Brooklyn or travel to Brooklyn on a weekly basis and can commit to one hour a week for at least 6 months, this is the program to be part of! You won’t regret it! The majority of our seniors live alone without any regular visitors. Having outlived spouses, siblings, friends, and even their own children, they are often extremely isolated. Almost every one of our seniors don't interact with anyone - ever - except the person who we match to visit them. Our Friendly Visiting program provides much-needed companionship for these homebound elderly in Brooklyn... but we need you! Visit us at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and find out more or simply enter your info on our site to be contacted. We will meet with you and match you with the senior that is right for you!
11224.title: Can you spare 1 hour?
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Volunteers needed to partner with senior clients to help then get to and from medical appointments/centers/temples. This program aims to offer assistance and support to our senior clients as well as to provide an important social network. It is often a challenge for seniors to travel to and from appointments, and they are often forced to stay home unable to leave for days at a time. With your help the client can get where they need or wouldlike to get to safely and at an appropriate time while also decreasing the feeling of lonliness.
11224.title: Senior Buddy-Socialization at it's Best!
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Purpose Introduce seniors to the fundamentals of crocheting and knitting. Responsibilities * Prepare weekly knitting and crocheting lessons for seniors * Create items to donate to give back to the community such as blankets for veterans or caps for infants * Knit or crochet items to beautify the senior center * Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills * Proficient in knitting and/or crocheting * Experience teaching arts & crafts * Experience working with seniors is helpful, but not required * Comfortable leading individuals with varying ability through activities * Patience Other * Flexible scheduling is available with a minimum commitment of one day a week * Ongoing opportunity * Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies
11224.title: Knitting/Crocheting Instructor - JASA Luna Park Senior Center

JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens.
11224.title: Art Instructor - JASA Luna Park Senior Center

11224.description: Retired? Have extra time on your hands? You can help! Do you have extra time on your hands that you're looking to fill in a meaningful way? If so this is perfect for you. We are in need of retired volunteers to visit homebound seniors in Boro Park, Bensonhurst and Sheepshead Bay. Visits are scheduled based on your availability. Just 1 hour a week is all it takes. If you can commit to visiting someone each week, this opportunity would be great for you. For more information please call Friendly Visiting (718) 449-5000 x 2205 or e-mail t.lieberman@jccgci.org. Just 1 hour a week really can make a difference in homebound senior's life.
11224.title: Friendly Visiting - Retired Volunteers to Visit Homebound Seniors
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Our mission is to serve homebound seniorsa sense of connection through our volunteers. Our seniors live alone, without family or friends nearby. Their interaction with others is often limited to our visits. Our weekly visits make a world of difference to our survivors. Provide emotional support thorough conversations, games, walks etc....
11224.title: Visit and learn from a Holocaust Survivor
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Can you spare one hour a week? Why not make that one hour count! Join the Friendly Visiting Program and that one hour will make a difference in the life of an isolated senior. Visit a senior and discuss fond memories, recent encounters, play games or read and discuss a book together. Help relieve feelings of isolation and loneliness experienced by the senior citizens of your community. For more information call 718-449-5000 ext. 2311.
11224.title: Friendly Visiting- Help Bring a Smile to a Senior's Face
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11030.description: North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset is looking for caring volunteers to join our Pet Therapy Program. Pet Therapy volunteers, along with their therapy dogs, bring much needed comfort to patients, families, visitors and staff. Therapy Dogs International (TDI) certification preferred. We offer flexible shifts 7 days a week. At North Shore University Hospital we believe that people deserve exceptional care. That's why patient experience is a central focus and the driving force behind our volunteer services department. Join our cause, make a difference, and become a volunteer.
11030.title: Pet Therapy Volunteer

11030.description: North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset is looking for caring people to join our \"MealTime Mate Feeding Program.\" MealTime Mate volunteers are specially trained to provide assistance and companionship to those patients who need help with their meals. Breakfast, lunch and dinner shifts are available 7 days a week. At North Shore University Hospital we believe that people deserve exceptional care. That's why patient experience is a central focus and the driving force behind our volunteer services department. Join our cause, make a difference, and become a volunteer.
11030.title: MealTime Mate Feeder Volunteer

11030.description: Women's Comprehensive Health Center in Manhasset is looking for vibrant, energetic people to greet patients, provide directions and escort as needed. If you are willing to give us a few daytime, weekday hours, we need your compassion and !
11030.title: Ambassador

10022.description: Seeking serious and committed individuals who would value the opportunity to join the volunteer board of directors of this independent Not-for-profit. Candidates should care deeply about strengthening and supporting Israel, and be interested in healthcare. Soroka Medical Center is one of Israel's leading medical centers, and an internationally respected humanitarian leader. Our board prides itself on its diversity. Board members meet at least four times a year, contribute financially to the organization at a significant level, and attend events. Board members have the opportunity to focus their engagement in the organization in their personal area of expertise, including Finance, Legal, Marketing, PR, Social Media, Writing, etc.
10022.title: Board Member
10022.org: AMERICAN FRIENDS OF SOROKA MEDICAL CENTER INC

10022.description: Raise awareness for children's literacy and girls' education, while getting involved with the local NYC community! We are looking for volunteers with diverse skill sets to help raise awareness and fundraise for Room to Read's global mission.
10022.title: Volunteer for children's literacy and girl's education!
10022.org: Room to Read New York Chapter

10022.description: Cathedral High School (CHS) is a Catholic, college preparatory school located in the heart of Manhattan, which welcomes young women of all faiths and cultures. Since it opened its doors in 1905, Cathedral has been a place where young women feel at home and are encouraged to be strong, smart, independent women who can do anything they set their minds to. In 2012, Cathedral High School was ranked by The New York Observer as one of New York City’s top 160 schools and among the top 35 private high schools. Almost all of our students are daughters of immigrant working families. 645 young women representing 72 countries attend CHS. Many of our students come from families who earn at or below the federal poverty level (60% of students are eligible for free or reduced lunch). Over 82% of our girls are Hispanic or of African American descent. Through the decades, CHS has continued to enhance its academic curriculum and extra-curricular activities to ensure that students graduate equipped with the skills necessary to be successful in college and careers thereafter. CHS routinely graduates nearly 100% of its students - compared to a current graduation rate of 61.3% for NYC public schools - and assists students in securing tens of millions of dollars in college scholarships. CHS graduates have the skills to be competitive in the global workforce and a sense of obligation to others so that they give back to their New York City community. We are seeking Volunteer Board Members to help us fulfill this mission.
10022.title: Volunteer Board Member

10022.description: Nonviolence International is a decentralized network of resource centers that researches and promotes nonviolent action and seeks to reduce the use of violence worldwide. We believe that every culture and religion can employ appropriate nonviolence methods for positive social change and international peace. Nonviolence International NY focuses on the United Nations, and on the community of New York City. We aim to share with the New York community the important things happening at the UN in our areas of work: Culture of Peace and Nonviolence, Disarmament, Palestine: Peace and Justice, UN Goals, UN-Civil Society Relations, Women's Issues. We are looking for a volunteer to produce photo and video content on a weekly basis while working closely with our social media team. We have our own basic equipment, but if you have your own tripod or lights, that is helpful but not at all required to be chosen for this position. The responsibilities will include vidoegraphy and photography of live events, people, and our work. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to propose ideas for content.
10022.title: Photography and Videography for NGO

10022.description: Nonviolence International is a decentralized network of resource centers that researches and promotes nonviolent action and seeks to reduce the use of violence worldwide. We believe that every culture and religion can employ appropriate nonviolence methods for positive social change and international peace. Nonviolence International NY focuses on the United Nations, and on the community of New York City. We aim to share with the New York community the important things happening at the UN in our areas of work: Culture of Peace and Nonviolence, Disarmament, Palestine: Peace and Justice, UN Goals, UN-Civil Society Relations, Women's Issues. We are looking for an intern to run our social media accounts and write original content for our organization. Interns will gain both the expeerience of social media marketing, and working at an NGO.
10022.title: Social Media and Content Management for NGO

10022.description: Interested in serving as a high impact agent of change on a New York City nonprofit board? Contact BoardAssist. BoardAssist is the leading personalized board recruiting resource available to the tri-state nonprofit community. We offer New Yorkers who want to make a real change in the nonprofit world hundeds of board options and advice on selecting the right one for them. Our nonprofit clients range from start-up organizations to some of the most established names in the nonprofit community, and serve interest areas from arts and education to the environment and poverty relief. Though most BoardAssist clients are New York-based, they serve locally, nationally and internationally. BoardAssist has been responsible for bringing over $80 million into the nonprofit community through our board placements over the last 15 years. We are a nonprofit ourselves. Please send your resume or LinkedIn link when emailing BoardAssist at info@boardassist.org, or simply fill out our new Candidate Application We very much appreciate your interest in giving back! Most boards require board members to give at least $5000/year to their nonprofit.
10022.title: Join a NYC Board of Directors - BoardAssist has 100s of New York board member openings
