11434.title: Youth Activities Coordinator

11434.description: The Arts @ Henson-Parks, Inc. is excited to bring The Pupil Project to after school programs, and for great reason to schools challenged in offering expanded arts education. Students in grades 3-12 in Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx and Manhattan benefit greatly from participation in our arts program The Pupil Project. It is a mobile educational initiative providing hands on instruction in digital photography, filmmaking and basic photo editing. Our program encourages participants to organically explore their surroundings and capture what they see. Program Coordinators assist with the structure of our program delivery inside the classroom, working closely with the Photography Instructor in teaching kids grades 3-12 digital photography, videography, and basic editing. Also assisting in acquiring required materials and proper data collection (weekly attendance, permission slips, etc). THe Coordinators manage equipment distribution and collection, assist with instruction, and creating fun, relevant activities in relation to material learned. Reports to the Program Manager. *Volunteer opportunity to salaried position, contingent on funding.
11434.title: Program Coordinator/ Assist Instructor - "The Pupil Project" Afterschool Photography Program

11435.description: The Graphic Artist/Designer will provide concepts, graphic design ad artwork production for organization as assigned, or serves as consultant in a particular area of expertise for the organization at events or programs. Range of materials may include brochure development, logos, direct mail programs, magazine/newspaper advertisements, electronic newsletters, web design, tshirt etc. The Graphic Artist/Designer will provie concept, design, production and coordination services for the organization and programs.
11435.title: Graphic Arts/Designer

11435.description: We are looking for volunteer board members to help lead and strengthen our programs and services for young women and children. If you are able to contribute your time, dedication, skills and leadership, one evening a month and are interested in exploring this opportunity, please contact us to find out whether this opportunity is right for you. We are especially looking for individuals with experience in accounting, legal, grant writing and fundraising.
11435.title: Great Board Members Wanted!

11435.description: Become a Mentor/Personal Empowerment Coach! We are looking for individuals committed to excellence, to help empower our young women to succeed in life. Menotrs/Personal Empowerment Coaches will help their mentees develop social, educational/vocational and leadership skills that support personal and academic achievement. Mentor/Personal Empowerment Coaches wil meet with their mentees bi-weekly, document their contacts and facilate monthly empowerment workshops. As a mentor/personal Empowerment Coach, you will receive orientation, ongoing training & support and be a part of a growing team of professional who share your passion.
11435.title: Aim to Inspire! - Become a Mentor/Personal Empowerment Coach

07642.description: Joan's Joy is all about children. Our Foundation was a created in memory of a special little girl and we are committed to promoting child safety and helping children that are dealing with hardship. We need helping filling bags with child safety information that we will give way at the our next event It will be Saturday September 23rd from 12-5PM Joan's Joy will be holding a fun family event to promote child safety education and be a joyful experience for parents and children of all ages. Child digital finger print ID cards will be made for parents to have in case of an emergency. The Hillsdale Police Department will have an area to talk about their new Child Abduction Awareness Program and connect with the community. Thank you for your interest. www.Joansjoy.org
07642.title: Can you help us fill tote bags with child safety information
07642.org: The Joan Angela D'Alessandro Memorial Foundation

07642.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07642.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Hillsdale

07643.description: Project Coordinators (PC's), volunteer in a leadership capacity at our volunteer opportunities and provide organization and a team atmosphere for every volunteer experience. We encourage these exceptional community leaders to make a commitment at one specific program usually once or twice monthly for the span of six months. Project Coordinators (or PCs) provide leadership in Jersey Cares’ recurring volunteer opportunities by serving as a liaison between volunteers, nonprofit partners, and Jersey Cares. They encourage volunteers to \"Be the Change\" and provide directions during projects. It’s a fun learning opportunity where you get to network with nonprofits and other community leaders while being supported by a cohort of other volunteer leaders. Project Coordinators commit to 1+ projects per month for 6 months at a time. READ MORE: https://www.jerseycares.org/JC_Project_Coordinator Contact: Dawn Browning Programs Manager, Leadership Development Dawn@jerseycares.org (973) 533-1993, ext. 20
07643.title: Project Coordinator - Be a Leader

07645.description: This position requires 1-2 Directors per NJ County Duties are to oversee and coordinate all work done by the foster care program. Maintains master database records for all active foster applicants. Executes all other foster roles as needed. Keeps Board of Directors and Foster Chair informed on key decisions. Recruits, interviews and prepares fosters to take a pet. Completes evaluation on background and veterinarian referrals. . Sets up home interview for each foster and conducts interview. Maintains master database of fosters. Communicates regularly with foster families who are not currently fostering a pet. Performs a variety of duties to assist with the intake process for pets of domestic violence victims entering the Shelter Our Pets program. Duties range from assisting a client with intake paperwork, reviewing completed pet intake forms, transporting animals to a veterinarian, evaluating behavior of canines and felines, transporting animals to fosters, getting them set-up in the foster home, and offering basic pet care and handling instructions to the foster family. Communicates directly with the caseworker overseeing the case, and keeps the Foster Chair updated on the case. Matches client’s pet(s) to appropriate foster. Coordinates getting pet, trainer and foster together. Coordinates transport of animal. May involve doing actual transport, temperament test/evaluation. Coordinates grooming and medical visits. Makes follow-up phone calls as outlined in program.
07645.title: Foster Program Director(s) NJ Counties

07645.description: Case Manager(s) *You need to be located within the state of NJ or Rockland County. This position may be fill by one or more individuals. The role of the caseworker is to be the primary point of contact with the client and domestic violence shelter. The Case manager performs a variety of duties to assist with the intake process for pets of domestic violence victims entering the Shelter Our Pets program. Duties range from assisting a client with intake paperwork, reviewing completed pet intake forms, collecting documents required to show proof of ownership, collecting veterinary documents, and getting all the information collected to the Foster Director and Foster Chair. Working with the Foster Director and Foster Chair, the caseworker coordinates the intake and discharge of the pets. They stay in communication with the client and shelter staff. They provide communication and pet updates to the client and shelter staff. The Case Manager is in charge of updating and maintaining the SOP Case Tracking Spreadsheet. Knowledge, Abilities and Skills Ability to- Deal courteously and calmly with the client. Must be nonjudgemental. Transmit information promptly and clearly to Foster Director and Chair. Drive for a moderate length of time (2 hours+) if needed. Adhere to strict confidentiality policy. Update and maintenance case log in conjunction with Foster Director. Training and/or Education Required: High school diploma or GED. Must have one or more of the following: Two years of experience working in an animal shelter, kennel or boarding facility or with an animal welfare or rescue group. Veterinary background. Crisis training. (Can be provided) Master of Social Work Preferred: Experience working with animals AND people in stressful situations. Licenses or Certificates Required: Valid driver's license Preferred: American Red Cross Pet First Aid Animal Control Officer CERT CART Vet Tech Shelter Our Pets is an all-volunteer nonprofit corporation serving New Jersey and beyond. Our mission is to provide a safe haven for the pets of victims of domestic violence who are fleeing their abusive situations. Shelter Our Pets assists people seeking safety from violence by providing alternatives to giving up a beloved pet, leaving a pet behind in a potentially dangerous situation or continuing to subject themselves and their pets to abuse. A recognized 501(c)3 charity located in New Jersey
07645.title: Case Manager - Pet Foster Program

07645.description: FOSTER COORDINATOR Working under the County Directors, Foster Coordinators can cover a variety of duties to assist the County Directors with managing the foster program. These duties include recruiting, interviewing and prepare fosters to take a pet. Completing vet checks and background checks. Setting up home interviews for each foster and conducting interview. Foster Coordinators may also coordinate the transport of animal, do actual transport, coordinate grooming and medical visits and make follow-up phone calls to fosters as outlined in program. Knowledge, Abilities and Skills The basic methods and procedures of kennel and crate cleaning. The basic methods and laws for safe animal transport. Ability to- Deal courteously and calmly with the foster. Transmit information promptly and clearly to fosters and foster program team members. Handle animals safely and effectively, including canines, felines, aviary and other small domestic animals. Adhere to strict confidentiality policy. Training and/or Education Required: High school diploma or GED. Licenses or Certificates Required: Valid driver's license Functional car equipped for animal transport Valid license and registration for car Preferred: Experience working in an animal shelter, kennel or boarding facility or with an animal welfare or rescue group. 07901.description: Founded in 1912, Girl Scouts of the USA is the preeminent organization for girls with a current membership of 3.6 million girls and adults. Volunteers use their expertise, skills, interests, and life experience to shape fun and enriching leadership experiences for girls and inspire them to reach their personal best. Girl Scouts Heart of New Jersey is looking for a Service Unit Manager to oversee Girl Scouts in the Summit community. As the Service Unit Manager, you will oversee the \"business\" of the service unit. With the help of council staff and your team of volunteers, you will work to grow Girl Scouts in Summit. Responsibilities include: Attend training to learn the job and participate in ongoing learning opportunities for continuous growth in the position Work in partnership with council staff to support leaders in your community Create an annual plan of action that includes leader meetings, girl and leader events, recruitment activities and financial planning Recruit and evaluate all Service Unit team members Oversee and support adult members in the Service Unit Team Support to all volunteers through a variety of communication methods Coordinate recruitments to recruit volunteers and girls reflective of the diverse community Create progressive opportunities to engage girls and adults within the Service Unit Qualifications: Computer Skills: Access to e-mail and the internet Excellent organization skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Men are welcome! No previous Girl Scout experience needed. Training is provided Benefits: Develop leadership skills in a supportive, fun environment Volunteer around your schedule. No minimum hours required. Make a difference in the lives of girls Gain transferable skills in management, budgeting, and group dynamics Access to learning opportunities that only volunteers have access to
07901.title: Want to develop leadership skills while having fun?
07901.org: Girl Scouts Heart of New Jersey

07901.description: We realize the importance of cultivating partnerships with corporations and community organizations to further our mission, and we like everyone to see the important work that our staff and hundreds of volunteers do daily. Besides giving employees an opportunity to do something positive for the community, corporate volunteering is good for PR, helps build team morale, develops employee skills and helps with local connections. SAGE offers multiple ways your group can help. We are always open to suggestions! Meals on Wheels For either one Day of Caring, or for an ongoing basis, volunteers deliver meals and spend a few minutes with home-bound, isolated people. Monday through Friday from 11:00 - 12:30 Up to 6 \"teams\" (cars) of employees can come to SAGE to pick up meals. Our staff supplies each team with everything they need and instructions. Local businesses have also chosen to do this on an ongoing basis if employee schedules allow. We also ask community members to \"guest\" volunteer during the month of March for the national March for Meals promotion. We also have a small Food Pantry, so non-perishables are always welcome! Spend A Day SAGE’s adult medical day center provides a safe and fun environment for vulnerable older adults. Corporate volunteers can come (best hours between 10:30 and 3:00) and work on a project with the clients, whether it be art, gardening, entertainment, oral histories, photography, etc. The staff welcomes outside groups for socialization and to supplement the calendar of activities. Maximum group size is 15. Sensitivity Training The ultimate team building experience, SAGE’s Sensitivity Training is a unique opportunity for your team to experience what it feels like to age in a series of exercises that simulate age related physical and mental conditions. The program is customizable and flexible with time - lasting from 45 minutes to 3 hours. Skill Based Volunteers We welcome the help of your expertise! We can always use skilled consultants - anything from planning events to helping with fundraising to serving on our board.
07901.title: Day of Caring for Corporations and Community Organizations

07901.description: JerseySTEM is an all volunteers grassroots non-profit agency dedicated to bridging the Innovation Gap, the Opportunity Gap and the Gender Gap in STEM education. We provide free of charge after-school, project-based, hands-on, team structures programs in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math to underserved students in New Jersey. Classes include: Robotics, Coding, Engineering, Life Sciences, etc. and are focused on kids grade 5-8. The programs last 10 weeks and are taught predominantly by volunteer college students that we recruit, train, transport and mentor as they donate 2 hours/week to the program. Position Description Under direction of organization leadership, you will plan, organize, direct, and manage human resource activities including on/off boarding volunteers, recruiting, running background checks, and related activities/responsibilities. You will advise volunteer and organization leadership on human resource-related issues and will develop, coordinate, and implement human resource policies and procedures across the organization. Essential Functions of the Volunteer Position -Build and maintain relationships with local companies to create sponsorship opportunities -Proactively research and meet with local companies to begin the sponsorship relationship -Create activities designed to promote JerseySTEM to the local community and introduce us to local business Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities -Past experience in project management -Willingness to pick up the phone and/or visit local businesses to find potential sponsorship opportunities -Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills

You will advise volunteer and organization leadership on finance-related issues and will develop, coordinate, and implement finance policies and procedures across the organization. Essential Functions of the Volunteer Position -Effectively manage and lead the finance team -Serve as liaison between the finance team and the rest of the organization -Oversee all reporting and fiduciary tasks -Ensure organization and all volunteers follow proper finance procedure as set forth by you and your team Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities -Experience as a manager of people or as a team leader -Solid experience in finance, accounting and/or business management -Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills -Well organized, with strong attention to detail

Meet once a week with a Team of Girls and coach them through the brainstorming, selection, sketching and design and submission of the app concept. Winning teams will receive mobile devices, thousands in cash for the program, and the opportunity to be coached by MIT Media Lab professionals to build their app and bring it to Google Play store. The winning students retain intellectual property rights to their app.

07901.title: Front Desk Receptionist

Mentored youth have significantly better chances for high school graduation and college acceptance, thereby significantly increasing life's opportunities. You can make a huge difference in someone's life's outcome!!
07901.title: Be a Mentor - Make a difference for a lifetime!

07648.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. You CAN decide which program you want to be a part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become familiarized with Homecare Homebase software Work on Special Projects when needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patients' quality of life Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Benefits Increase purpose and meaning in your life by positively impacting other lives Experience significant opportunities for personal growth and development Convenient FREE training that fits your schedule Internship Credit (if applicable) Develop interpersonal skills Build your resume Reference Letter after a period of commitment Join our team of volunteers who make a difference!!
07648.title: Hospice/Healthcare Volunteers Needed - Norwood, NJ

07648.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07648.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Norwood

07649.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07649.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Oradell

07869.description: Grace Healthcare Services welcomes is looking for Hospice volunteers. We welcome your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07869.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer!

07080.description: Contact us for more information on working with hospice patients close to where you live. We provide FREE volunteer training for you along with free TB and Rubella/Rubeola testing. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
07080.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

07081.description: Volunteer Opp: Outreach & Special Projects Volunteer- Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Description: The American Cancer Society office seeks volunteers to assist the Community Development Team with public relations, volunteer calls, and outreach to secure in-kind donations in support of Making Strides Against Breast Cancer of Newark, Jersey City, Parsippany and Ridgefield Park. In addition, the office volunteer will assist the team with special projects including event coordination support and community outreach support. About the American Cancer Society The American Cancer Society’s mission is to save lives, celebrate lives, and lead the fight for a world without cancer. We are a nationwide, community-based, voluntary health organization dedicated to eliminating cancer as a major health problem by preventing cancer, saving lives, and diminishing suffering from cancer through research, education, advocacy, and service.
07081.title: Outreach & Special Project Volunteer-Making Strides Against Breast Cancer

07081.description: Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is looking for responsible individuals to volunteer at its Springfield-based outpatient pediatric therapy center. Volunteers would be responsible for assisting therapists during recreation and therapeutic programs, organizing and cleaning materials and equipment and possibly performing a few light office duties (chart organization, filing, etc.). This is an excellent opportunity for high school or college students interested in allied health professions to gain valuable experience and obtain required observational hours or for any individuals who want to help kids succeed in life. Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is an affiliate of Trinitas Regional Medical Center and a leading provider of school and center based occupational, physical and speech therapy services for children of all ages. Our Springfield office hours are 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM Monday through Friday. Recreation programs (when volunteers are most needed) tend to run after school and in the early evenings.
07081.title: Children's Therapy Service

07086.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
07086.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Weehawken NJ

11726.description: We are looking for volunteers to join our Board of Directors. The current open positions we have are Director of Community Outreach, Director of Media(Public Relations), and Director of Marketing. We are seeking individuals who share a passion in our mission, and is enthusiastic about carrying our organization to it's next level. Come Join Us! We Want You!
11726.title: Looking For a Few Good Board Members

11726.description: From time to time we need volunteers to assist with mailings - folding letters, stuffing envelopes and labeling envelopes.
11726.title: Office Work

11726.description: Volunteer to be on a committee such as our annual Chefs for A Cause fundraiser being held at the Venetian Yacht Club, our annual Golf Outing our perhaps our Bowling event. Several opportunities available. Duties can be varied: PR, decorating, raffle/giveaways,program, liason with restaurants/distributors. Also looking for someone who can type, and a photographer is always needed.
11726.title: Fund raising committee

10075.description: The Carter Burden Network is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Network's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBCA can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. We are looking for a temporary receptionist volunteer at our Main Office located in the Upper East Side. The receptionist will answer the phone and will meet and greet all visitors. A training and supervision will be provided by the Executive Secretary. Skills/ Qualifications: Ability to listen and communicate Professional phone demeanor Ability to present a professional, friendly, and objective appearance to visitors and staff Schedule: This is an ongoing volunteer opportunity. Volunteers will be needed on an adhoc basis through out the fall and winter. This position is best for a volunteer with a flexible-day schedule or retired corporate professional. If you are interested in this volunteer opportunity, please contact us at: volunteer@carterburdennetwork.org
10075.title: Receptionist Volunteer

10170.description: Purpose: Samuel Waxman Cancer Research Foundation is looking for an individual who can volunteer to provide support at the front desk & for the entire staff. Qualifications: Able to commit to at least one shift: (1 Days) Monday, - Friday: 9 - 1 pm (1 Day) Monday- Friday: 1 - 4 pm - Ability to act resourcefully and with appropriate degree of independence in completing tasks - Follows organizational procedures - Detail oriented - Excellent written and verbal communication skills - Inputs donor data accurately into appropriate databases - Acts in professional polite manner in dealing with colleagues, vendors and members of public - Proficient in Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, Outlook - Raiser’s Edge experience a plus Duties: Performs tasks effectively in furtherance of the operations of the Samuel Waxman Cancer Research Foundation including those related to donor management, administrative support, data entry & reconciliation. Specific Tasks: - Staff the reception desk - Answer main phone line - Maintaining appropriate organizational records and filing system - Additional operational & administrative tasks - Providing event specific support to the Executive Director - Sorting and distributing mail - Monitoring and routing email correspondence from general email account To apply, please send resume to swcrf@waxmancancer.org.
10170.title: Front Desk & Operations Volunteer

08861.description: \"Sometimes music is the only medicine the heart and soul need.\" -Anonymous Do you like to sing or play guitar? Do you enjoy sharing your musical talents with others? If the answer is \"yes\" consider becoming a Compassus hospice volunteer! Help bring comfort and joy to patients and their families. Be the bright spot in someone’s day! Because music reaches a deep, non-rational part of the human spirit, it is ideally suited to address complex end of life feelings such as grief, fear, anxiety, sadness, and anger that stand in the way of a clear passage. Music can release blocked or painful feelings and can stimulate positive ones such as hope, love, and gratitude. What do we provide? Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free TB testing and background check Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Music Volunteers Needed- Singers and Guitar Players Wanted

08861.description: \"If it scares you, it might be a good thing to try.\"- Seth Godin Healthcare and human service undergraduate students play a valuable interdisciplinary treatment role at Compassus Hospice . Compassus offers both volunteer and internship opportunities throughout the entire state of New Jersey. By making a commitment of at least 8 hours a week, you will be trained to become an integral member of our hospice team. Your role will include participating in patient assessment, treatment plans, patient care and medical records documentation. Volunteers and interns are trained to provide physical, psychosocial, and spiritual support to the hospice patient and family. Interns visit with our patients to provide socialization, sensory stimulation, creative arts and companionship. How can you benefit by being a volunteer or intern? Build your resume: Volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Acquire knowledge about hospice and experience in the healthcare field Develop patient interaction skills Experience significant opportunities for growth and development- this is not a sit and observe us internship! We offer you: Free training at a location near you and a time based on your convenience Free TB testing and background check Ongoing educational opportunities Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Healthcare and Human Service Interns and Volunteers

08861.description: \"No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.\" - Aesop By volunteering with Compassus hospice, you have the wonderful opportunity to make meaningful connections with patients and their families. These non-medical visits may take place at an assisted living facility, nursing home, or in the patient’s own home. We work around YOUR schedule- hours and patient visits are based on your availability. Come be the bright spot in someone’s day! What can volunteers do? Make friendly visits to patients in homes and facilities near you Provide caregiver relief and respite Read Listen Share a special talent like music or crafts Administrative support- in our office or from your home computer. Complementary Therapies such as Reiki, Massage, and Pet Therapy (with proper certifications) What do we provide? Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Love to help people? Become a Hospice Volunteer!

08861.description: Volunteer will manage the inventory of in-kind donations, assemble and organize activity packets, puzzle packets and other items used for distribution to patients, and maintain the donation database. Volunteer will also assist with patient experience initiatives as needed.
08861.title: In-Kind Donation Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Assist Volunter Services department with clerical duties such as patient chart assembly, filing, sorting, collating, and preparing mailings. Other clerical and computer task as requested.
08861.title: Volunteer Services Clerical

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Visits patients on all nursing units to offer reading material. Bring reading materials to outpatient waiting areas.
08861.title: Book Cart Volunteer

08861.description: Volunter will provide clerical support for designated departments. Task include; answering telephones, filing, sorting, copying, faxing, data entry and other clerical task as needed.
08861.title: Clerical Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Assists staff by running errands. Volunteers deliver various items throughout the medical center. For example, inter-departmental mail, pharmacy orders, lab orders, drop off mail to departments outside of the medical center, charts, flowers and gifts, medical records, and patient supplies.
08861.title: Volunteer Courier

08861.description: The ED Liaison will provide rounding and facilitate communication between patients and providers in the emergency department acting as a customer service liaison between emergency department staff and patients. The ED Liaison communicates with patients about the patient care process and addresses any needs or concerns that patients or families may have during their stay providing information about wait times, delays, or directions within the facility.
08861.title: Emergency Department Ambassador

08861.description: Sunshine volunteers bring good cheer and smiles to our patients and guest, lifting spirits and brightening their day. The Sunshine volunteer will round the medical center with M.A.C. the Mobile Activity Cart visiting waiting areas, the emergency room and Pediatrics department to offer activity packets to youth guest making their wait time in the clinical areas easier. They will also visit our new mothers in Maternity upon discharge to bring a special gift from the Volunteer Services department. The Sunshine volunteer will also round on patient floors with activity packs for our adult patients. Time commitment is once a week for 3-4 hours depending on patient/guest volume. Ideal start time is 10:00am. One volunteer each day Monday-Friday.
08861.title: Sunshine Volunteer

08861.description: The Hospitality Specialist will provide excellent customer service to patients and guest to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions they may have. Centrally located on the concourse the specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit or redirect them to the proper department. The specialist will provide directions, escort guest to their destination, serve as a liaison to fulfill request from staff (in patient care areas) for patients (i.e.... books, newspapers, bibles, magazines, activity packs etc.)and provide service that exceeds the guest expectations.
08861.title: Hospitaltiy Ambassador

08861.description: Provide rounding on out-patient waiting areas to serve as a point of contact, and act as the medical centers eyes and ears to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions visitors may have. The specialist will facilitate communication between out-patient guest and the department they are receiving services from. The specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit providing information about wait times, delays, and directions within the facility.
08861.title: Service Excellence Ambassador

08861.description: Visits patient floors and spends time with patients deemed either a falls risk, or in need of a little extra TLC. Bedside Buddies can service all designated in-patient adult areas (they are not stationed in one place) and carry a \"buddy kit\" stocked with games they can play with the patient, small projects, or simply to sit and chat for a while.
08861.title: Bedside Buddy Patient Visitor

08861.description: To provide patients the opportunity to interact with trained and certified dogs during their hospitalization to improve thieir emotional and social status.
08861.title: Pet Therapy (Perth Amboy)

08861.description: To welcome medical center visitors (outpatient) and provide directions and/or personally escort visitors to their destinations. To reinforce the medical centers misson to provide exceptional customer service.
08861.title: Medical Center Greeter

08861.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08861.title: Mentor Disadvantaged Youth

08869.description: The Board of Directors for The Learning Gate is made up of dedicated community members who care deeply about the community and look for ways to increase access to early education for underserved populations. Our board is strong, but several members are retiring in the coming months. We seek community members with the skills listed below to donate one evening a month for a 3-year term as a board member. Board members are expected to participate in strategic planning and development activities, to participate in several events throughout the year (fundraisers, youth celebrations, etc.), and to lend their expertise and network connections to the Executive Director of the Association.
08869.title: Board of Directors Members Needed

08869.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Raritan

08904.description: Parker is a non-profit senior service organization serving elders throughout the central Jersey area for 110 years. Our campus, Parker at the Pavilion, offers amenities for our residents residing in the attached Parker at Stonegate Assisted Living Residence, and the Parker at River Road Nursing Care Residence. We are looking for volunteers to assist our staff with various clerical projects as needed. For example, file, stapling, data entry, and more. This can be on a reoccuring basis, or on an \"on call\" basis as needed, upon your availability. If you are interested, please contact us and we'd love to have you!
08904.title: Clerical Assistance Needed at Highland Park Assisted Living Home!

08904.description: We are looking for volunteers to help us distribute fresh produce to those in need this summer, as well as volunteers to help us pick up food deliveries in New Brunswick, stock our shelves, and take part in our regular distributions of non-perishable foods. There are lots of ways you can help -- even if you just have just an hour a month to give. Contact us or learn more on our website: http://sites.google.com/site/hpfoodpantry/ Volunteers are needed on Tuesday mornings, Wednesday mornings and evenings, Thursday mornings, Thursday evenings, Friday late afternoons, and Saturday mornings. Mostly we prefer volunteers who will commit to a regular schedule of volunteering at the same time every month, but one-time or occasional volunteers are allowed on Wednesday evenings and Friday afternoons. Wednesday evenings are the only time that we can allow volunteers who are younger than 18. It's a great group of people -- come lend a hand and meet some of them!
08904.title: Highland Park Food Pantry

08901.description: The Court Appointed Special Advocate (CASA) will champion the needs of a child from your community in the local Court system. They will ensure abuse and neglect does not continue at the hands of the system. Spring training is February 26th - March 29th, with a built in make up day in case of snow. Responsibilities: Become a part of the life of a child in foster care. Speak with people in their lives including teachers, therapists and those who care for them. Investigate their school, medical and case worker records. Discover what resources they may need. Establish and communicate recommendations to court professionals. Skills: Complete 30 hours of training (generally completed in one month, during evenings). Attend a 3 hour Court observation. Take part in a swearing in ceremony with a Family Court judge. Commit to advocating for a child's case from inception to conclusion, generally 18 months. About Us: CASA Middlesex is the only child advocacy program where volunteers are appointed by judges to represent a child's best interest. We serve children from our community in Middlesex County who are in foster care. Children with a CASA volunteer spend less time in foster care and have a higher likelihood of finding of finding a permanent home then non - CASA children. We are endorsed by the American Bar Association, National Council of Juvenile and Family Court Judges and the U.S. Department of Justice.
08901.title: Child Advocate

08901.description: Special Olympics New Jersey has volunteer opportunities for our Young Athlete Program. The Young Athlete Program is an inclusive sports play program for children ages 2 through 7. This program prepares children for future participation in sports while improving gross motor, social and cognitive skills. To volunteer for the Young Athlete Program please use the link below to register to volunteer online. https://2018yapprograms.my-trs.com/
08901.title: Special Olympics New Jersey - Young Athletes Program, New Brunswick

08901.description: Help combat community hunger at the 5 Loaves Pantry. Volunteers help unload and sort food, organize pantry items, and assist clients with shopping.
08901.title: Marketplace in New Brunswick

08901.description: Every year more than half a million abused and neglected children are in need of safe, permanent, nurturing homes. Too many spend years moving from one temporary home to another. They have no family to call their own. They are more likely than other children to face homelessness, unemployment, even prison as adults. That's why CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocates) is important. CASA was created to make sure the abuse and neglect these children originally suffered in the home doesn't continue as abuse and neglect at the hands of the system. As trained advocates, CASA volunteers get to know children in foster care and talk with their caregivers, schools, therapists, and other professionals, in order to gather information about their wellbeing and advocate for them in court. CASA volunteers advocate for the appropriate services to be offered to the children and their families and assist the Court in determining the appropriate permanent plan for each child. No special skills are required and you will receive all the training you need through CASA for Children in Middlesex County. Please note that we primarily serve children originating from Middlesex County, New Jersey, and that travel to other counties is possible.
08901.title: CASA:  Court Appointed Special Advocate

08901.description: Transports children/patients in wheelchairs/stretchers or walks with patients to and from therapy departments. Important functional area of volunteer service requiring reliable and conscientious person who is able to make a reasonable long term commitment
08901.title: Internal Transporter

This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
08901.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Central NJ

08901.description: George Street Co-op in New Brunswick NJ is seeking volunteers to join our cafe prep team. Volunteering just six hours per week will earn you a 25% discount on all products the Co-op sells. We'll schedule a shift time which fits your needs while still benefiting the Co-op. Applicants for this position are expected to be enthusiastic, trustworthy, and principled. You'd be challenged to find a more enjoyable work environment. Everyone working at the Co-op is here because they love it. See our Facebook page to get a sense of the buzz!
08901.title: Volunteer Cafe Worker

08901.description: To offer 1:1 assistance to boys and girls ages 3-10 years old who are participating in an adapted swim program. Having 1:1 volunteers with children promotes safety for children, encourages participants to feel comfortable in the water, and gives individual attention and encouragement to help each child do his or her best. You do not need any special training or certification. You must be 15 years old to volunteer.
08901.title: Swim Volunteers Needed

We’ve got a great team of enthusiastic workers, and we’re hoping to upgrade our facilities a bit to make working here more efficient and enjoyable. We’ll provide parts & materials, of course. 08901.title: Handyman

08901.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08901.title: Adult Mentoring

08903.description: Child Placement Review Boards review children that have been placed in out of home placements such as foster care or residential placements due to an abuse and neglect case that has been filed againt one or both parents. The boards receive information from the Department of Child Protection and Permanency fomerly the division of Youth and Family Services With the reading material and meeting with Foster parents, parents and any other interested parties they collectively make recommendations to the Judge as to what is best for the child. The recommendation is very helpful to the Judge in proceeding with the case and has an important impact on the families.
08903.title: Assist children in out of home placements become a Child Placement Review Board Volunteer
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage

08903.description: Juvenile Conference Committee Superior Court of NJ Middlesex County is seeking volunteers to become members of the the Juvenile Conference Committee. The Juvenile Conference Committee meets in the evening once a month. We would like citizens from the community to sit on this board as volunteers and help guide the children. They make recommendations to the Judge as to how the complaint should be handled within the community. The goals are to involve community members in the court process and to prevent young offenders from future delinquency. Child Placement Review Board Superior Court of NJ is seeking Middlesex County Residents to volunteers and become members of the Child Placement Review Board. There are two 45 day review boards located at 120 New Street in New Brunswick, Family Court House. Residents of Middlesex will monitor the cases of all children who are placed outside their home by the Division of Youth & Family Services. Review case files, discuss cases with team, and make recommendations. Division of Youth and Family Services (DFYS) workers are at the meetings to clarify any questions pertaining to the cases. The Volunteers in Probation Program is staffed with volunteers from the community who mentor adults on probation. Each volunteer will be assigned to supervise an adult on probation. You will meet once a week with the probationer to make sure they are fulfilling the requirements of their probation & to maintain regular contact with the supervising probation officer. Volunteers address issues in the court order that include employment,education and counseling. Only probationers with minor or non-violent offenses are allowed to participate in the program .
08903.title: VOLUNTEERS MAKE A DIFFERENCE
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage
